The service was also very professinal and attentive. However, sticking with an established approach to dining shouldn't mean not being attentive to quality, and I felt like for the price we spent, certain things (like my husband's salad and steak, as well as the pretty terrible rice pilaf and mashed potato sides) could have been brought into the 21st century or at least made more tasty!   As the dinner came to a close (we were there at 9 or so on a Tuesday night), we got to be parties to a very interesting conversation between a woman sitting at the bar and the *very* old-school bartender. She said that she had lived in Phoenix for 35 years but quickly moved to ranting about her daughter, who she claimed was "gorgeous," a part of the "happening Scottsdale crowd," and a former flame of Derek Jeter's! She even offered to bring her to Durant's and introduce her to the bartender. Wow, what a girl (if she does exist). This woman also had opinions on a variety of other subjects, including cell phone providers, and didn't stop talking during our entire main course.   This little dialogue (monologue?) made me realize something, though. Times change. Women who probably used to have meatloaf or roast with a baked potato and spinach for every meal are now sitting in restaurants talking about their daughters dating baseball stars and how bad their cell phone reception is indoors. I figure if they can get just a little bit "with it," so can Durant's. No major changes necessary - just a slight stepping back and re-evaluation of the menu to decide whether rice pilaf would be worth swapping out for a roasted asparagus. I'm not trying to be a traitor to a timeless institution or asking that it change its essential character - I just think that a few little tweaks here and there would keep the local population loyal and keep folks like me, who want really good food (part-way there) in an amazing environment with friendly service (check), coming back.

XzXHGDmzUX1oVGWXrIo9Hg.text: This was my 1st time at Durant's and I was expecting a top-notch restaurant from what others have said about the place.  The atmosphere is nice but the food and service are just so-so.  We ordered the clam appetizer, and we are the types who don't like a lot of added extras like sauce, seasonings, or cheese.  The clams were brought out smothered with cheese and tomatoes - yuck!  Neither the server or the menu said anything about this.  After sending it back twice we finally decided on mussels which were better.  The steak was so-so for the price we paid, had a lot of gristle. The chocolate cake dessert was the best part of the whole meal.  We left there feeling like we paid a lot of money for mediocre food & service. Many other steak houses in town are less expensive with better food quality.

e1UQEE2TV4PcIVtnkSx6cg.text: I recently stumbled across Durant's while I was downtown. This is quite a gem. I felt like I could have seen the characters of Goodfella's walk through the door at any minute.  The decor is classy, old and dark. Very vintage-classic steakhouse. Its refreshing to go to a restaurant and totally feel like your in another time. All the staff was nice, knowledgeable and attentive. The food is to die for.   Seeing as I only went there for lunch, I had a sandwich and sweet potato fries (which were the best I have ever had). Hopefully one day I can go back and try what they're famous for, steak!   I would 100% recommend this place for anything from an intimate date to a place to impress your boss.

uu3TYhrJ8LC66zdN_xfsfQ.text: It takes guts to be a steakhouse with a pink exterior, red velvet brocade wallpaper and an entrance through the kitchen. I give them five stars just for having the balls to pull that off -- and for being able to pull it off for nearly 60 years.   Yes, this place is a Phoenix landmark. Anything over 20 years is considered a landmark here, so this place is actually ancient by Phoenix standards. Although I've lived in Phoenix my entire 31 (almost 32) years, I never had the pleasure to dine at Durant's until about a year ago.  I came for a work dinner and was pleased to have had a great first experience.  My second experience at Durant's was for lunch. And this time, the experience was better than great, it was fantastic! I had the French Dip, which is one of my favorite sandwiches. I've tired them at many different places, and have found a few that were pretty decent.  But that was until I tried Durant's French Dip. Holy Cow!  The meat was so tender it literally melted in my mouth.  And there was plenty of it!  I seriously don't know how I managed to eat what I did.  It didn't look like that much, but man oh man, it was piled on there. And to add to the deliciousness of the French Dip, I got sweet potato fries.  Yowzer!  What a decadent meal. I needed a serious siesta afterward.  Both visits to Durant's were True culinary and mouthwatering pleasures. It is a little pricey for an all-the-time spot, but for a special occasion, it is definitely the place to go. Plus, it has got history and panache. And who the hell doesn't like both those things in a restaurant?!

ee0rlHknIoV-SHX3-I1Sxg.text: **This is a review of the bar only**  I am at least 15% cooler after having sipped on a vodka gimlet in the bar at Durant's.   Sure I smelled like steak after I left and felt weird about walking through the kitchen to get in and out. But for the hour I was there, I was felt cool as shit.  And my drink wasn't half bad either.

YEb8A1hFFHrbPfRpXT4RZw.text: We've been wanting to try this place for a long time. Have been to plenty of great steakhouses but want to support local businesses. It was a birthday celebration and although we were a bit shocked at the sticker price that was not an issue. However, we sat for 10-12 minutes and the only acknowledgement we received was water delivered to the table. We saw a server tending to a large group but nothing to indicate he was our server. We expected a little better service and left. I would have said something to the host (who by the way was very nice and addressed me by name) but he was not at the stand. Sorry to give it such a low score.  I'm sure their food is great according to the reviews ... maybe another time but like I said there are other great steakhouses to choose from.

iaUXh0LH5fOCXShPNgKciQ.text: I have traveled to many states within the United States and have never felt discriminated against like I did here. I'm not sure if it was because we were younger than the average crowd, Hispanic, or because they were homophobic. One waiter (Cory) asked us not to use our phone in the restaurant, but yet everyone else around us was using their phones. Did I mention he wasn't even our waiter? I have never felt this disrespected. This restaurant isn't cheap and we paid about $60-70 per person (the same as everyone else). It's not like we had a groupon or some type of freebie . The manager offered us a discount on our bill, but that wasn't enough to erase the embarrassment that we had just felt. The food isn't even that great people! We ate about a tenth of our food and basically told them to keep their leftovers!   Too bad we can't rate zero stars because that's what I would do!

vGJDarrpih1xHEo0JC-eXw.text: My 3rd time here now and it just gets better! Last night the prime rib was so seasoned, tender and delicious... The best prime rib in town! The atmosphere is very nostalgic and cool. They are very organized and the service was great from Lonnie. We enjoyed a bottle of Stags Leap from their extensive wine list and had a great evening with no room for dessert? The garlic mashed potatoes were my treat.

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Fm1YyXMVSz7xFP4tXhM-LQ.text: This is my very favorite restaurant in the world for celebrations. I wanted to get married here, but they were closed for a small kitchen fire on our wedding day.  So instead we celebrate our anniversary here every year. We celebrate everything here - with a Martini and Debris. If we are felling it we get Oysters Rockefeller.  The bar is the place to be. I love the barkeeps and have actually seen them about town eating and enjoying our other favorite places. The bartenders actually know us - having gone here for over 10 years while dating and entertaining clients, and now with my husband. My son texts me when he hears we are out at Durant's and begs for his favorite, the mashed potatoes.  You will feel like you walked back in time when you enter through the kitchen and get welcomed warmly by everyone. The service is incredible - the way I remember as a kid. HIT THE BATHROOM! It's a must to lounge in the ladies lounge. ENJOY!

ROLnPyi0DHX2wI3NBgPcRw.text: YUM....the bread at the beginning is amazing!!

EV4n6-suXDqiRTWitzs-cg.text: Classy joint!  Service is always great.  Food is always done right.  Only thing I'd knock was their old fashioned - made in a very 80s way with muddled fruit and a sugar packet - but I won't punish em for it! Highly recommend to anyone.  Better than all the flashy steakhouses out there.

uhRTrekLnbPP4KZiFy8GKw.text: Excellent Service. Casual atmosphere. Waiter and busboys  good.Steak Number one: a Bone In Rib Eye was slightly over to overcooked and dry. The waiter promptly exchanged it for a different cut and brought it to us better cooked but still the steak was dry.  For the same price steak I would have and should have gone to Steak 44. Although this is a Phoenix Institution, it only lives up to service but not to the quality of steak

ZC699aZTYMvSGCiWFNIxaQ.text: Great classic Steakhouse straight out of the Bugsy Siegel days.  Loved the vibe, great service professional staff and beautiful plate settings. I ordered the Delmonico with garlic mash potato and Roquefort dressing salad.  Everything was amazing with one small hitch.  I got a tuff steak. Strips are normally a more firm steak, but this happens to have much grissel and looked like the end cut.   It was ordered and served medium rare. I want to stress that the steak was obviously an exception and I am certain that it was just bad luck. The server offered to replace it but I had eaten half so I didn't feel it would be fair.  The manager discounted my ticket, and offered everything right to fix the issue. They were great.  I will definitely being giving Durant's a second try.  You should too! Unfortunately this time I can only give 4 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ccaoZ4jXMiECaaefJ-05Fw.text: My food was delicious as usual.  I didn't have much of an appetite so, I had the oysters Rockefeller with a house salad and a glass of Malbec.  Always great service!

W8PewaQozn4m2zxVrSejcA.text: Food was great. Steak well prepared. Plate could have been a bit hotter. The salad dressings are all hand made and delicious. Steaks come with a salad or soup and a side dish, which is not the case in most steak houses. Wine selection is great.  The bar is a little either to comfy to hang but not as much to each. Have these cushion that I can't decide if I love or hate.  Overall is very good but a tad overpriced. PS: I LOVE the going thru the kitchen thing!

yb9iA7Q_0_Azcq7cfV9HQw.text: Went on a Monday 6pm. Very mediocre .   First the ol'fashion wasn't correct. Regular ice, a watered layer from the ice ( regular soda ice, not the highball whiskey,  Also, I don't believe a high quality liquor was used. An place like this should k oo how important the drinks are.  Service was horrible, trying to catch a water was a mission.    Salad entree was half full. Took allot to get it on the fork and get a good real bite. Just not a full bowl, more like sprinkled.  Bread was day old hard, but great oil mixture.  Menu needs an updating,  very limited and non culinary. Doesnt seem changed in some time, which is sad. Arizona has many steak houses that push the envelope now..   Steak and potatoes where great. Sadly, the sides are all starch.  No fresh veggies etc. You have to pay extra for them.  If looking for a high end steak house..this isn't it. About 80 per person, I expect better.

Z7jblw4lXBIneg28smYM5A.text: Durant's is a classic, and I think serves the best steak in Arizona. The service here is highly professional--Greg and Jet have been my waiters during my visits over the last year, and are impeccable. I almost always order a Basil Hayden Manhattan, up, as these bartenders know what they are doing. Then it's usually a chicken liver appetizer, or oysters, or stone crab. On my salad, I just discovered the French garlic dressing, and that is my new favorite. Split a steak with my companion, and save room for dessert. I love the old school vibe of this place, and recommend it to visitors and locals alike.

a0XK7f3xYgyLZ8O3QMCWBQ.text: The place for red tufted leather and old style bartenders and table cloths.   The feel of back room deals and political appointments in the making

Ec6tAI93uM41IJBJjlgIoQ.text: Def a go to place & usually very predictable. Food & decor is old school and very much a part of Phx history. Recommended. Ps last time I went the bone in ribeye was a little too marbled but management took care of along w/dessert. More restaurants should be more old school...

bPr_E4ciRbsv2KkgCeTZ7Q.text: Exceptional service! Fun location and all of the food was unremarkable. Greg was our server and he was so knowledgeable of the entire menu, he really tied the experience together!!

bN-jFnjctIP5C1IXKeLFZg.text: This place isn't what it used to be! Feels like this restaurant used to be upscale and worth every penny but now it feels run down, old and over priced.   Haven't been here for awhile but decided to take my mom out for her birthday and go back to what we thought was still a really high end spot, considering it stills says ($$$) and dress code says dressy and there were more good/okay vs. bad recent reviews.  Dress code was not dressy! We saw people VERY CASUAL, saw people with basketball shorts, flip flops, t-shirts, jeans, ball caps. Which is fine, but not what we remembered for a high end restaurant.  Food was good, not excellent. Overall we didn't feel it was worth the high end price. We got a spinach and artichoke app which was enough for 4. Prime rib, the bone-in rib eye, top sirloin, and clam linguini w/ white sauce and a free desert for my mom's birthday which were all good! Total came out to $307 after tip.  Overall experience was okay but the price does not match/make sense for what the dress code is, the quality of food and overall experience.

DytLSW1osESax8two1eP0g.text: I feel like I'm almost wasting my time writing this review because Durant's is an institution it this town. This place is classic old school ice in the urinals, black vest, tux shirt, and tie type of place. You expect Frank Sinatra and The Don to be sitting in one of the round oxblood red booths. I'm almost looking for the old bullet holes in the red textured velour wallpaper. Best seafood and steaks you'll ever get in this town. The service is always impeccable. If you want a cool experience park in back and go through the back door. You go right through the kitchen and the back of the house welcomes you. They got nothing to hide here and they know it. I promise you won't be disappointed. When I stay in Phoenix my main criteria for a hotel is how close it is to Durant's

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

KLZ9U98CL1_nFniSsZTPHg.text: Service at lunch is really awful. It takes so long and the waitress is uninterested and never comes by to ask if you need anything. I had to flag someone down each time when I needed something like water or the check after sitting there forever. Good thing I didn't want a dessert, that would've never happened.  It's one of those waitresses that have probably worked there forever and thinks she owns the place - but doesn't. I was surprised to see how packed this place was at lunch on a weekday, and my girlfriend and I kept commenting on how long it was taking tables around us to get their food.  Ours came at a reasonable time but seriously every other table was waiting FOREVER. I know it's a nicer restaurant but it's still lunch and the patrons were visibly on a lunch break. It's still a 4 Star review because my Salmon with Mango glaze with mashed potatoes and veggies were very good. The Cesar salad was not good.  I also like the ambiance in there and the restaurant used to be an old mob hangout. I mean come on, that's pretty cool.  I'd go back for dinner but would request a different waitress if I got stuck with the same one again.

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lunch menu Salmon with mango glaze, mashed potatoes and veggies $49.50
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lunch menu Steak salad

5AiU7JaN5jLbL31j70KO3Q.text: Food was very good, service was excellent, atmosphere was classic 50's steakhouse but very noisy. Hard to hold a conversation. Food was overpriced making a great visit but not a great value.

XzOw_oaFv_SSZ7B35Mq1wg.text: Durant's is a place for special occasions or for fun with friends. The place was packed and Durant's  has been around for 50 years.  I have been there a few times over the years and it's remained the same. The deep velvety red wallpaper and perfectly dimmed lighting make it a wonderful place to enjoy an unbelievably good meal. I got the chicken and was shocked at how good it was. Sacrilege I know. I couldn't make myself  forgo the sticker shock of what I would have chosen (I'm sure similar restaurants charge the same). Yikes, that's sad. Loved the amazing waitstaff who are unobtrusive. And, the waiter didn't make me uncomfortable by having me test the wine first (very intuitive). The owner/manager was the one who asked how everything was. They are old school in that they leave everyone's plate on the table until the last person is finished. You are free to take your time without feeling rushed. We did laugh when our waiter asked if we were done with our dessert. Um. The only way we wouldn't have been done was to lick the raspberry off the plate and none of us are five ;). But, that was his way of letting us know we should take our time.   Our son got there before us and said he had a hard time finding the front door. I didn't know there was one. Do not use it. Going through the kitchen sets the stage. Everyone greets you almost like you're a regular. You can't help but think of all the business and government deals have been made. Plus, surely the mom ate there back in the day.  I almost don't want to say this so please don't only read this part, but for the love of God, get rid of the tv!! It's not a sports bar and if you can't go without tv for a few hours, go elsewhere. Unfortunately, the tv was a distraction and I did have to focus on the table. Had my ADHD husband been facing the tv, no amount of medication could have kept his eyes from the shiny thing on the wall. He doesn't even watch sports.   Anyway, it's a must. Maybe the other side doesn't have a tv. I'd certainly ask. Go!

OXKdWgOF1L2agA8wjCfKCw.text: What a let down.   Such high recommendations from friends.   I liked the idea of the atmosphere and old style.  So walking in it was automatically a 10.  Wine list was good.   Steaks were TERRIBLE   Poor quality all 3 steaks were cooked improperly    Burnt wouldn't describe it correctly.    Burnt so far from any taste and determination of the type of steak would be closer.  Manager was not helpful.   Sever was very nice and sincerely concerned of our experience    Waiting on deserts next.   Hope they are at least the reason to possibly come back.   Will do another tip with the result   Bottom line.  Any steak place is better than Durants   Keep looking on the huge list of options in Phoenix

67IeBSAp-sDXUWfWEZDW-Q.text: Style, ambiance, and great food make Durant's the landmark that it is. From the moment you walk in through the kitchen you can tell there is something different about this place. You are immediately assaulted by the smells of the delicious food being prepared and greeted warmly by the kitchen staff.

yYjBDDOxI_3kHJIJ5WO_7A.text: Fantastic! Went there for a special occasion and it is worth every penny! Free valet (be sure to tip though), enter through the kitchen, check in, be seated, and indulge!  Staff were all very friendly and attentive. The menu had a little bit of everything. You get a small crudites plate and a bread sitting in a buttery onion "sauce". Our waitress made excellent recommendations. The meal was cooked perfectly, the quality of meat was excellent, the portions are generous! Wonderful experience all around. Looking forward to a return visit.

Zizqy9FYRGCIGmyl_dNifw.text: Durant's is the epitome of excellent food and fine dining.  I challenge any business to out do Durant's.   I admit the location is not very desirable but once you enter the door you are treated like royalty. The waiter was ridiculous in his explanation of the food.  His accent was cool.  Probably French.  The decor was dated but excellent in my opinion.  Durant's is a legacy.  I encourage everyone to relish in this piece of history. Just savor the experience

h9RWWbxeau15g0lPL4urXA.text: We came just for a drink. Upscale traditional. My husband had a Manhatten and he said that their martinis are great there also. It seems like a business crowd getting off work. My husband, a previous local, said that their steaks are famous.  They were beautifully decorated for Christmas. We walked in the back door which goes right through the kitchen and everything was spotless. It was the perfect atmosphere for a drink after work.

thY2-fLQePPzWy6jhwbMlQ.text: What can you say other than the best restaurant in Phoenix for 50 plus years. John the bartender was solid as always.

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

LKD151xjUFJby1TgCw0uiw.text: Phoenix classic! I took a client here from out of town, and they loved it. It's like stepping into the seventies and that includes the quality of food and service. They will cater to any women and the pricing is fantastic for what you get. This is definitely a place that I will frequent more often when the occasion calls for it.

CU9xIRCEsMiGXRuJSIIWQA.text: For many years we have been enjoying this restaurant every time we came in. The last few times food quality was still good but prices started going through the roof.  The last time I was there, I ordered the ground steak.  It was very tough and I had trouble sawing it.  Chewing was a challenge but the flavor was pretty good.  That was $20 for a hamburger patty and veggies.  How in the world do you make ground beef so tough you can't chew or cut it??  Service was very slow too.  Our server seemed to have gone missing for 20 minutes at a time and when she emerged she walked slow and casual.  It took 2 hours to get through lunch.  I don't think I can do this again.

ohlsAvlPIvvQOXFAZEbUuw.text: Impeccable service! The waitstaff were pleasant. Riccardo was our server and he was EXCELLENT! Nice, quiet ambience too.   When we arrived (on a Thursday evening), the bar area was super crowded. We were seated in a cozy booth. We started with the chicken livers with cocktail sauce (a wonderful recommendation by Riccardo). I opted for the chicken Marsala with rice pilaf and Mister choose the scallops with mashed potatoes. We shared our meals. Both entrees were prepared to perfection! Mister talked about how delicious the meal was HOURS later!  Durant's will definitely be a place we frequent!

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Marsala and rice pilaf
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Scallops and mashed potatoes

g39Bo9qUEHzZbbnxMmFsGw.text: Another solid & delicious dinner!  My mom and I are back- we were seeing a show in Tempe so we came in for an early lunch.  Tempe is seriously lacking in decent steakhouses so lucky for Durants.  We came in around 4:10 pm and requested a bar table- unfortunately they were reserved.  We sat in a dining room booth, boring atmosphere at that time of day.  Would seem a tiny bit crowded if it were full.  I was in the mood for a margarita, as usual, and my mom got wine.  It wasn't the best I've had but obviously from fresh lime.  Nice to see our server bring the wine bottle out & pour a sip before committing to the wine.   The crudites and bread are solid starters and we were bad and got 1/2 order of onion rings to start. They were nice and hot and crispy- everything we were hoping for!  For salads my mom had the house and I had the wedge which was delicious!  They are generous with toppings and the lettuce is nice and cold.  For entrees we tried a 16 oz T-bone.   It wasordered it medium well though it arrived more medium than she prefers.  Our server came back to check at the perfect time and quickly replaced the steak with a perfect medium well T-bone with new potato.  So many restaurants would bring the same potato or left the potato when they took the steak.  Small things make a difference!  My Kobe sliders were yummy on pretzel buns with Caramelized onions and a horseradish mustard.  If I get them again I would get the mustard on the side.  It was still really yummy but very mustardy.  I had a recommended Cabernet Sauvignon that went great with this & ended up being on the happy hour.  Thank you to our server again for not trying to bring a $16 glass of wine when a comparable one is on happy hour!   We were way too full for dessert but reminisced about the delicious creamy New York cheesecake.  I get the impression this place really understands customer loyalty and what customers value.  Thank you Durants for another delicious, comfortable, and fun meal for my mom and me!

tlbmS4iFoc9mhd8KFDFCDw.text: Food and scenery was great! I would highly recommend this for date night and feel free to dress. The staff was all great and did what they could to make our night perfect!

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

J__AXSiRqmJYgGOVa71b3A.text: Durants is an excellent steakhouse, the atmosphere, the service, and even the old school walk through the kitchen is top quality, And if you like to avoid the couple that couldn't find a babysitter for their kid ,this is the place to be. I get so annoyed when I go to classy restaurant, and low class people bring their kids, this is a group of etiquette people,

3IEJxcDMRtuMc70H_y4bqg.text: New to yelp but thought I would chime in and say this is my favorite place to eat at! My husband and I are regulars here on weekends! Do yourself a favor and try this place out!! -LB

BUyvsUeLhZYjPmqr7PIh9w.text: I think if Frank Sinatra had to have a place to hang out and have a good steak, this would be it.  Love the back entrance.  Feels so New York.  Service is always impeccable.  Price is high but so worth it.  I never get anything else but the filet mignon every time.    Reservations are a must.   I just wish they would dust more.

yuWLVquPMoNrTBYfLhFoPQ.text: Love the ambiance  You walk in through the kitchen for a True steakhouse dining experience which is awesome and one of a kind! The food is to die for from the steaks to the catfish! Love it so much. Definitely a staple for Arizona.

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 8oz filet with waffle cut fries

Vqqby1olyCUWQdFfc8z5LQ.text: First visit:  Classic, old school steak & chop house. Entry is through the kitchen. Glad I knew that ahead of time or I would have thought I walked in the wrong way. Obviously nothing to hide. Immediately greeted by staff.  Bar takes pride in their martinis. They did not disappoint..  Our party of 4 was seated promptly at reserved time. Server was friendly. Decor is red felt wall paper and dark wood. Like I said, classic. Waiters in white shirts & black slacks.  Appetizers were solid: Raw oysters on the half shell, crudites, crabcake, spinach-artichoke dip.  Service was OK.  It was Saturday night and they were out of the pork chop. Unacceptable. Then the ribeye I received was incredibly tough. Very disappointing.  I'd give this place another shot if someone else wanted to take me, but I wouldn't go on my own.

W0Bt4IhQHffGxr_u689mLw.text: You get what you pay for. Great service. Check out the photos to get an idea of how cool the atmosphere is.

vuwDFUyht773tXNpTtOsuA.text: If you are looking for a fabulous steak in a historic Phoenix restaurant, this is the winner. Excellent beef and always top-notch service. I've never had a waiter who doesn't know the menu inside and out.   Was there for our first anniversary and they were very sweet and attentive. They surprised us with a complementary strawberry cheesecake.   Relive a bygone gangsta era of rich mahogany, leather booths, cut velvet wallpaper, walking in through the kitchen, and strong martinis.

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bone-in ribeye. This is living!
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Small prime rib and &#34;atomic horseradish.&#34;

5JQ4Fx7DBT6Pp51CSfZJXg.text: Durants is a great option for a nice dinner or to celebrate a special occasion. I have to say that I enjoyed the look and vibe of this old school, romantic, mobster-ish joint a tad more than I enjoyed the actual food.  Had to go with the prime rib, which was good and large so come with an appetite!  You definitely want to make a reservation but luckily I was able to get in same day (during spring training) So that was much appreciated.   Tip-have a martini!

qXIqQ6NYDEFJebJrxJ_o2Q.text: Can anyone say, Goodfellas?? We entered from the back and walked through the kitchen...same era, right? I think a lot of people feel this way walking through there. It's funny and a cool experience. Anyhow, the place is inviting and on the older side, along with the decor, the lighting is dim and dark, but it all just adds to the charm. Don't let it scare you. The staff is always friendly.   The food was excellent. I had steak, made to perfection, med-rare, drinks were good too. I would definitely go back. It is a bit pricey but well worth it.

ugfQZ7oLVpOiJWFy6a4ibA.text: I learned about Durants from Yelp while on a business trip to Phoenix. The rave reviews are True: Yes you walk through the kitchen; and there is velvet on the walls, etc. Great ambiance.  The food was outstanding. I had the rib-eye steak. Service was great too. Bottom line, my wife joined me later in the week and we went to Durants again!

wGdQq5yokmYViBpEq742EQ.text: Well they have done it again!  Durant's is the coolest steakhouse in Phoenix.  Let's start with entering through the kitchen, YES I know everyone talks about it but, I love that the staff greets you like you are a regular even if you are not. Next the red velvet walls, the booths, the low lighting, the old school photos, and an actual phone booth, all fling you back to the 50's when the place opened and when people dressed up for dinner.  Oh and the bar! That full length bar with rounded ends and the huge padded arm rest that always makes me think that after my meal I could take a quick nap before dessert.  The bar is actually where I prefer to eat dinner.  Don't roll your eyes until you try it.  On to the food.  I am not one to tell someone what steak they should choose, so let's just say they are all great.  What I am good at is telling people is what the must have items are on the menu.  On the top of my list are the onion rings.  These are the best onion rings on the planet and yes I have gone there just for those and drinks.  The stone crab is a must (if it is even available on the night you go) Oh and of course save room for the strawberry shortcake I mean it!  One last thought.  If you appreciate a great cocktail, and I mean cocktail (Manhattan, Old Fashioned, Martini etc.) that is made correctly with the right amount of each ingredient and has the correct garnish this is your place for happy hour!

cOMuGADffW9zcL4TWfP_YA.text: Durant's, I wanted to like you. I really did. I'm a huge fan of steakhouses, particularly ones with as much character as you clearly do. But what you did to my $51 bone-in ribeye was too unspeakable to allow me to recommend this place to anyone. But I'm getting ahead of myself.  I was able to get past the fact that the server looked like a mix between an airport bartender and a blackjack dealer at a casino on an indian reservation. In fact, I kind of appreciated it as sort of a promising omen of the character and history I expected from the esteemed Durant's Steakhouse of Phoenix. Surely this veteran of the steakhouse circuit would have her routine polished and provide a truly memorable experience.  Sadly, I was mistaken. She could barely answer simple questions about the cuts of meat coherently. She was slow and inattentive, and got our appetizer orders wrong.  OK, I can get past that. Just having a bad day right? Well here comes my delicious bone in ribeye, mesquite grilled to precisely the "just barely medium rare" specifications I had so politely and clearly requested.  Wrong again. Perhaps near the bone was an area of steak that one could charitably label "medium rare." most of it was much closer to medium and the periphery approached carbonization. In fact, I could not finish it (a first for me). Sadly, by the time our server reappeared to ask how everything was, I was no longer hungry. Of  course, she expressed remorse and offered to make it right (bringing the table a complementary order of passable strawberry shortcake), but it was going to take more than strawberry preserves, poundcake and whipped cream to get the taste of charcoal out of my mouth.  If you want excellent steak, as much as it pains me to say it, stick with Ruths Chris or Mastro's. If you want Old Phoenix flavor and are OK with rolling the dice with your meat preparation, give Durant's a shot.

wbpPy64k3UhWeqwBmTdXew.text: Okay, if you've not visited this Valley institution by now I don't understand what you're waiting for.  Go now, really-put down your mouse, shut off your computer and GO! It's certainly the old school aspect that adds to their appeal, for once you get taken back to a by-gone era with the red velvet and killer cocktails, good steaks.  Are they the BEST EVER steaks?  No, those are cooked up by me at home but Durant's are pretty dang good.

rPXm3j4DKyJSeWEbx72TTg.text: Five stars, five 1st  star Culinary excellence, 2nd star Service perfection 3rd star Atmosphere and history 4th star flawless operation  5th star dessert -1 star, management need not say more.,    Old School Style fine dinning.  This restaurant dates way back to the early days of downtown Phoenix.

Y4QGqjDxS3OUssWzLg2nKQ.text: Steak was gooodddd..... as was the banana cream pie that I had for dessert - I am a sucker for banana-themed sweets - that is 3 stars right there...... however, I was NOT a fan of the caesar salad - it was spicy - where did that come from??   Also, this place is a little weird - very old-skool, in a weird part of Phoenix (the building from the outside is a trip - looks like a cross between a bowling alley and a strip club), and the service just felt a little bit awkward to me.  Maybe I am just so used to places with a more casual, modern vibe.  We had a good meal here, but I don't know if I'd come back or not.  I know it's a chain, but Ruth's Chris is more my kind of place, and I think the steak is better....plus i like the Biltmore area much better than this area (I don't even know what this 'hood is called - central phoenix?)

VT1-av23vIZaex0feByYeg.text: I met my husband at Durant's after work recently.  The bar was filled with downtown Phoenix professionals enjoying cocktails after work.  The only problem is that it was just before the smoking ban hit, so people were furiously puffing away while they could.  Durant's is a very nice expense account type place, so it was nice to see that you could also eat dinner at the bar, which several people were doing.  I was dressed casually so I felt a little out of place.  But it was totally self induced.  We didn't have a reservation but they were able to seat us in a cozy booth fairly quickly.    We started with Durant's Debris (my husband raved about it so I had to try it; it's bits of steak) and a Shrimp cocktail.  The seafood here is amazing, so don't feel you MUST order a steak.    For dinner I had the shrimp and crab louis salad.  Delicious and VERY generous portion.  We didn't make it to dessert because we were stuffed from dinner.  You might skip the appetizer if you want to have any hope...or share one.    One other funny thing.  If you use the valet parking, you enter the restaurant through the kitchen, a la Goodfellas.  There's a refrigerator on your left as you enter where they have one of their famous massive Porter House steaks.  It's huge, like 50 ounces.  It's the ultimate place to indulge.

TynJOD7bQLyKY-bBd7g-TQ.text: Being in Durant's reminds me of being a bit actor in a movie remake of some 1950s cult classic.  Like oceans 11.  The original had Sinatra and Martin and Davis, Jr and Bishop.    The remake had Clooney and Pitt and Damon and Garcia.  And although the 2001 version was pretty good, maybe even VERY good, something about it seems disingenuous.    But when we talk about the cool-factor of the 1960s "11", there is no denying that the film makes you feel like you're walking around like your number one.  Well, translate that into this dusty steak joint, that has somehow passed its prime and now seems like a poor remake of its former (classic) self.  Their food has sadly nose-dived into average, while their prices have sharply risen like a Vegas hotel room on a holiday weekend.  I only feel marginally dapper drinking in here.  Sure the bartenders are cool and quite aware, but the setting is dank and I feel like I'm drinking in an 80s mob bar that is trying to thematically play homage to a 20s speakeasy.    Where once THIS was the steakhouse that others (even chains -- heya Bucco di Beppo) tried to emulate, everything just seems to have spindled out of order.  Its trying hard to work, but it just doesn't.  I'm also aware that they are under new mgmt and have changed some staples on the menu.  We shall see if they will return.  For now, I'm just going to stick to drinking the occasional scotch at the bar before moving on to Capital Grille or City Hall.

vmauHi_8qwJ45mXa0V_jkA.text: Trust the positive reviews...   This place is like no other.   When I travel for work to Phoenix, this is the first place I think about whether I get there or not.  I've been going here since 1988.  During the right time of the year they fly in stone crabs.    You are not a True Arizonian if you haven't been here.....  What an institution....  I wish I had this place in Los Angeles.....

Wsi5EAAK0FurYHKOIkUU3g.text: Steak and Martini! It's a perfect combination! This is the best place for lovers who want to spend quality time with each other. I've always been here with my best friend, boy friend and now my husband! They have a good ambiance and everything is perfect!

x91aXGJFosx90LMIwEbFaw.text: We hadn't been to Durants in probably 5 years.  We decided to go over our staple steakhouses Mastro's and Flemings.  It was a disappointment over our standards.  The "garlic" bread was drowning in oil.  The taste was great just way too much oil. We had to send back both entree's Steak prepared Rare instead of Medium Rare, and Halibut served raw in the middle. To compensate the did give me a comp glass of wine, and my husband a dessert, however he didn't get to choose the dessert, which was quite disappointing, since I had my heart sent on sharing the trio of creme brulee and we got cheesecake which I didn't care for.    Overall the food is good.  But not at these price point when there are much better establishments.  Durant's is a good for the old time atmosphere and for being nostalgic.

fhI6cXJ8mikJbjS5quCRSA.text: We recently celebrated an anniversary at Durant's, and I still swear by it.  Best steak in Phoenix, +1 star for atmosphere, +1 star for service (top notch all the way around).  +1 for the meat, oh so good.  +1 for the bar.  Can I just go ahead and give it 10 stars?  It is, indeed, as good as it gets!  The ribeye is just fantastic.

56b8B9Y0uZ4BdA3VQ8wtRQ.text: Durant's has that old, musty, dark, Mafia feel. Love the atmosphere and allure. We mainly sit at the bar, but have dined in. The happy hour specials are good, and we have tossed a few back here having great talks and enjoying the ambiance. Now for the bad: The food is overpriced for it's quality. The steaks look fatty, the salads wilted, and flavor pretty bland. It would probably be okay if we weren't looking at 20 plus dollars per entree. Back in the day, Durant's was very high end and elite, so I could see the pricing from that perspective. However, if they want to stay in the game, they need to keep the food up to par as well.  5 stars plus for ambiance, relaxation, a throw back feel, and great drinks! 1 star for food and food prices.  However, a major landmark in Phoenix, so please check it out! We never know how long these staples will be around. I would just recommend going for drinks and maybe split an appetizer. It does ignite the "romantic mood" and will leave you reflecting on those "good old days".

u_WZavcZZXyBT4TOrzgwuA.text: Beautiful atmosphere, prime rib was fantastic! Don't pass up the garlic mashed potatoes...negative thing...so noisy we had to repeat our orders to the waiter several times, this resulted in getting the wrong, more expensive, bottle of wine. Hint check your receipt closely. Positive: they did make good on the mistake.

qA1MsMqtniwBMXvO6u1fdA.text: Been going here since i was a baby, love this place, food is top-notch as is the service. this place is a land mark and a most go to!!

Crvl2LbGfG3Ko9uqiN0PHg.text: I would have given Durant's a fifth star, except that the quality has declined in recent years and I must punish them for that.  Durant's is nonetheless a classic.  I miss the great times dining here with my grandfather when he was still around.  He could always point out the notable lawyers and politicos at dinner time, and I could tell that he enjoyed carrying on his tradition as much as I enjoyed playing a part in it.  What also used to be.... truly exceptional service!  It's still great, but I have the fondest memories of the last generation of wait staff.  They always recognized the regulars even if we hadn't been there for several months.  Likewise, they would often remember our regular orders.  This place practically defined classy dining for me as I was growing up, which is why I've always gone there for birthdays.  In more recent years, I admit I've been less loyal, although it appears that others are keeping them busy enough in the mean time.  But I recently learned a new way to enjoy Durant's on a budget.  A few weeks ago, I took some clients there for lunch and had yet another great experience.  The menu revolves around burgers at lunch time, which I wouldn't dream of ordering for dinner, but they are indeed tasty.  I think I will be back soon for another lunch, if not dinner and cocktails as well.

4kr3Qnv4-pztDaSnWVcRww.text: From beginning to the end, Durants was flawless.  No windows in the place, and red booths fill the room.  a large inviting bar, and old rat pack feel from the place.  If I could afford to dine here often I would be one fat and happy girl.

mP4PbP3zcgDtAWPNNd5sww.text: We went for NYE 2011. Good night, place was packed, and yet they managed to get us in right when our reservation was.   Food was, as always, amazing. Best steak house in Phoenix.   Would have gone 5 stars, but the service was a bit off this time, which was a first. We sat for about 30 minutes before even ordering drinks, which is unusual. I'm just gonna chock that up to it being a super busy night and the server being over run.   I'd absolutely go back. As soon as possible. Anyone want to take me to lunch to hear my pointless opinions on things?

lq_A8j91J8OEQRxBk-_hrg.text: Went here for New Years Eve. My in-laws loved this place because of the old school kitchen entrance.  I however thought it was weird and I'm sure there is a reason for it to be considered old school. The entrance does make you feel welcome but to me it's a recipe for a health concern with so much traffic through the kitchen. The food was just ok. It was not anything that impressed me but once again the in-laws liked it. I have to give it 4 stars because my party did like the food and it is a different kind of restaurant. Also I didn't have a steak that night so maybe it was just what I ordered that I didn't like.

Ti1mzb0kYxrApB1kNs1uAQ.text: I love love love Durants. I feel like I'm back in the 50's, eating steak with the likes of Sinatra and Sammy Davis Jr. I love the ambiance, it's super cozy and comfy. They've got these great leather booths, cool old school portraits, and waiters in little tuxedos. I also love the fact that you can enter through the kitchen, giving you that goodfellas vibe when they walk through the kitchen of the copa.  There's a fantastic wine and booze selection (of course, the first thing I look for) and FANTASTIC food. For starters, the waiter will bring you a little plate of fresh veggies and this amazing bread with a garlic herb topping. Then, I totally suggest getting the mushrooms as a side. They are awesome, in this cream sauce that is indescribable. I always get the filet (medium rare) with the garlic mashed potatoes.  LOVE IT!! really good place for a date, a small party, or just a fanciful dinner. Did i say that i LOVE IT??? It is kind of expensive, but completely worth the price. You are guaranteed to leave satisfied.

GwUlasyGs3FelUo3i0zPsw.text: I've dined here a dozen times over the last few years and always a great experience.  Good cocktails, great steaks, and perfect atmosphere.  Be sure to get the sauteed mushrooms.  Can't wait to go back.

cE6V7AEf1S6YE6gcG8LwHA.text: Took the bf here for a very special milestone birthday. It was his first visit and my second, but has been several years for me. Had a drink at the bar while we waited a few minutes for a table. No, make that had a perfect, delicious, wish-I-could-replicate-that-at-home martini! We were seated by a gracious hostess, unfortunately it was a teeny tiny booth and the bf is super-tall so he was a little squished. Our server was all around wonderful, the Oysters Rockefeller amazing, and our steaks cooked to perfection. The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because of the sommelier. Our server sent him over to assist us, and his disheveled appearance kind of turned me off right away. However, it was his total lack of enthusiasm that really got to me. He didn't seem interested in helping us at all, he barely spoke two sentences to us. Our server seemed more knowledgeable and was much more helpful, thank goodness! Overall, a wonderful dinner and will return for future special occasions.

xDFiKsUD79GxFRQj9Azq6g.text: Durants, you are truly amazing. When I come to dine, I want to be my best-dressed, wittiest self I can be, because dining at Durants is an event deserving of the best. Be on your A-game because Durants is all A game.  First, coming through the kitchen never gets old, no getting around it, you feel like you're part of a very cool club and the vibe just continues as you approach the hostess. Every time, she always acts like she had been waiting for me and my party all night. Then there is the decor.  It's better in person just go see it. Finally, the best thing about Durants is the food. The sides of spinach, potatoes are incredible but the steaks are what makes Durants so amazing. Truly incredible. Channel your inner Marilyn, grab your best man an have a meal that sends you to the moon.

6JdzJO1FqpYoiBJ-OT8BZA.text: I am sad to say that Durant's is off my list permanently. This is the second time in recent months that not only were staff rude and lazy but the food was lousy. At times, the wait staff seemed to be more concerned with the party in the bar than the patrons. As a longtime Phoenix resident, Durant's USED to be the only place to go.   There are many other dining establishments that deserve the kind of money that we have paid to Durant's.   Unfortunately, I will not be back.

81maIVKkLiJFpqU-bRkTzA.text: Durant's is a classic steakhouse that maintains its 1950's charm and atmosphere while server wonderful food.  I was in Phoenix for business and went to Durant's looking for a good steak and a restaurant with character.  I was not disappointed.    The 50s are alive in the restaurant with the red upholstered booths and the red velvet looking walls.  Portraits and paintings line the booths.  The staff is friendly and knowledgeable and the wine list if top notch.  You can't get a better filet.  5 stars

Guy8J1iCty27V-9KaNFV7Q.text: I'm going to qualify this review by saying that Durant's is an experience and definitely not for everybody. If budget is at all a factor, or if you're expecting Claim Jumper sized portions (or even a fifth of a Claim Jumper portion) this place is not for you. This place is classy, old-school. When you walk through the kitchen to get to the dinning room, you are going back in time. The place oozes with history, from the red leather upolstry to the lamps and carpet. Anyone who's read up on this place knows the history and famous actors who once graced Durant's with their presence. The servers are veterans, again old-school many East Coast. The menu has a lot of awesome selections but this is where the budget comes in as this is one of the highest priced menus I've seen in Phoenix. We're talking $125 MINIMUM per person if you're going to do dinner, apps and cocktails. Also, as I said your plate is not going to be piled with food. But I can honestly say the filet mignon I had was one of the best I've ever had:cooked perefectly and tender like nobody's business. I also have to point out that a good salad is included with your entree. Having lived in L.A. and gone to supper clubs like the Dal Rae, I have seen similar entrees priced lower. But as many such places ar ala carte, things balance out at Durant's since you're not paying extra for a salad. That is one thing the struck me straight off. So yes, you're going to pay a lot and you won't have to undo a notch in your belt when you leave. But in my opinion, the quality of food and the overall experience is worth the cost, especially if you want a really memorable place to go for a special occasion.

bE24J8mx08g7pfHvOOcUrQ.text: Durants ROCKS.  I love the red velvet walls. I love walking through the kitchen to get to the restaurant. I love the garlicky cheesy bread that probably has a million calories in it. I love the steaks. I love the decor. I love the bar.  We all ordered different items when we went here for dinner one night, and all raved about what we had.  I don't think you can go wrong, no matter what you order.  It's amazing, delicious, and very very unique.

-EFRM-mpxkg4aBVYnDbV0A.text: I've been coming here since I was a kid.If you want a top notch steak this is the place. You walk in through the kitchen like your in a MOB movie. Everything on the inside is covered in red. The prime rib is delicious and the filet is perfect.

FDlT7UkR7fl9zsXJiWYjlA.text: One of the BEST dining experiences...EVER!  Start with a martini and oysters. End with a chocolate martini and strawberry shortcake with fresh berries!

vH5zfF0ydQYIYvcS4x1bCQ.text: 1960, meet.... 1960.  Durant's has not departed from that era, and I'm glad it hasn't. From the entrance along the red carpet in the kitchen, to the velvet covered walls, high back red booths, and staff in tuxedos, you know you are in for a treat as soon as you walk in. Hell, even the line cooks will wave hi and bye to you.   Featured in the bar every afternoon is a killer happy hour, with half price domestic and well drinks. They typically draw a pretty good crowd that doesn't seem to let up until late in the evening. A lot of the clientele here is the well heeled group from Phoenix Country Club, Palmcroft, and other nicer neighborhoods. It's a diverse group from 20 somethings to the about to die blue hairs.   The honest truth, as others have said, is that you can find a better steak. I would barely put Durant's in the top 10 with stars like Donovan's, Mastro's, BLT, J&G, etc. But Durant's isn't all about the steak, it's about the experience, one every phoenician should encounter at least once in their lifetime. The owners aren't the least bit accommodating either, as they don't have to be. The restaurant fills up almost every night.   I still maintain that if it weren't for Durant's, a lot of people wouldn't even know what Central Avenue in Midtown looks like. I hear very often, oh, downtown, thats by Durant's right? Long live a Phoenix landmark.

1SIF0ItP67JswZqf2A66rw.text: Ok so entering through the kitchen was fantastic, I really like seeing 'behind the scenes' and the red velvet wallpaper was over the top 'mob' cool with the big comfortable booths and awards on the walls for all the folks that have eaten the 48oz steak! Holy cow!   I'm not a big steak eater but this was the BEST steak I've had in years. And i cant stop thinking about the garlic bread. Great wine selection and truly great service, you can't go wrong!   Just make sure you make reservations, they were fully booked.

01Bw6-YXSL1heR7qx8E-gQ.text: The red flocked wallpaper--the leather banquettes--the way you feel like a Goodfella when you walk in through the kitchen--you know you're at Durant's!  This is one of the bastions of Old Phoenix at its best--or maybe its worst, since a lot of the bad old days of corrupt city governance likely took place within Durant's walls. But since the staff is so discreet, we'll probably never know...  Now to the food: I really like the food, the wines, the service. I've had prime rib here and it was great prime rib. I've had lunch here and it was fab also...now if I could just get hubby to take me here sometime, I'll be a happy woman!

jL2tgasm1jTG9im-4_ze0Q.text: From start to finish, absolutely loved this place! Excellent food, excellent service. Can't wait to go back (which I hinted to my daughter would be a nice birthday present)! A bit pricey, but well worth it.

RTaeUn1V32Pcx2jaBeVoBQ.text: Does this place really need a review? I'm a Phoenix native and this has always been a premier place for dining. I love it. I love all of it. It's our special occasion place because it is expensive. Walking through the kitchen is a nice experience and the staff always greets us. They actually didn't have our reservation the last time we went for our anniversary but they sat us right away. A nice booth opened up after we were seated and they moved us. The service is impeccable and very detailed. I love the relish tray in the beginning. It's so old school. My husband says it's the best Old Fashioned in the Valley. The salad dressings are made in house. I don't really eat bleu cheese dressing but I always order it at Durants. The bread: how long can I go on about this bread? There's nothing like it! A nice, round bread mound drenched in melted butter, topped with a spinach artichoke schmootz served in a bowl? Unreal. I ordered the ribeye this last time instead of filet. So flavorful and juicy, perfectly cooked. I like to get the baked potato with my entree...served w/ butter, sour cream, and chives of course. Something about meat and a baked potato makes me think of my Dad who's passed and he always ordered baked with all the fixings. By this time we are wondering how we'll fit dessert in but we can't skip it! The creme brulee trio is the best and perfect for two to share. We always do cappuccinos and if we're taking a cab, Sambuca. And then we say night night. Always a top notch experience!

qMOrk_6gylcaPFoJI3tzzg.text: I rate it a three because although the crab Mac n cheese is fantastic, the prices are insane. $12 for a martini. Really?  The food isn't worth the prices.

rBGQOxXRDbDCkeJvzC32cA.text: I will definitely go again... Nothing like a good beef fillet and a slice of killer key lime pie...

G_ehL9WuK50RAeXxDVcxGQ.text: I've been going to Durant's for years and the nice thing about it is it does not change (they are celebrating their 60th).  Food and service is excellent.  If you're looking for great American food, this is the place, if you're looking for a light meal you will probably overeat here.

S4_lBJ9aChDHhcZxp5vFJw.text: Delicious food, excellent service, strong cocktails, and appropriate wine choices. I had the 8 oz filet with garlic mashed potatoes and spinach salad, with a side of asparagus. All dishes at our table were cooked perfectly, including the scallops (which can be so hit-or-miss sometimes). Our server was excellent as was her busser. Timing, knowledge of the food, personality, and wine recommendations were all spot-on. You get more than what you pay for at Durant's.

ZdFJCtS0gvMXv4uoe7vecQ.text: Outstanding! - I hit Durants again last night for the new date's birthday and Its going to be hard to think of a negative thing to say. Everything from the entrance to the decor and lighting  to the incredible food and wine was perfect. Shrimp cocktail, bisque, steaks and a great dessert..there is nothing else to say.

wcb2vZyQNFGc0UYemINxsw.text: Very cool old school steakhouse. Love the fact that you walk through the kitchen. Had the steamed clams appetizer and they were amazing. Also the bread is awesome. The steak was very good but I have had better at other steakhouses for the same price. Overall definitely would come back for the ambiance and food anytime I am in the Phoneix area.

1reDxrnLbpugVAqKavStfg.text: Delicious Steak.. medium plus done excellent. Dessert- Strawberry Shortcake was amazing  Old leather couches, no cellphones, just conversation

WHSKi-9BD8a73XBRMxCaEQ.text: Very sad.  As a customer for 25 years I suggest that Durants finds a new manager.  The Durants of the past is gone.  Don't waste your time.

CpnzR4fl9jBjF6T7Ez7T-w.text: Great food! Delicious, nice atmosphere,will definitely be back with friends! It's a long drive to come here  but it's so worth it. Wil be back to celebrate friends promotion

-s35WOlEmEFAIl8dzOeaFg.text: A wonderful meal at Durant's, as always. Definitely a special occasion restaurant that will leave you smiling, and the staff makes you feel like royalty. The atmosphere can't be beat, nor can the steaks and Caesar salad with extra anchovies. And I want to bury my face in the bread with garlic leek butter -- that stuff is truly magical.

szy-EdktvsKB1dVrDEsobA.text: Excellent experience, overall. Durant's is old-school dining at its finest. Staff was courteous, knowledgeable, and proud of the restaurant's long history. Host shook my hand and welcomed me and my wife as if we were the owners. T-bone steak was superb. Garlic mashed potatoes were creamy and dreamy. Raspberry cheesecake was the best I had tasted in two years. Wife and I were treated like king and queen. If you are looking for a unique central Phoenix dining out, please treat yourself to Durant's.

an4Z8qzt961Az19v46Biqg.text: A few years ago, I let one tiny misstep tarnish my impression of Durant's. Fortunately, I went back. A few times. A dinner with a dear friend - service was impeccable, the food was fantastic, and the timing was right - I finally got one of the dessert chips I've been wanting for so many years. I've also been back for lunch - and everything was spot on - and I got to take advantage of my chip!  I don't know that it's worth reviewing the food - I don't know they're capable of less than stellar. The cocktails are strong, the wine list is great - and the classic red steakhouse decor never actually goes out of style.  I love this place!

Nhc2y9nhZXO0pboQ_1n0xg.text: Oh Durant's, what's left to say that hasn't already been said.   It's THE downtown original, the prime rib is amazing, the service is typically on point, it's rat-pack retro, you can walk through the kitchen, and they put ice in the urinals.  What's not to love!    This is a great place to grab a cocktail or to have a very nice dinner.  You get two side dishes with an entree, and their take on "garlic bread" is super tasty (and free).  Sure it's a little spendy but you will leave full and probably half drunk because a martini is definitely in order here.   It's a good idea to have a reservation, particularly any weekend night, and probably an Uber.  I have been here many many times, never had a bad meal, and one thing is for sure if I am at Durant's you are sure to find me in very good company, surrounded by great friends or family for an awesome meal.

6aWS-dBs4J9yQ0PLBb37rQ.text: We came here a few nights ago for the first time and my impression of the outside was this was maybe a cheap spot but when you walk in its a whole different atmosphere. Looks like and old style upscale restaurant. Waiters and waitresses were very pleasant food was delicious and the martinis were STRONG. I wasn't super pleased with my steak I asked for medium well and it was super well done. They were about to close so I didn't bother complaining. But overall it was a nice place. Very pricey.

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

dRRe6at7KOZtPenSDk3PnQ.text: Frankly, I don't know what this place was 50 years ago.  I saw people in shorts and T-shirts walking in, and upon entering, thought there was clearly a disconnect and lack of keeping up standards.  All I can say is that I was WRONG!!!  I'm in town for a Father's Day weekend from NYC, and used to the great steakhouses in the country there.  The food here was comparable and in some cases, better.  My steak was amazing as well as being cooked perfectly, baked potato amazing, the bread drenched in butter and garlic, amazing, the salad, yup, amazing.   I will say the food is priced high, even more than NYC, which is fine, and it is worth it, but the wine list is so accessible to any budget, it isn't even funny.  Be sure to  take advantage of it. Some bottles less than $30. The waiter, bartenders and maitre D was great as well.  Wow, what a meal.  I'm full, I'm drunk, and I'm happy.  I highly recommend.

vMKHgMEv-2X_-yWLY6StCA.text: It doesn't get any better than this fellow steak lovers!  DURANT'S continues their tradition of PERFECTION. We arrived at 6:15pm  - 15 minutes earlier than our 6:30pm reservation. We were greeted warmly and seated immediately. I love the cool vibe which totally takes you back to some of the classic New York City steak houses.   Here's what we ordered: 8oz. Filet cooked to perfection "black & blue" which is the only way to enjoy a juicy steak. Prime rib, and 2 orders of the 14 oz. NY strip. We ate every delicious morsel. I don't want to forget the outstanding Italian wedding soup, which was a heavenly marriage of meatballs and spinach in a flavorful broth. I sopped up every single drop of the broth with the crusty hot bread they brought to the table.  For dessert we all shared an apple cobbler with vanilla ice cream.   Everything from start to finish was pure perfection. Our expert server, David Hooley, deserves a shout out for everything he did to make our evening special in every way. I can't say enough about this place. Sure it's expensive. But as the saying goes: quality remains long after price is forgotten. I'd eat here every week if they were in my neck of the woods, but it's a two hour round trip adventure so we'll just keep it as our occasional treat when we're craving the BEST BEEF IN ARIZONA!

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A feast for the senses!

V1px5NByn9K43JIs9h5eZQ.text: Durant's a couple of years back was very good.  It's not bad, but definitely not great.  Service is hit or miss and the quality of food you can tell has gone down as prices have gone up - seems like the economy has been hitting them harder than expected.  One bit of advice is to eat in the dining area, not the bar area.  You will get better service for sure.

QvrB5NbeMAvRhkCQrRAqrA.text: This review is over twenty years overdue.  Durant's has changed over the years. The stern no nonsense maitre d that directed if and where you sat and whom would serve you has been replaced with a much softer version of himself.  Shirts and ties, or at least an evening jacket has become the exception rather than the norm for the male dining clientele.  The ladies still look nice, but don't tend to dress up as much as down to dine.  The fresh cut roses (enormous and fragrant) have have given way to much more modest floral decoration and (shudder) Mylar balloons.   Durant's is where those on the outside went to watch the power brokers of Phoenix have lunch and dinner.  Mayors, governors, sports celebrities and members of the powerful Phoenix Forty were a common sight.  Years prior the likes of Clark Gable, Jane Russell, Lee Marvin and John Wayne could be spotted as well.  (Guys, imagine John Wayne standing at that same ice filled urinal).  Not so much now.   What is the same?  First, the food.  I sincerely believe the food is the same first rate food and beverage that can/could be acquired and is as expertly prepared as was available in 1950.   Service is next.  The wait staff is first rate being personable, attentive and completely knowledgeable about the menu and drink options.  A high server to table ratio ensures your drinks are continuously topped up, empty plates are promptly removed and your dining experience is always a positive one.  Next the place itself.  You enter through the kitchen.  Think about that.  Any other restaurant of lower quality would might be afraid of what you might see.  Not here.  The food prep areas are spotless and orderly, the cooks and assistants are dressed neatly and are friendly.  When in there, note the mesquite wood fired ovens that make those steaks and chops taste so good.  (Sometimes newbie customers will wander around and come in through the front entrance, perhaps as their rite of initiation, but only once.)  "Friends don't let friends use the front door"  The red velvet patterned wallpaper, the large red vinyl private booths, the small toilets, the 1950's era phone booth where errant cell phone users are directed to take their apparently important calls are the same and hopefully never will change.  Don't go there for a cheap meal.  (The reviews by those complaining about the cost are borderline hilarious).  Do go for special occasions, but no, the waiters will not gather around to clap and sing happy birthday to you for the annoyance of the surrounding guests.  The Mrs. and I go two to three times a year, and it's at this humble establishment  where we first met for lunch and now enjoy our anniversary dinner each and every year on the 14th of February.     Our favorites?  The Mrs. prefers the Prime Rib with the knock you back in your seat freshly ground side of horseradish sauce. (Use sparingly  - you have been warned).  Mine is the Top Sirloin medium to medium well, and I steal a little of her horseradish sauce for effect.  You almost don't need a knife to cut the steak or Prime Rib, they are of the highest quality.  Do not insult the place by asking for steak sauce, it is not needed.  At least once have the shrimp cocktail..Words cannot describe it.  We have been married over eighteen years, I do not share it with her, it is that good.   And, please dress up a little bit, show some class and respect.  There are many other places in town where shorts, sandals and ball caps are adequate dining apparel.

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. They are full of ice.  John Wayne was here.

r_lTvy05wRV7VyOTxYZtVg.text: Classy historical Phoenix landmark !  Shrimp awesome and gigantic! Steak delicious , melted in my mouth

NJ9ok1pNKwTOZH8ySLoX3w.text: First of all their prices are high and that's OK, I knew that. I expected to get a really great dinner. The steaks are the best. Prepared perfectly. Don't order anything other then the steak you want. My spouse had Scallops added. Not a real good idea here. They were the smallest Scallops I've ever seen.....ever. The price difference was huge for what you got. They were not cooked all that well and were a bit gummy. You only received three (3) and they were no bigger then a nickel and not all that thick ether. Way too much money for that. My suggestion is, stick to steaks without the seafood add-on. They have no idea what they're doing. Go to a seafood restaurant for seafood not Durant's.

YSYgO5Oef9aZmXoPQ3rEng.text: First, I would like to take the opportunity to thank all of you who recommended this place to me.   I took my boyfriend here for his birthday dinner.   He was absolutely stoked!   It all started with the entrance through the kitchen (Goodfellas style)!This was one of his favorite parts as he loves the movie.   Then, we were greater by a friendly hosts who escorted us to our table. Our server showed up shortly after and the party has started.   For start, they bring you this amazing bread roll, soaked in olive oil and topped with mixture of leaks and few other greens. Then complimentary plate of raw vegetables served on bed of ice. Amazing!  We started of with some cocktails and deep fried chicken liver for appetizer, which was delicious. For the main course, we both ordered 8 oz. Filet Mignon that was served with super fluffy and delicious mashed potatoes. Easy 10 stars for the main course. The Filet was cooked to perfection and was melting in my mouth like butter.   The dessert was complementary on the house for a birthday boy! We choose to share Creme Brulee Trio for which, I easily give 5 stars.   The atmosphere was super nice. It made us feel like we were somewhere in New York. The story about the restaurant was super cool and our server was kind enough to share it.   Expect great food, atmosphere, service but also expect to pay $$$$ for it. For special occasions, absolutely worth every pennie!

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crème Brûlée Trio
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 8 oz. filet mignon with mashed potatoes.
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Complementary bread with leaks and olive oil...

QnsTTryW3AITA06aiaS5Iw.text: First,as you walk in you feel as if you're going back in time. The atmosphere is sort of rat pack-esque shabby chic. I felt like it was interesting and nostalgic, but it seems like they've let the place go...   We started with cocktails; of course, you can't go wrong there and they're heavy on the pours! Next we got some salads, eh, nothing spectacular, but oh well, I wasn't there for a salad. We ordered filets for our entrees and the steak was amazing, so full of flavor! The sides were not as good though, they border pathetic. We got the broccolini which was lifeless and bland. We also had the crab Mac and cheese, it was low on crab and needed salt.   I wish they would do a little updating on the way they prepare the sides, as well as fix up/clean up the restaurant a little, because the steak was really good.

OT_oQZ9oXzXooQ7wlOg7xw.text: Loved the atmosphere here. I felt like we were walking in the wrong door when we went through the kitchen, but I guess that's the front door. The steaks were perfect, best I've had. I thought the Caesar dressing could have been thicker. The baked potato was good. Overall a great dinner and experience.  I had the chocolate indulgence for desert, it was delicious!

tpKHiZiJRKxAR5JTZJdJxw.text: Dissapointing. After my first experience of getting food poisoning,  I tried to give Durrants a second chance but was disappointed again. On our second visit we went for my husband's birthday because he wanted a good steak dinner. Our waiter was very nice and accomidating. Durrants has a very cool old town gangter restaurant feeling, including the entering through the kitchen. The atmosphere is loud but adds to the experience. We were seated in a hallway close to the bar, but we did not mind until a large group of men started to crowd into the bar area in front of our table blocking the hallway and facing their butts toward a our table. They were so close to our table that when someone tried to go by our table they would slide their butt across our table to get through. It was very disturbing while we were trying to enjoy our main course with a view of large Butts. We told our waiter and he apologized, offered to move us, and had someone ask the butts to move. The butts move for a second then were back in full view. The food was underwhelming; my husband's filet was warm and dry. Again, the waiter was very nice and knew these butts were annoying and offered a free dessert. Very nice but, our meal was already spoiled. On our way out we noticed the other part of the bar area was not crowded. Why the butts decided to hang out in the crowded area against our table was a mystery.  I felt bad that my husband did not get an enjoyable birthday dinner. I understand the butts were customers too, but I think management could have addressed the issue better since we were not the only table that had issues with this group and there was plenty of room on the other side of the bar. Needless to say, that was the last time we will ever go to Durrants.

kuoh5fLPbkbqBHXCHfz7AA.text: Always go to Durant's for my birthday.  Awesome steak and martini's.  Vince is a great server.  I always request him.

N7cdsFEJSwQ3uDmicDFTcA.text: I've always loved coming here for the throw-back style and atmosphere, but in more recent visits I've found the cooking and preparation to be getting routine. On top of that, it's become quite over-priced. You shouldn't have to spend $60 and up for a steak at this level. Service is usually excellent.

j69Aii46KmdznZ7KoQvnqw.text: I went to Durant's last night.  Best Tartar Sauce ANYWHERE ( made in house ) Fine dining occurs when the staff does their job without interrupting the customer.  Whoever trains the bussers, waiters, and hostess..... ask for a raise. Ten Stars.  It's great to go to an old school restaurant with a varied menu.... I've had the steak.... obviously.... and the calves liver, trout, fried shrimp...those are the ones I like. All good enough for multiple visits if you're a regular.... I mean.... when was the last time YOU went out to a restaurant bc you liked ONE ITEM on their menu? Not at Durant's.  I hope they have continued success. Even though the food is not James Beard Creativity.... it is solid, good quality with attention to its preparation.... if not it's presentation... ( sides served in soup cups, and garnish I can't recognize )  Go to Durant's. Enjoy. It is a treat... if you open your eyes.

t0szAf4zKgjUthBD7whdkA.text: How anyone has less than a 5 star review for this place is beyond me!  The ambiance is awesome and so fun to enter through the kitchen!  The service is always top notch.  We typically order oysters Rockefeller as an app and even if you think that is not your thing, I would give it a try.  It is awesome!  I got the filet and scallops and loved every bite.  If you like mushrooms get a side of them for the table as they are by far my favorite, even eating them alone.  I love the martinis and they always nail the execution.  Seriously, we have never had a bad meal here.  It's my favorite Phoenix staple!  We were too full for dessert this time, which is typically my favorite part; so we couldn't pass taking some home.  We thought the cheese cake and tiramisu would travel best and it worked out great.  Tasted amazing.  We will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Filet and Filet Mignon  &amp; Grilled Scallops with Au Gratin Potatoes, so yummy. Martini is amazing too!

3qbWK2bLL1WRowUJGT6V3g.text: We have been visiting Durant's for years. Never, ever had a bad, or even mediocre experience. We Bragg all the time about Durant's and love sharing with our friends the history and stories of Jack himself.    The entire staff, always greet you like you are an old customer and make you feel you are the most honored guest in the restaurant.    The ambiance is truly "Old World", and a place where you can feel comfortable "dressing well", which is a rarity these days.  Thank you Jack, for leaving this fine restaurant behind for us to still enjoy.   And BTW, the steaks are the best we have ever had. Jack was a rare bird making sure he always served the best meat in town.  On a side note...legend is..when he passed, he left the restaurant to his long time employees.     Good man he was!!!!

MWmv1asMHyHd1VroTUXifg.text: I give Durants 4 1/2 stars. Overall it is very good but I think it is a little overpriced from other high end steakhouses in the area. But you definitely get that old school experience that you are looking for. My ribeye was cooked perfectly and so was my wife's fillet. Oh and don't leave without buying the strawberry shortcake that was absolutely the best way to end a meal.

it0uW5EF6i77bN7ELNPk6A.text: We decided to check this place out prior to heading to the airport at the recommendation of a co-worker. I had the BBQ Chicken Slider, My coworkers had the scallops, sliders & onion rings. We were all satisfied with our food, the chicken sliders were good, but the sauce was just a little too sweet for my pallet. As for the customer service, it was just okay, a little slow in getting our food. My only complaint is regarding the lighting. This had got to be the darkest restaurant that I have ever gone to. I had to use the light on my phone in order to see my menu. Even with the light from the phone, my pics of the food was still dark (you be the judge) Not sure if I would revisit, only time will tell.

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

dNcCi0fHyQx4jcpfEN6tEg.text: Swing and a miss.   As many have said the entrance is through the back, which I actually liked, it made me feel much cooler than I actually am. We were greeted pretty quickly and waited about 15 minutes for a table which wasn't nearly as bad as I expected.   I had the bone in Ribeye and my date had the Filet and grilled Scallops. My Ribeye was ordered rare and came out easily medium and that's me being pretty generous. The filet was ordered medium rare and came out correctly but the scallops were exceptionally uneven. A couple were burnt, some were almost raw. I'm not sure what was going on. After being sent back everything came out as close to correct as you can hope for. The scallops were still a disaster but my date had given up on them and just enjoyed her filet. She told me to not make a big deal out of it.    I will say this, through all of this, our server kept her composure, apologized a billion times and tried to make sure everything was good. She seemed to be slightly overwhelmed because another one of her tables was having issues but she kept it together. I was just frustrated at the end but she did everything she could to make it right. Maybe the kitchen was just having an off night.   Going out to places like this is kind of a treat for me so when it doesn't go well it's kind of a bummer. I don't anticipate spending money here again.

XkCbd21lCCx7Ax1d1FMVJg.text: Durant makes you feel like your in the movie GoodFellas!   You drive around back and you walk right through the kitchen......  The hustle and bustle of the kitchen had me on pins and needles.  What an awesome experience. We  were seated on all red leather seats with red walls. This place is so cool...   Let's get to the food..... This place isn't CHEAP..... You are going to pay some serious money.
