When a plate of shrimp scampi costs $48.00 (YES, HUNTEE, it's not a typo)  this better be the best shrimp scampi ever... and I must say it was good now was it $48.00 good... that depends on the individual..but it was good!   Now their steaks that's another thing all together. It was amazing.... but wait there shrimp cocktail gave me LIFE... It was so damn good.   The shrimps were butterfly style and the horseradish cocktail sauce was AMAZING.... sweet and spicy at the same time.  Yummy!!!   The wine list was 6 pages long.  You can get an entire bottle or a half of bottle. Of course I finished the entire bottle. Yes, ME not WE!   Who's ready for dessert.... I AM! I ordered the tiramisu, it was delicious..one of the best tiramisu I had so far!   Look this place is great for an anniversary, birthday or any celebration.    The bill turned out to be a whooping... wait..... It was over $340.00 that's not including tip.  It's an expensive place but it depends on you... to me it was worth the experience at least once!

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chocolate heaven
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tiramisu for the GODS....
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Friends for life

2T1N4KzJIurQgY1ubff-0A.text: Believe it or not I love a great preparation of liver and onions and bacon. Durant's does it better than my sainted grandmother of course Durant's is a Phoenix classic. Amazingly they continue to maintain their excellent quality year in and year out While I love that liver and onions I must admit that I began to crave the beef dinners that my dining companions had - guess I must return soon

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

_51Gc52NjW_1rWmz22geoA.text: 5 STARS here!! I looked up nice places from Sacramento so when I got to Arizona, I wouldn't have to worry about getting in anywhere nice. I made reservations, took my 91 Year old dad. An old fisherman...... he loves seafood and fish. From the moment we walked through the door you are treated with Kindness, attentive, shook hands and didn't let a dirty dish stay on the table, making sure you are VERY WELL taken care of. The atmosphere is elegant and beautiful.

Byi1gG_j-lurLnPLCOnucA.text: killer calamari  awesome bread  juiciest well seasoned steak ever  Service was slightly lacking. Felt like we weren't as important as some of her other patrons. Very little smiling and talking as we observed with other tables.  Steak is to die for. Go there.... now. But be willing to pay for it. At minimum $75 per person!!! (Lobster and filet was $255.00) took a while to get food even at 8 pm. Was so excited to eat didn't get good pics.

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

9WfA8PcBWKOKqdWbJtDmBQ.text: OMG amazing dinner tonight! Happy Valentines Day to us!  Hubby ate the 48oz Porterhouse & is now a member of the 'Porterhouse Club'! I had the Chicken Picata. Both were soooo DELISH!!!! Tender, flavorful, simply wonderful! The steak came as husband ordered AND it was cut up for him in pieces so he knew when it arrived that it was cooked perfectly as he ordered it. He said it melted in his mouth. He could cut the meat with his fork.  We got a free dessert, too! Strawberry Shortcake. Yum...Nom Nom Nom.  MUST GO! Worth every cent. Beautiful restaurant and great service. Dress up a little and you'll fit right in. Recommend making reservations.

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

LUQTTJozj7GHUZFs7vjSzg.text: This is my favorite place to enjoy succulent Prime Rib the ambiance was nice and quaint it was a memorable experience a look forward to my next time going the reason for 4stars the wait due to Valentine's Day but the wait was well worth it.

l2hWSvabI5tSEOvhWAhOBA.text: This review is for all of you that love the pure unadulterated definition of a steakhouse.  This place orders, feels like, and serves like a steakhouse from back in the day.  They are successful because they absolutely know what they are doing.  Impeccable service, food, steak, wine list!  I am not normally a martini person but ordered one because "when in Rome" and I WAS NOT disappointed.  Thank you Durant's for being close to my house and an easy place to take the husband always!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak, au gratin potatoes, double cut lamb chops, garlic mash.

uge00DNQ2Qd-7swizrJJHw.text: Old School steak house.  Atmosphere is much more unique than Mastro's or Flemming's.    The Steaks are good and cooked to accurately to temperature.  Seafood is fresh.  It is not cheap, but a cool place for a special occasion.

FpkxD79FgjlNna0JWiOL2Q.text: Older aunts. Have been coming here since I'm a kid with my parents. One of the original steakhouses in the Phoenix area. Definitely old school mentality decor and service. Excellent steaks and food. Or we served promptly with excellent quality. If you're looking for an old-school steak house with the big booths and the dark 60s style Decor this is your spot. Definitely come and check this place out if you have never been. Plenty of new steakhouses in the valley these days but this one has been here for many decades. That says a lot.

pP2A9iAJFueNUBBIvXGVig.text: Great steak prep and seasoning. The atmosphere is definitely Rat Pack or Goodfellas when you walk in. Staff all well trained and super nice. They know the products very well. You'll pay a bit, but it's worth it if you want the Durant's experience.

-2o-2BMQUtNXVuDHWaglXg.text: The best service and incomparable prime rib ever. Wish we could travel here from Yuma every weekend, a real class act.

mXfTD8MZD4Sgvc64IVACwQ.text: NOTE:  They are CLOSED on Christmas Day (no matter what their Yelp page may say that day).  Also, they don't bother to have an outgoing voicemail message saying they are closed on Christmas, the phone doesn't even go to voicemail, it just rings and rings.

t-4rOKuSSfj0ACLxbUC4Og.text: I am so disappointed in the service tonight at Durant's this is the 2nd time I've been here And the bar service has been  terrible I'm not sure what the deal is but it's awful. I was ranting and raving about this place to my friend and we got this !  I loves this place but It was very disappointing! The bartender yelled at us I'll get to you when I'm done with these 8 people!!!!!  He took their order brought it to them took their pictures and still had not even acknowledged us !!!!

AsUvW3um7ijfb5LfXRv3fQ.text: A friend and I had a delicious lunch here today. The ambiance goes back in time. We walked through the kitchen to get in to the dining which was red and dark with booths. Loved it!!! It was difficult to decide what to eat because everything sounded sooo good. However, our main purpose was to have the prime rib which friend have raved about. Tender and flavorful!!! The prime rib was perfectly cooked and delicious. The garlic potatoes were good but very salty and I like salt. Our server was wonderful and split the wedge salad and our desert for us. Will look forward to returning.

vtu-ZbOfBAFI9NvvVtbMeQ.text: Microwave. Rubber. Chicken. 2 weeks ago I made the horrible mistake of ordering a non-steak item. Horrible, inedible "Chicken Masala" was MICROWAVED! So rubbery it went "boinnnng" when I picked it up. The taste and texture was disgusting. Chef Ramsay needs to come in here! The 5 star reviews are a LIE. The only thing going for it is the name- and paid reviewers. Foul- go there and see for yourself! Try the food. NOT GOOD- my cats wouldn't even eat the leftovers. Really gross. Maybe their steaks are good, maybe it's the ONLY thing that's good. Miserable food.

qvsoNNzwvq-Z5SgdIoPDow.text: Old school steak house in every way... amazing food, great bar.   If your looking for nouveau which Phoenix as over done ad nauseum, your at the wrong place,  One of the few higher end restaurants in Arizona that actually has character and history....

D9MeArrHA1f88uTlrKekRQ.text: Service was superb. None of the turn  and burn nonsense that has invaded more and more upscale joints.  Great wine selection, steaks were excellent. Mashed potatoes were...mashed potatoes.

PJWpjBEMvJWOZdp8EURSYA.text: So my fellow yelpers were on point again. This place. Was OK.  I have training here in AZ and was told by one of the fellow business guys this was the place to go. However he had French cuffs held together by paper clips so immediately his opinion was suspect.  Of course I checked this site. The reviews made me a Tad nervous but the girl I brought was already buzzing from the pool bar and I was tired so we went anyways.  Drinks were awesome and the service I got was also great. Of course the lady and myself were looking pretty good so that may of had something to do with it.  I had the rib eye and my chick had some sort of fish. Both dishes while not bad were rather uninspired. Nothing that I wanted to text back home about awesome steak or anything.  I will come back for the booze. We will see about golf out here tomorrow in 6billion degree weather. Don't know how the locals deal with this heat. Must be part camel or something.

RToFM1h8XlnNa7-6LmZo0A.text: I've only been to Durant's for lunch.  It was not all disappointing!  The atmosphere is of a nice, classicly dark steakhouse.  (Just remember how bright it may be when you leave!)  I had the open face cajun prime rib sandwich.  Yes, it's as good as it sounds!  Couple it with a nice glass of wine, and  you'll have a hard time wanting to go back to work!

iIQq1cKIIyiQP6_lIfa1Qg.text: I ordered the filet and it came under-cooked.  I sent it back and it came back over-cooked.  I sent a quick note to the owner..........and they returned a nice gift certificant (please don't do this unless you really had an issue.  Not fair to company).  Bottom line -  the food was good and I was very impressed with the customer service.

E0wJf-Az2JppXwh7qk1SgA.text: Nice filet mignon, wines and some of the sides are really good like the broccoli. The desserts were just ok. I think that for the price I was expecting a bit more. Service was excellent.

APtc5FfmwuQspZ-aphdy8A.text: Even though I'm a new resident in AZ I've been coming here for years. Durant's is my husbands favorite place so we've been there maybe five times. It's upper end prices and I've never had anything but prime rib but it's always fabulous. The food isn't "foodie" food and isn't exceptional. But it's consistently good food.  The service has always been good. Not what I'd call "excellent" but consistently good. I've never sat around wondering where the server is, or why we don't have something on the table. The reason I'm giving it a four instead of a three is the overall package. It's got a great atmosphere and it's always consistent. consistent food, consistently good service, a decent wine list and a feeling of "occassion". I like it.

h1hZ25vyGJPXErk2F0JyYA.text: My husband & I have been patrons of Durrant's for nearly 40 years.  The service has always been the best as well as the food.  However, on this trip, while our server did his best, some of the food was a disappointment this time, except for the Oysters Rockefeller.  The bread loaf was just too darn soggy from the olive oil.  Our lettuce wedges were covered with unedible black charcoaled bacon bits. We ordered the shrimp scampi appetizer & got the full dinner plate of shrimp scampi linguini.  The shrimp was way over-cooked & hard.  The linguini was dripping with oil.  What really got our goats was the fact that we ordered the shrimp scampi appetizer was less than $20, but the same shrimp w/linguini was $20 more.  So, basically, we paid $20 for a dish of linguini that I could not eat because I'm gluten sensitive.  We discussed the error with our witer & he insisted that's what we ordered.  We tried to send it back & just get the shrimp alone, but there was no doing that.  my husband chose not to make a scene & get our server in trouble for the screw up, because he was a nice man.  He treated us to a free dessert.  The other thing is that their prices have risen to the point of being ridiculously high, especially for being in a restaurant with a musty aroma from the old wall covering, booths, ceilings, & carpet.  The restrooms are the worst.  They are the tiniest, most uncomfortable public spaces we've ever been in.  One has to nearly sit on the toilet to shut the stall door.  They are not ADA accessible & the  women's smells of sewer at times.  This last visit will probably be one of our law visits.  They are so proud of their continued operation based upon an old reputation that the idea of being called "nostalgic" is an understatement.  The place is just really old & dirty feeling.  The high food prices do NOT reflect the quality & quantity of the food, & especially the musty outdated ambiance.

dqxdS7XBsfvIJ6tIvrn1JQ.text: I absolutely don't get the draw of this place.  I really try to see things in as positive a light as possible, but I call it like I see it.  While some diners may call a dirty and neglected restaurant as one with ambiance and atmosphere, I call it for what it is, a place that has aged without care of replacing or updating things as needed, and that goes for the food too.  It may have been quite the fancy dinner at one time, but unless your taste buds are as stuck in time as this place, nothing exciting or even worth remembering here - very bland.  I guess as long as people keep coming and swooning over this old and gawdy place, that will continue to be used as an excuse not to care or change.  At a minimum, they really should at least sweep up the broken beer bottles and all the cigarette butts up in their parking lot and sidewalk.

3KOi7pJ_ypIGsZZqtzkjtQ.text: HORRIBLE service and food the quality of DENNY'S. Place needs new chefts, ownership,  and a manager who knows what they are doing.

u0kk5a4uCxj6Cm-gLyX3-Q.text: Honestly, they deserve 10 stars. Durant's on historic Central Ave is one of two favorite Phoenix restaurants, and I've been a long-time patron. First, the fare. Perfect. Every time. Prime rib with garlic mashed potatoes is a "sure thing" although the filet is equally delectable. Flavor, temperature, presentation, timing, all perfectly orchestrated. Great wine and mixed drink selection, strawberry shortcake (their signature dessert) is out of this world. Second, the ambience. You walk in the back door through the kitchen like you're a Don in Goodfellas. Everyone greets you as though you're a member of the family. The dimly lit dining room is encapsulated in rich, red velvet wall paper with matching red seating. It's also a well tended historic property, adding to its quaint charm. Third, the staff. Always affable, accommodating, and genuinely kind. I cannot recommend it enough. Bon appetit!

E7F4uaN7-nF2sworyb0CBQ.text: The service, decor and appetizers are always top-notch. Crab claws and mussels are some of my favorites. While the steaks are always good, they leave me wishing I headed to City Hall instead. Factoring in the high prices, the steaks are just not my first choice. If you're into a simpler slab of lightly seasoned beef, however, this may be the place for you.

IgLGXtzDb7JVdZvKKsZn_w.text: Fun, great food, classic old-school feel.

dT6kD-Sw_QoAoeNVNWdiPQ.text: I'm not sure if Durant's is really 5-star worthy, but something about it, I gotta say I like...a lot.  I also don't know what mind boggling insightful information I can provide after 90 plus reviews, but I'll put in my 2 cents (dammit, here we go again with the lack of a cents key on my keyboard--typewriters have them you know!) which will buy you nothing BTW.  Yes, there's red velvet wallpaper and one could argue the interior is more like a "before" shot, but that's part of its charm ("charm"...one of those words you don't like to read in a real estate listing, much like "cozy" or "up & coming neighborhood.")  But I think anyone over the age of 40...I'm not saying I am over 40 mind you...will appreciate the comfortable, recognizable, glimpse into the past it offers you.  I would have never seen the inside of a place like Durant's as a kid since I would have either been left at home or sent to the car (my parents had no problems with sticking you in the car even when it was 110 outside), but I can imagine this is what I missed.  Service did start a little rocky.  Rocky as in at least 10-15 minutes for someone to even consider taking a drink order.  But when I ordered a sloe gin fizz, I did not get a blank stare, however, I'm pretty sure I did not get sloe gin either.  There was a little overkill on the sweet, so hard to tell.    Once we were able to order a drink, service was impeccable...see what a drink in hand can do for you?  We had oysters rockefeller which were seriously delicious, and I had the scallop and filet combination.  Scallops were perfectly seared and the filet was almost fork tender.  Garlic mashed potatoes were not hot enough, nor garlicky enough either.  But I forgot all about that when I saw the size of the strawberry shortcake.  When you're sharing, size does matter.  So I love Durant's in spite of a few shortcomings, and I would happily return.  Maybe in a few years, when my dad is really old, I can send his ass to the car.

SJ_P0Xuz_pK6Tdasr0fmHQ.text: This long time Phoenix restaurant never fails to impress. The food and drinks are consistently good. The female bartender who is there on Friday nights makes an AWESOME old fashioned.  It is always a treat at Durant's, but last Friday night we had Patrick McCausland as our waiter as he made our experience extra special. What a great waiter!

9FX-S4r9Qz8ddkpZ7JLZkg.text: After a long week of running a partner conference, myself and the team wanted something unique to Phoenix, AZ, which had a good steak and seafood combo.  Thanks to Yelp, Durant's came up.  After confirming with the concierge at the resort, we realized the place is pretty legit.  So we are in the car, driving up, and we pull up at the stoplight across the street.  Looking across, the place looked like a strip club.  Pink building with no windows.....seriously, do we abort?  Ahhh heck, let's do this."  So the 10 of us go in.  When you walk in, you enter through the kitchen.  The wall paper is red and looks like it has texture to it.  "ok, are we making the right choice? Yes, we are here let's do it"  I ordered the Bone in Ribeye and let me tell you, it was to die for.  Even better than that was the scallops and loaded baked potato.   Dessert came, and oh snap daddy likes. Creme brulee in three styles: coconut rum, chocolate and berry.  Would I recommend it again?...heck yes!  Rock on Durant's

f1zzcj1mNyyYOs4ReDDkyg.text: Finally got to eat here for a work event.  It was EXACTLY what everyone is raving about.  My steak was perfect and all the fixings were just as wonderful.  The waiters are very professional and the atmosphere is classic.  Treat yourself already!

mFGJLSPLVPDFsFg2E9n1ow.text: the most legitimate dining in central phoenix. classy, urban, east coast service (efficient: fill water in timely manner, strong drinks, attentive, clear plates when finished). the scallops are cooked to perfection every time so is the salmon. the filet is delicious as well. park in the back and enter through kitchen. place is bomb.

XMdshVhtlwN4ZYDFZHQRHw.text: Durant's is everything a steakhouse should be. Dimly lit with a somewhat mafia like gangstery feeling warm atmosphere, professional and prompt no b.s. service with THE BEST tasting 12 oz filet I have ever had. The walk through the kitchen is a nice touch, especially when leaving because you get a chance to thank the chefs that made that mouthwatering slab of perfection you just gorged on. I don't mind paying a bit more for a meal like I had last night. And they don't skimp on the pours, my martini was filled to the brim which is just how it should be. Mastros can take their pretentious wait staff and long speeches about how their cows are hand fed grass by some old farmer and his wife in ohio and seasoned with blah blah blah, seared in a 1200 degree oven and served with bleh blipitty bloop and if I order it rare it will have a cool pink center etc (I think I know what rare is)... just give me the GD steak and make it amazing like Durant's did and let me enjoy my company and my meal. I can't wait to go back!  P.S. Their Bearnaise sauce was great too.

j8RQEmB3k2BTGq3rcsFD0w.text: Yes, the food here -- especially the steaks -- is fantastic but what really sets Durant's apart is the amazing service. Earlier this week, my wife and I wanted to go someplace special for an early anniversary dinner. While we were thinking of restaurants to visit, she tossed out Durant's and the suggestion elicited a pretty instant "YES!" from me.  Durant's as you know, is classic old school Phoenix. Everyone from political big wigs to mobsters making time in the valley between New York, Jersey, California, Vegas, and prison made the Central Phoenix steakhouse the place to be. They still serve one of the best martinis that you'll find around. That and some quality time in their lounge should appeal to most people, at least as a one time thing.  In any case, my wife and I managed to slip in without a reservation; it was a Monday night so we weren't that worried. We both ordered the the 12 ounce top sirloin steak, which was perfection as expected.  Our server, Kevin, was the best. His easygoing friendliness was pretty great and he made us feel like rock stars. While Durant's has great desserts, Kevin was the cherry on top.

gtI8_XAYqN_TKhEP6eaNFA.text: As a Phoenix native, I've been eating at Durant's for ages; therefore, this rating reflects my overall dining experience versus a specific visit.  Simply put - Durant's has the best ambience of any steakhouse in the Valley, from its deep booths (perfect for date nights) and red velvet wallpaper to its kitchen entrance and Rat Pack swagger. It also has the best food on a consistent basis: I've never gone wrong with a classic martini, medium-rare prime rib, and any chilled seafood choice.   Reservations are recommended, as is eating at off-peak hours or on Sunday nights, as the bar and restaurant can get crowded / loud. But no matter when you visit, you'll see people of all ages in all levels of dressy/strange/casual/business attire - and you'll enjoy your experience. [It's much better than Mastro's or other chain-steak-places.]

NP8b5nqI13A9grKdkAPztw.text: Overall a really nice experience.  Very vintage, old school place with the naugahyde booths, flocked wallpaper, somber lighting and mid-20th century vibe.  Like a place Goodfellas met for business ;-)  It really is not fancy by any stretch.  It's exterior is profoundly modest and, like I say, the decor is like what we remember as "fine" restaurants in our youth (I'm in my 60s).  The food was very good, and the service was truly outstanding.  But, oh!, those prices!  Most steaks were in the upper $50/$60 range, and some considerably more.  Ok, you get soup or salad, which were great, but still.  It reminds me of a cool old place in LA's Koreatown, Taylor's Steakhouse, but Taylor's prices are a fraction of this place.  I enjoyed it; it was like stepping back in time, but I really cannot see how they justify their prices.  That said, it's popular, so there you go.

sqULGeBANgsot_UBwd10uA.text: We had a great meal at Durant's on Sun 5/17 and will come back when we are in Phoenix.  We enjoyed the steak and filet and good starters and dessert. The wine list was fine and the server was excellent. We called ahead, Steve told us to come on down and expect a brief wait.  The wait was really short and staff could not have been nicer to first time out of towners.  We were staying in a hotel nearby and when driving by noticed the sign. It looked like a long-established joint, and a quick check on Yelp revealed that this is the Phoenix version of the old-fashioned steak houses we love in the LA area - SoCal types who like Dal Rae, old timers who remember the Riviera and those who know and love Park Ave will be comfortable here, down to the crudite plate.  Note that some Yelp reviews of this place that mentioned the dress were by people who may not know what's expected anywhere.  We are here to correct that.  Based on Yelp reviews we read that evening, the place is dressy, so we hurriedly DRESSED for dinner.  And sure enough, the ambiance calls for people to dress a bit better than T-shirts and jeans. And yet, there were tables of lender/developer/broker-looking types in hawaiian shirts and tommy bahama wear. California no-rules apply in PHX, evidently.  Still, even if the clientele run the gamut the same way they do in SoCal, you won't go wrong respecting management by  dressing appropriately for a nice, clubby restaurant experience.

EYqvZcMtq8LSj3Yy2xAPdw.text: $39 for an average size pork chop  ?  Come on Man !!!  Food, service, atmosphere all good, just a little aggressive on pricing.

_2FpZaK248ulc6XeJE7hQQ.text: Have been going here for years food is spot on. Place is cool! Just love this restaurant and the service is amazing.  It's a must go in my book

fxg2wtTxWsNBy2-SD-GxZA.text: Clearly the kitchy decor is reason enough to come to this ancient joint of Phoenix past.  You pull into their parking lot and walk through the kitchen to get to the dining room.  One would wonder why they have not changed this; however, the entry only adds to Durant's charm.  Started off my meal with a martini.  Yeah, this is a martini kinda place.  I expected the perfect martini from a place like this.  Sadly it could have been a tad colder and been prepared with a drop less vermooth.    Had their navy bean soup.  It was a really good bowl of soup perfectly seasoned with nice pieces of ham.  Hit the spot.  Will definitely opt for the soup again.  I chose an entree salad for my main course.  Was 84 degrees in Phoenix last night and a salad sounded perfect.  The salad I selected had Dungeness crab and grilled shrimp with a remoulade dressing.  It was $32.95; however, tasted great.  The fish was fresh and all of the ingredients complemented one another.    Finished off my meal with their scrumptuous key lime pie.  The graham cracker crust was thick and buttery while the pie had a nice cream consistancy.  This is another item I will definitely order again.  My party of four split a bottle of red wine.  The wine was good but served too cold.  Either their wine storage unit is set unusually low because this is Phoenix or they had it in the fridge.  Regardless it was too cold and one does not have to be a wine expert to make that revelation.  The service was fair.  They were not that busy as it was a Monday night; however, could have used one more waiter on staff.  One expects flawless service in a place like Durant's.  Will I come here again?  Of course.  Probably will order the same things I had last night.  Food was great, service was far and the ambiance very special.

1GfOs8eDlFse0LRUgmYjBQ.text: The food was very average  and the portion large . Fries were overcooked.  The Cresent sandwich  was cold and not freshly made . Service was good . Ordered pie to go and it was average but the price  was on the high side not sure why this still has a great  reputation

9cnJlzOVlVyGW2je9TIZLQ.text: New chef, knowledgeable bartender GAIL, the finest quality beef, and professional staff make Durant's my recent favorite for swill, swank and STEAK.  --great late night dinner. seatings until 10:30, maybe later! --steak sliders only available from the bar --shrimp cocktail, huge and delicious --oysters on the half-shell, scrumptious --petit fllet, perfect every time --crab cakes not consistent, sometimes overcooked and dry --prime rib is juicy and luscious. don't miss the horseradish --horseradish will BLOW THE BACK OF YOUR HEAD OFF hot.  Gail knows her stuff. She'll take you on a trip down memory lane serving up all your Old Man old fashioned favorites from salty dog to boodles martini (yes, martinis are made with GIN _and_ vermouth which actually goes in the glass, you FAKERS!!) all the way to my own five-point manhattan (knob, dubonnet, up, twist, stirred). And at Durant's all drinks are stirred, the way they're supposed to be.  The decor hasn't changed since my last review -- indeed since 1962 -- except for the small street light sconces in the dining room, but they may have been there before too. Tradition.... Tradition. Fresh flowers every time, starlight star recessed ceiling lights and those red silk walls.  They don't call it atomic horseradish for nothing. It will blow the back of your head off. Please bring a net to catch it.

21voS7Ao__6CVD8dlTYR9w.text: Doesn't have the upscale finish that adorn many of the newer high end steak houses nor does its menu flirt with the latest culinary trends.  But what you get is equally great if not better.  You get an old school Phoenix institution serving up meat and potatoes in a manner that harkens back to the original golden days of the American fine dining experience.  A well deserved Phoenix landmark and a must try for any Phoenician seeking to sample the best of what this town has to offer.

SBheDxzWv9w6sVJ9Ykp2bw.text: This is the official birthday restaurant for me & my husband. We drive from N Scottsdale, it is such a treat for us to come here twice a year....feels like we are not in AZ, like a mini vacation from our lives.

02cup3wkQCDv6OpofICuMg.text: Best steak in Phoenix.  So many upstart steakhouses have opened in the Valley lately, and some really are good.  But Durant's remains the gold standard as far as I am concerned.

Q_0cqESsr8G61L0ktQ8nsg.text: Excellent food and this a local favorite!  We have gone here for company celebrations for a special treat!

NnWIIc8Mwj95wABI2Q7ftw.text: We entered through the back- through the kitchen, which was strange but kinda cool.   The bread that the server brings out is so good... I can't express the excitement it brought all of us! Haha. Make sure to ask them to bring it out to you!   I had the New York strip & it was honestly pretty dry. It wasn't awful. But it wasn't as good as I expected it to be. It came with a choice of side & I got a baked potato which was normal.   My wife had the chicken piccata & THAT was DELICIOUS!!! We had the leftovers for dinner the next night & it heated up really well!   I had the creme brulee for dessert & I wasn't really a fan. The dish has an assortment of 3 different types. One was a fruit creme brulee, which reminded me of cough syrup :(.   All in all.. We would go back! For the chicken piccata & that delicious bread!!!

CwLvqj_J3xTG5B8Pj0OoQw.text: As their reputation suggests...PERFECTION!  The steak, shrimp, scallops and bone in ribeye were prepared and presented in a manner to only dreamed about. Old time decor with wood and red velvet adorn the walls. Red leather buttoned booths finish the  ambiance. If you want the best and don't care about money, this is the place.

5y8AbM3UWht7RZNtGcYhxA.text: I've never written about him before, I have a gay father. Well, technically he's not my real father but a man who I met some years ago. Coming out for me was pretty tough, married, house in the suburbs and a wife who I loved deeply. After coming out to her, my family and friends, my therapist suggested I quickly join an online support group for married gay men, and that's where I met Larry Johnson. A kind older man, Larry immediately took me under his wing; living in San Francisco it was easy for him to show me more about our mutual passion, food.    Over the years we've exchanged thousands of emails and I've visited him in SF as often as I could, Larry taught me a great deal about fine dining. Including how to have food adventures and about getting the most out of life's pleasures. While my mom will always be my first food hero, Larry will always be my gay dad and has helped to make me who I am today.   So when he comes into town for a visit I'm always a little stressed out about where to take him for dinner. This visit was easy, I decided to choose something basic and straight forward like steak. Opened 60 years ago, Durant's is not only a Phoenix institution but is also a great steakhouse. While the trend of new steakhouses in the Valley has finally started to taper off, Durant's classic approach is commendable and endearing. I'm talking about fantastically tender steak, understandable sides and professional service.   Steakhouses in general are probably some of the most expensive restaurants in town. So I was ready to spend a mint on dinner but did notice one thing at Durant's, the steaks aren't ala carte. This means when you order a steak you're not only getting soup or salad but you're also getting your choice of accompaniment, what a value.  Entering Durant's from the rear will take you right through the kitchen, dont worry about this, its all part of the charm. You'll see that the kitchen is spotless and most of the cooks turn around and give you a warm smile and a happy hello. Once you get into the dining room its all old school. Black leather booths, crushed red velour wallpaper and dim lighting all set the mood for a relaxed and subdued dinner experience.   Ordering the 16 oz Ribeye Steak ($39.50) was an easy choice for most steak lovers. The ribeye for has the perfect amount of marbling to meat ratio, this means that the meat will be really flavorful without being too fatty. I have to tell you, the ribeye at Durant's was one of the best steaks I've had in years. This thick juicy steak was everything that a steak should be, slightly salty with a distinct smoky char and perfectly tender. I also upgraded my side to the Stuffed Baked Potato ($4.95), think twice baked potato.   Larry's 8oz New York Strip ($29.50) and loaded baked potato were delivered. Not only was the steak perfectly seasoned, it was expertly cooked at medium-rare as requested.   A silence fell over the table as we enjoyed our meals together. Durant's not only impressed me and me made look good, but they made me proud of our restaurant heritage here in Phoenix. Durant's, thank you.

dCEhUEE-JaMUR_ua-qB06w.text: Let's start by the fact that this fine dining establishment has been in existence way since 1950. I planned this restaurant trip in accordance to my visiting sister in law. I wanted to show her what Phoenix has to offer. This was the very place to do so. The history Durant's has to offer is priceless. I believe that is much of it's appeal to me. Another factor in visiting was that is was during Phoenix Restaurant Week.  As you arrive you enter through the back entrance and through the kitchen which is an experience on its own. This is straight up mafioso style in the likes of Goodfellas. That is just the beginning of the experience. Your senses are immediately assaulted. The whiff you get from the cooks making the meal of the patrons already there is invigorating to say the least. You see first hand who is working on the meal you are about to embark on. You hear the chimes of sizzling steaks and steaming veggies. Finally you're at the hottest stand and you tell them your name. They greet you with kindness you really can't buy. They tell you they've been expecting you. You move through the crowded restaurant as it was a very busy night for them. You get to your table and the feel of the leather booths are reminiscent of restaurants Sinatra would visit.  You are seated the waiter introduces himself and you put your drink order. I got a dirty vodka martini. They are known to have exceptional cocktails. Their wine list is extensive which my sister-in law loved. You are given a plate of iced veggies with ranch which for me something I had never seen before. They were fresh and delicious. Secondly we got bread not rolls we got a whole loaf of artisan bread. It was drenched in olive oil and leek concoction. It was buttery and delicious. I could practically live in the olive oil leek mix. We ordered two appetizers the Oysters Rockefeller and fried calamari. I'll start with the Fried Calamari I'm not a big fan of the dish. The calamari you can tell was fresh. It wasn't rubbery at all and crispy in all the right places. On to the best appetizer I have ever eaten. The Oysters Rockefeller came on a steaming hot aluminum plate that held 8 Oysters covered in ooey gooey cheese and bits of crispy bacon. As soon as they hit my palate my taste buds where dancing with joy. Each bite was tender with taste of cheese, bacon and oyster. Nothing over powered the other flavors they all worked in sync. It was an amazing experience. We then ordered our meal. We both got the restaurant week special which included dessert and a glass of wine plus a pre fix entree choice of 3. We both got the 8oz prime rib medium rare. Lets just say that this prime rib does not disappoint. The cut itself a fatty cut cooked to our perfection. Every bite came with a combination of juicy red meat and buttery fat. It was seasoned to perfection. My brother and cousin both ordered the ribeye which for them was cooked to order. It was perfectly marbled. We all had sides which were all perfect in their own way. The asparagus was tender and crunchy all at once. The baked potato perfectly fluffy. The soup was also quite amazing onion cream soup. The taste of sweet onions and delicious cheese was a perfect pair. Overall, you get what you pay for. This place is not cheap. You pay for amazing food, good booze and an amazing experience. If you get the chance to go you most definitely should. This place wins over any fancy steak house in the valley.

J5zphD4S5-S5xF846p5HAw.text: First impression: Wow! I really enjoyed the atmosphere. I felt like I was stepping back into time. I came here with my boyfriend for our anniversary and the meal was outstanding. First we had the shrimp cocktail which was absolutely delicious. The meat of the shrimp tasted like butter, so soft, massive and delicious. I then had the 8oz filet mignon medium well and cooked to perfection. My boyfriend had a Bone in rib eye and it lacked something. It also was not very tender. It lacked something and I we could not figure out what! Anyways, I really enjoyed myself. Don't come here if your looking for new and modern. It is a place that should be appreciated for what it is.

TH0Cj1Y5EInfmlXgXyh_0g.text: Beautiful decor. Definitely an old-school vibe; felt like I was in an episode of Mad Men!  I got a few gin and tonics - very heavy on the pour (which I loved, of course).  The steaks were perfectly prepared. We got a bunch of appetizers; my favorites included the au gratin potatoes, broccolini, shrimp cocktail, and kobe sliders. We also got an order of the oysters, which smelled rotten...we sent it back to the kitchen and they apologized and knocked it off our bill. Minus a star for that.

pWDq9ZwZ4_-363iENGEerA.text: Best steakhouse in Phoenix!  The food is top notch. I love the steaks here and I've been going for almost 20 years. The service is professional and prompt.  The red velvet is great BECAUSE it reminds you of an era long passed.  It is not an inexpensive place so be prepared for that, and I highly recommend getting classed up a bit. It's nice to see people go to a fine dining icon and show some respect by wearing a dress and a suit. At least a tie.  And nostalgia beckons upon you to enter through the kitchen....just like the wiseguys of old. It's a great place, and one of a kind. I hope it stays that way forever!

R7P9VHxUjOppaCFaEwQ4Qw.text: The food, the service, and the atmosphere was perfect. Could have chosen a better place to Celebrate  making room for Desert.

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. To die for
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oh my can&#39;t believe how delicious the food was. Definitely worth every penny. Mmmmm

FJ6H4jb7m8n2hrc6lqtT3g.text: Oh gosh, where do I even begin with this review!? Durant's is a TRUE Phoenix classic. I have been coming here since I was a little girl, as it was my grandpa's FAVORITE place to celebrate his birthday. Sadly, I had not been in 19+ years!!! I told my fiance that this is where we must celebrate our anniversary dinner in honor of my grandpa.   As soon as you sit down, they bring you ice-cold veggies and their delicious ranch for dipping in addition to THEIR BREAD, holy heaven. It is drenched in butter, shallots, and just pure goodness.   Then, you must order one of their famous martinis to start. I'm a cosmo girl! For an appetizer, their JUMBO shrimp cocktail really can't be beat.   All entrees are served with a cold salad or soup. I ordered the Chicken Piccata (my first time ever not ordering a steak here!) and my fiance ordered the Trout and said it was AHHHHmazing. ;) They're really known for their amazing steaks so if you're craving red meat, this is your place. We ended the night with a Choco-tini instead of a heavy dessert because we were so full!   The service is always top notch and we can't wait to celebrate another special occasion here in the future (sooner than 19 years from now!). 5 stars all around!

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Trout!
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Chicken Piccata was amazing!!!! And I had plenty to take home. I mean, 3 chicken breasts?!
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

dDyKHZvLZQhI9w507j4Cqw.text: Don't bother with this place. Steaks taste like supermarket meat, the sides are boring and too big. The decor is laughable and the price for all this is "rip your face off expensive". Enter through the kitchen? No thanks Durants, it is not charming or inviting to enter a restaurant through the kitchen, I am not a busboy or a waiter, I am a customer and I deserve more hospitality than coming in to a  expensive restaurant through a hot noisy kitchen. No reason for anyone to go there as far as I am concerned.

A32639gDve40KGG1S9l5kA.text: If I'm in the mood for steak...I don't mean just some chewy meat that passes for steak but some real life don't need no A-1 sauce, makes me lean back in my chair after every bite type steak, then Durant's is where I head! This time I brought someone who had never been before so we got the whole enchilada...maybe that's the wrong metaphor but you get the idea. Shrimp cocktail to start....drinks...salad...entrees and even the Creme Brulee. Everything was incredibly decadent and the environment was so warm and inviting that this meal was a home run! The staff was incredible and remembered me by name, the suggestions from the staff were on point as well. Not only will I be back but I want to bring as many people here who haven't been as I can. If you consider yourself a Phoenix local and you haven't been to Durant's yet? Shame...All the Shame on you!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

YY_hdwv-r6bocRYI2GSjuw.text: When my best friend comes to town from the Motor City, we head straight over to Durants's for a glass of wine and a beautiful steak dinner... Life doesn't get any sweeter! John the bartender adds to the evening with some good story and fine cocktails. Thanks to the entire staff for always taking good care of us! This place is truly LEGENDARY!!! MTV

65h_ax0DBqt5A4bTBTg07g.text: I haven't been to Durant's in such a long time. It's same old same old. Nothing has changed. You walk through the kitchen to get to the dining room and the host stand is there to greet you. Oh yea don't forget to make a reservation. Dim lighting and red velvet on the walls. Man did I miss this place.   We started off with fried calamari and I would have to say that it was okay. Nice and flaky but it was good. I've had better. They also brought out bread with a basil and onion on top. The bread was so good. Really good but I had to control myself for my entree.  April S was telling me to get the prime rib cause it was so good and actually the best. I was planning on ordering prime rib but our server said that ribeye and filet was the most popular and I really can't resist a good ribeye. I got the 18oz ribeye (sorry April) and it was cooked just perfectly. Nice, juicy and fresh. Boy was that good and I gobbled it all up. Topped that with a baked potato and I'm totally stuffed.   My wife ordered the Salmon with a mango ginger glaze. She really liked it a lot. I didn't get a bite cause I was so fully but everyone who tried it really enjoyed it.   My son got the 12oz filet Mignon with garlic mash. He really liked it and finished it off.   So after dinner everyone had dessert. Let's see. They had Key Lime pie, strawberry spumoni, and Cream Brule tray. They all looked really good and no one was complaining. I just got a cappuccino and that was just outstanding. Just hit the spot after such a big meal.   The service was just outstanding too. Our server was very friendly and really took care of us. Always watching over us. Our drink cups were always filled and our dirty dishes were taken away in a timely manner.   Only complaint is that the restrooms were so tiny. Trying to fit a few people in those bathrooms can be very trying. Just interesting.   So overall we had a really great time. Great food. Excellent service and a nice ambiance. So what else could you ask for. Enjoy.

Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Key Lime pie

k-SWXaHWwpJtCqzSVsDEqQ.text: Durant'a is a top notch restaurant- food, service, experience.  From beginning- entering the restaurant through the kitchen- to dessert Durant'a will impress you. The salad had the Best blue cheese dressing I have ever had and the Manhattan clam chowder was absolutely delicious. The bread with garlic and leeks is Devine. Now to our entrees - prime rib and the bone in ribeye- what can I say, Both were cooked to perfection. Had a side of garlic mashed potatoes which were excellent and also a baked potato which was perfectly cooked with awesome toppings on the side. Finished with the strawberry shortcake dessert which was huge and delectable. On a side note the wine was delicious and surprisingly economical as was the after dinner martini.

dxa1zdG-kyr4kZsJw0mHrg.text: Service and atmosphere were good. If you want sizzler quality, but want to pay an arm and a leg this is the place for you. The filet and rib eye were incredibly dry. For being as expensive as it is, it's hardly worth the quality of food given. We also ordered the crab cake appetizer thinking there would at least be two cakes, but there was only one and it was fishy. We won't be coming back. Save your money and go to Ruth Chris.

e4d3g4rkffYkdv0yg8hWdQ.text: Durant's is sooo good.   I have loved this place for over 30 years. Spectacular steaks and great classic cocktails. Never had a bad meal. I bet I've eaten there 50+ times.   Two major hints - Oysters Rockefeller and strawberry shortcake.   Trust me, the steaks, salads, ambience and appetizers are all first class, but there are some classic treasures on the menu.

7cdzt6SXQjY2rLGdAHKcow.text: Disappointing experience, our waiter (Greg) was a good guy but our NOT waiter CORY singled us out... definitely discrimination.  Walked into the establishment, you walk thru the kitchen which I thought was so cool since Food Network is my favorite, Hell's Kitchen, Top Chef, Beat Bobby Flay!!! Sat down and had a $200 dinner for 2, looked around, the Patrons were older which we don't mind, we came to Phoenix to see Fleetwood Mac lol!   Cory ( who was not our waiter)  told me to turn my phone off (in an extremely aggressive tone)I was perplexed because I was was looking at the picture the  Matrie'D had just took of us so I thought Cory's request was out of line ( btw, the Matrie'D (the bald guy) was also very respectful and nice).  We were shocked because we have traveled across the world  from Australia to Miami and never been talked to in such a disrespectful way.  Btw we ate about 10% of their glutenous serving and left the doggie bag in the kitchen on the way out but still paid the bill and tipped our server +20% because my mom taught me right, where was Cory's mom tonight? . Don't come here ever, unless you want to open yourself up to a bad experience... I can go on and on about my opinions of discrimination but I'm educated enough to to stop while I'm ahead.  Good luck Durant's.  Once the millennials are left you can close your doors, sincerely GEN X.

TxEc4fzR5iBP_X31UyzFYQ.text: Why has it taken me so long to eat here!? Good, solid, old school. Not pretentious. Food was solid, service solid.   We enjoyed everything. The bread is so freaking delicious, I now have a new fondness for leeks.   The highlights are the bread, debris appetizer, ribeye, and strawberry shortcake.   The appetizer is the trimmings from all the steaks on skewers with the most delicious sauce. The meat was just melt in your mouth good. What can I say about the steak, it was great. The strawberry shortcake lives up to it's reputation.

mNZB2LQ1Z-Y_tqNgVpCnBQ.text: Another beautiful Friday lunch at the O.G. famous Durant's. Get the Fatman special #3 you can thank me later. Ice cold martinis custom crafted by Gail, she is a gem. A+

x6q6c11lmExCPcpKx-FR1w.text: The food is very good at this upscale old-favorite Phoenix eatery. I like the traditional-old-school-rat-pack vibe.

ektbLhOTaBmnPrG76rll0A.text: Haven't had a first bite and the ambiance gets a 5 from me. What cool old style restaurant with the wait staff all in waistcoats and bow ties. We entered from the parking lot right though the kitchen which was pretty cool. I ordered the Ruben which was a blend of pastrami and corned beef on rye. A very good sandwich and recommended when you stop by.

0v3A9CKuJ1QVlC_pst0UmQ.text: Durant's is amazing. We find ourselves there several times a year. Never ever a bad meal. Always high quality food. Old school "Rat Pack Mobster" feel which is awesome. I can't wait for our next visit.

qNFbUwQZTa-iTJvw_9Os-g.text: Perfection. My brother and I came in on a Sunday night. Our server was David and he is fantastic. I hope you are lucky enough to have him take care of you. Perfect service from beginning to end. The food is out of this world and the atmosphere is friendly and inviting. Go here. Eat here. You're welcome.

g22uBg7tWryCdMbs62rFRw.text: We we walked in at 3:40 PM in the afternoon, bar was open walked into the kitchen very nice atmosphere. Bartender finally came over after we sat at the bar for a few minutes, we ordered two glasses of wine and asked him what the happy hour specials were he gave us the dinner and lunch menus. We wanted to order a couple of items off of the lunch menu before 4 o'clock as that was the cut off. . He was down at the Other end of the bar talking with coworkers and when we tried to order before 4 o'clock, he said I will be right back I'm sorry I'm busy. He then returned after 4 o'clock and we decided not to order at all. We had high expectations of Durrant's from recommendations we have received from friends. The service at the bar area was substandard but as we observed the other restaurant staff among the tables being served seemed exceptional.

RgyRGYc0wWLJZWeC12zluA.text: Cool atmosphere with the kitchen entrance. I had an excellent open faced roast beef sandwich, which tasted like prime rib. The garlic mashed potatoes were tasty as well. I'll have to go back sometime for dinner.

JpYMqMvPx6lYwIrxehSz5Q.text: Wow best dining experience I have had in a decade.  Great food and service. The staff are friendly professional and attentive.  I will definitely be back for my next special occasion.

hmoy_Uu1Yfl-t8l8emwLkQ.text: Great place for a steak!   You walk in through the back like it's goodfellas. The inside has a very classic vintage feel to it. Even on a Wednesday night it was busy, make a reservation.   They're soup and bread both hit the spot. I had a bone in ribeye and my friend had the top sirloin. We were both more than happy.   My only regret is not having coffee and tiramisu.

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

GCER9GQNZQZxptpCLWLW3A.text: Durant's is as classic as a 57 Chevy; then again, this is one of the most classic restaurants in Phoenix that I've ever seen (and I'm a native). The food is amazing but it's gonna cost you some coin.   I went with a large group for lunch and this place is known for their steak sandwich ($30) or some of their other steak dishes... the prime rib looked delicious.  I'll come back when I get the Christmas bonus.

1mWnD30h6VtfMrB1fuyRmw.text: All roads lead to Durant's!  Another visit to this superb restaurant, another evening of bliss. We (my wife and I) took my wife's mother out to Durant's for a belated Mother's Day and ordered again the grilled scallops with garlic mashed potatoes. The complimentary soup of the day was navy bean soup, surely the best I've ever had. The garlic/leek buttered bread was a little bit soggy but tasty nevertheless. The main dish was even better than we had before and we ended with a slice of the best key lime pie we ever tasted. There are a lot of fancy restaurants in Phoenix but Durant's is by far the best and the classiest. Can't wait to go back to Durant's in the very near future.

kQ2Bs582AdCYotcxKYitKg.text: Husband and I have been here a number of times and always enjoyed ourselves thoroughly.  The best part about this place is the atmosphere.  I always feel like I am in an episode of Mad Men and that I need to order a gimlet and smoke a cigarette (nevermind the fact that I don't know what a Gimlet is, and I don't smoke).  Last night, we met some friends here for drinks before heading over to watch a show at the Phoenix Theater.  It was a great meeting place.  We all had martinis (delicious) and then walked over to the theater.  This is not only an excellent dinner place, but also wonderful for your pre or after show drinks!

oVKly2ngRleT3q70cCSDqw.text: If the Rat Pack invaded Phoenix, we'd know where to find them...Durant's of course! Enter through the kitchen into this windowless establishment topped with red velvet walls, red velvet booths, dirty martinis and old Phoenix at your fingertips. If you've ever wondered what the Valley was like before the sushi restaurant invasion, just take a look at Durant's and you've peaked into the past.   Drive by Durant's and you'll see nothing but a cement building with a mobster-like neon sign out front. If I didn't know better, I'd say it takes a secret invite to get to walk through the mysterious entrance. But, lucky for me, it's not 1950-1960 and they don't require a special handshake to eat here. I was lucky enough to go here recently for a Friday night out on the town and given it's the holiday season, I grinned from ear to ear when I stepped inside Durant's and saw old school Christmas decorations like I'd just stepped into a scene of A Christmas Story.   First let's start with the cocktails because that's how every 1950/60's classic movie starts. I know. I should have ordered the famous Dirty Martini. But, will Frank Sinatra haunt my dreams if I admit I'm not a huge Dirty Martini fan? I thought about it, but I just couldn't make myself pull the martini trigger. Next time, Frank...just for you, I promise! I did have a nice glass of wine though and after a taste of a Belvedere pim's cup, I also learned that Durant's knows how to pour one stiff drink!   After the cocktails, the evening of cuisine began with the most buttery and garlicky loaf of bread staring us in the face. It's worth every garlic breath bite -- as long as everyone at your table consumes it too. For the entree, I had the wedge salad and the scallops. The salad was creamy and delicious and I like to pretend it was fat free (most definitely not). My meal came with not one, not two but six scallops. I wasn't expecting such generous portions! Top it off with garlic mash potatoes (yes, more garlic) and I had one delicious meal! I was so stuffed I couldn't finish my scallops which I feel like is a sin and I should be ashamed of myself. But the meal was spectacular and I can't wait to go again.   And... here's a huge bonus! Durant's is celebrating 60 years of being fabulous which is such an amazing accomplishment! What's even more amazing is that they are giving their guests a present when shouldn't it be the other way around? I don't know how long this will last, but if you visit during their celebration period, you'll receive a black poker chip (so fitting right?) and it's good for a free lifetime dessert every time you visit and have an entree! So it looks like I've been targeted as Durant's future regular guest and I'm happy to take on the task!

eXmIxqCYMxI8SOXDyg2U1w.text: Waited at the bar for 45 minutes to order food. Got to the point where I was just curious how long it would take. After seeing other people eat and enjoy their meals at tables I just decided to leave and eat elsewhere. Nice place......food looks great. Wouldn't know how it tasted.

-3nqmiRn1wLquFncVn87kQ.text: This place is highly overrated.  We made reservations and we were seated right below a tv that was showing a game in the lounge area.  The whole time we were eating, people were stopping and gawking right in front of our table watching the game.  Not only customers, but employees would pass by (on purpose) just to take a quick peek at the game.  It was quite distracting and annoying.  On to the food:  The bottle of moscato was amazing!  We ordered the crab cake with chipotle aioli and it was quite tasty and very flavorful.  We ordered the sirloin steak (medium) and it was quite chewy.  I'm not a red meat fan, but I really was not that impressed on the steak.  I also chose the sweet potato fries and that as well was not that impressive.  I have had better sweet potato fries elsewhere.   The tiramusu, however, was to die for and probably the best thing out of the meal.  On the bottom of the tiramusu was some kind of crunch of some sort - I love crunch on dessert!

WFVdm7WuBi-J8R_LyYOV5A.text: Although we have been going to Durant's for years, we chose Durant's as one of our AZ Restaurant week pick.  It is of course one of our favorite places. Durant's has a veritable plethora of cliental.  During restaurant week you may sit next to someone who frequents Durant's or someone who is experiencing it for the first time, as we did.  It can be difficult not to give direction but the staff is very good at pointing you the way.  We are fortunate to have made acquaintance with a few of the wait staff. One or two I have known prior to there tenure at Durant's. It is coveted and difficult to get a job at Durant's, you must wait for someone to leave and that rarely happens.  One person I really miss is John, the bartender, who served for over 40yrs.  He was an icon at Durant's. When I was younger and had a lot less money I often sat at the bar with friends and chatted with him over a martini.  He taught me some tricks and life lessons in his quiet way. I had my fist and possibly last taste ever of the most amazing liquid desert, Louis XIII de Remy Martin, cognac. When you have waiters who are dedicated, dressed, able to interact one on one with each type of client, they bring you the best food & drinks, how can you go wrong?  If you want the feel of a good old classy chop house, that has the character, this is the place.  There are some other Steakhouses that offer great stakes, however, Durant's will remain my favorite for more personal reasons. I prefer the Rib-eye or Delmonico depending on my mood. Hit Durant's at lunch and have one of their burgers. If you like chicken livers give those a try here, my friends dad, who is Greek, even got the chef to wrap them in bacon for us one time. Talk about heart attack but boy were they good.  The Oysters Rockefeller are great.  If you get to visit when Stone Crabs are in at Durant's, take advantage of the Stone crabs they offer. Or get the Crabs and Steak.  They offer and extensive fine wine list. My recommendation for red wine drinkers like myself, check out the wine list on their website prior to dining. When you arrive at to dinner, have them open the wine and let it breath at your table. This way it will come to temperature out of the cellar and open up for a much more enjoyable taste with your meal.  I always order the salad with Roquefort, Durant's house dressing.  However, on this last visit Christopher ordered the shrimp bisque and it was amazingly rich and tasty.  Once yearly in late spring they offer a few bottles from their end of bin list.  Great bottles at half the price. I am pretty sure that is in the month of May.  I can go on about the food and the dining experience but just go there and have your own experience, taste it.  From the time you enter through the rear kitchen door and are greeted with smiles & welcomes from the wait & kitchen staff you will get to the Maitre D' with a smile already on your face as your eyes adjust to the surroundings of dark wood and red toile wallpaper.  Hey, get there early and hit the bar for your favorite cocktail. With the new no smoking laws in AZ you won't get the cigar or cigarette smoke that reminds me of the old days sitting at the bar with friends, talking to John. Good Friends, Great Steaks ,& the Best Booze, are the necessities of life.   -Jack Durant, Founder.

awj05O7CbYXt0X5NnkQMug.text: Durant's is one of my favorite restaurants in the valley, and every experience is memorable.  I have never been disappointed, and now that I think of it.... it's time to make a reservation. Don't forget to turn your cellphone off :)  Update:  I would also like to mention that this is a steakhouse.  I have heard that some people have been disappointed with other dishes, but I cannot comment on that because I have yet to try anything beside steak and hamburger.  Those are always my go-to dishes (and let's not forget the incredible strawberry shortcake).    Challenge of the day: see if you can find the "Hoof Hearted" name on the wall.  Every-time I see it, it cracks me up.

WgB7SP0YmFyYaBC4tmjptg.text: Just went back for my one year anniversary and what else can be said other than Durant's is a gem in a lackluster city like Phoenix.  This place is about great detail and experience finished off with some great food.  I cannot tell you about it, you have to come in for yourself. Yes you will break the piggy bank if you are not used to ordering a 40 dollar steak but hey that's life.

jQNDVGiSwGrs1JQBS5mGDg.text: Been coming here for 30 years.  Back when I was a poor student waiting tables, after our shift my coworkers and I would come down here for late night drinks and dinner. Nothing fancy just good meat and potatoes.  After a visit to Durant's recently, I get the feeling they are trying to compete with a Morton's or Ruth's Chris style, white table cloth place.  It was bloody expensive - even now when my wallet is a little fuller than it was back then.  Fancy wine, fancy food, replaced all the old grouchy servers with your chipper ones.  The food is still good but its so highfalutin now. Back in my day there were cowboys, and old ladies in bedroom slippers at the bar.  Awesome. Doubt if college kids could come in Durant's and be able to feast and still make rent.  The prices, just wow.  Keep it cheap and funky!

uSHksnhLS9VEVyAitzqQOQ.text: We met friends here based on their suggestion, and it certainly saved me a lot of future time, as I won't have to look around for a place I like.  This is the exact type of place I like for a Steak house, absolutely perfect.  Some of the negative reviews here have me baffled.  Either 1) They went to a different place and got confused.  2) Can't tell the difference between vintage or old.  3) If you put 5 different quality steaks in front of them they would have picked the one drenched in the most sauce or glaze and based their opinion of taste on that.  With that being said, Outstanding appetizers,  incredible meal,  superb drinks, impeccable service, friendly staff, and I could go on and on.  Place was clean, decor was great, maybe the negative reviews were disappointed that the word "Infused" wasn't on the menu somewhere, or the fact that there wasn't some sort of a pumpkin ginger martini twist thing.  This place is a real joint, not some trendy flash in the pan that you'll regret that you ate at once it goes out of style.  Lighten up and enjoy the experience.

-yEbufUogISFvvMTsA5YTA.text: Love Durants. Fabulous atmosphere, service and food at a very reasonable price. Our guests loved it too. Will come back again and again.

yh7p3Ji0U4Lt_lnMxJygfQ.text: On a recent trip to Phoenix, my husband and I decided to stop by Durant's to try out their steak.  From what I heard and read, we had to try Durant's at least once during our trip.   Overall, we were pretty disappointed.  The only saving grace for this place is the decor which makes you feel like you walked into an old style restaurant in Hollywood.   The place was packed and crowded which is nice to see but the food was average at best.  My husband ordered the Cajun steak, which was their special for the night but it was extremely salty.  I had to dunk the meat in water to wash off the excess salt in order to swallow down the steak.   The prime rib I ordered was over cooked.   The garlic bread that everyone is referring to is terrible.  It's just french bread dunked in a bowl of olive oil with some garlic shavings on top.  Nothing special there.      The sauteed mushrooms we ordered as a side was also extremely salty.   Do they even taste their food before serving it to people?    If you're visiting Phoenix, skip this place because it's definitely not worth it.  We wasted a meal by coming here.

HLhKuTAhks9gX1Fak_SPUA.text: Make reservations! We showed up with a party of 15 on a very busy night but they did not turn us away and took care of us. A couple of us ordered rib-eyes medium rare. One came out perfect the other medium, validating some of the inconsistency remarks made about this place. Fortunately, I enjoy my rib-eyes rare, m-rare, or medium, so it wasn't a big deal.   The bread they serve prior to the meal was awesome. Bread drowning in leeks, garlic, olive oil and butter. Sounds weird? Don't knock it til you try it.

FHRYgcWa13d9qMMMKJAm5g.text: The entrance is cool walking through the kitchen. The main Chef was not there and my NY Steak was over cooked, had to send back. Took awhile to get a new one. Was OK, I will probably not return.

qpbLY9JcwmL-fEW8wBDVVQ.text: I kinda loved it. I took a special someone for a birthday dinner. The atmosphere was great. I loved the dark wood and the deep red walls and old-school mobster feel. Our table wasn't ready so we started off at the bar with some of their famous martinis, which were delicious. However, the bartender who served us seemed a little overwhelmed. It was pretty busy. And the barback/bartender who actually collected our payment when our table came ready acted as if we were an inconvenience for him. Boo. Lost a star for that.  But all was restored when we were seated and began our meal. The service was great. We had a delicious meal. The Humble Steak was amazing. The pork chops were amazing. And the sides and appetizers were amazing. The portions were bigger than expected and we walked out fat and happy with a full-on grocery bag of delicious leftovers. YUM!   Also, I left my credit card and the staff was resourceful enough to find my phone number to call and notify me that they would hold my card in the safe until I could come get it. When I came back to pick it up, they quickly and politely returned my card after verifying my identification.   I'll definitely be back.

6J3IkhzExI_GgKY1YhT4XQ.text: Durant's is old school.  Rat-Pack old school.  The reason elderly people love it is that is their style of gourmet food-- very traditional gourmet American fare. This was the fancy food of the fifties. The reason young people like it is because they romanticize a past that they weren't a part of.  My point is, it is not a place to go expecting a culinary revolution.  The food is very good, but not gastronomically exciting.  That said, this place is fantastic.  When you arrive, you walk through the kitchen, which sets the tone for the entire experience.  I imagine myself scurrying through the kitchen with Old Blue Eyes himself, smoking cigarettes, entering the back to avoid fanfare.  The decor is a striking fifties art deco, and everything is pleasantly vintage.  I can't help myself, I always order seafood when I eat here, and recommend the scallops.  Gotta have a gin martini too.  If there was ever a time or place to have a real martini, this is it.

DBsHaScN4BSQn9OfRMtPqw.text: This is a place I have been to before and had good memories and high expectations.  Unfortunately I had one of my worst dining experiences ever.  Asked for a steak medium rare.  Served medium well.  Brought out a new steak...very rare.  By this time everyone else in the party was finished eating.  I left without having an entree.  However, they were magnanimous, they did not charge me for the steak I did not eat.   This place caters to those looking for a window into a nostalgic past, which is why I scheduled a birthday dinner at this establishment.  I left realizing going back in time is not all that it is cracked up to be...sometimes it just leads you to lousy food from a place well past its prime.  Goodfellas, old school vibe, please....look past the pictures on the walls and the red leather banquettes and the actual output is really just mediocre at best at premium prices.  This place is really very weak...I am just sayin....  They do not deserve to celebrate their 65th anniversary.  Service recovery was weak at best.  They have their regulars which keep this place busy, but there is no longer any pride in serving a good meal.  They really do not care about you.  So sad to see this establishment with a great history to descend to mediocrity on a good day.

9OATPfIjbwRwn_IPO9nN5Q.text: Great Service, Great Wine, Great Food, Great Ambiance.  I always come here when I am in Phoenix on business.  I am very comfortable coming alone and always meet people at the bar after I eat.  The bartendars are very friendly and accomodating -- gave me and a date directions to another restaurant while we had a glass of wine here.  I have had their oysters -- excellent.  I have tried their rib eye steak, excellent.  Their bread is a must have...even if you are watching your carbs.  Kitchen is very clean.  Wine is stored at the right temperature.  Just a great place all around.

jsa5RwdrvbEgt8DqZvKFnA.text: If you're looking for a throwback kind of restaurant that also serves a very good steak, then Durant's is your place.  The decor definitely gives off the gangster vibe.  I'm not sure if I would consider this restaurant to have too much of a romantic ambiance because the lighting was quite bright and it was quite loud.  I would definitely recommend that if you coming with a date (as I did) to ask for one of the corner tables because they are a little more private and allow the chance for conversation.  If we weren't sitting right next to each other we probably would not have been able to hear each other.  I didn't have to ask for the corner table, but I've heard that it is best to request it.   I didn't really get the feel that the waiting service was that different than most restaurants with people who actually know how to wait tables.  I got the filet and it was excellent.  I would recommend this restaurant more for a boy's night out rather than a date.

PqmnnKDa6S1-iwoin1Nmnw.text: Don't bother trying their Happy Hour. There are only 20 seats at the bar and they are soon taken up by regulars. They do not allow you to sit  in the booths in the Bar and have Happy Hour amenities. And if you try, the wait staff is nothing short of RUDE and pompous. We used to go to this restaurant and enjoyed it, but after this experience, there are too many really good restaurants with a much more pleasant staff. Including SWITCH next door!

nCBABegMkRs5Wk7klaSpjg.text: Should not even be a 1 star. went there for a good steak, 2 meals $300.00,+ no Liquor.. what a dump in every respect. You want a steak?  Go to Okeechobee Steakhouse. West Palm Beach, Florida $65.00 Best steak in USA.  100 % better everything than this Durants Dump.

PZ21fvHChK7aPF-OKd4aRw.text: You can't go wrong here. Its a staple in the downtown community where you can rub elbows at the bar with some great Phoenicians.  The steaks are top notch, service is great, shrimp cocktail is to die for, I've never had a bad meal here ever. I've been a patron for 17 years and never hesitate when someone mentions going to Durant's intact I usually drop what I'm doing to go.  The ambiance is completely mobster from the kitchen entrance to the red tucked booths, and dimly lit atmosphere. You must experience Durant's if you have never been or doing business in Phoenix from out of town.  Truly a top notch establishment!

fiYnqojMr17dS4cAsu6A3g.text: Walking in through the not so glamorous backdoor was an interesting experience. I was not too fond of the all red interior but felt like I walked into a movie from the 70's.   We were greeted by one of the kindest waitresses I'd ever been served by; she was polite, charming and witty- the perfect combination of a hostess!   By the time I was done with the not-so-side-dish-more-like-giant-main dishes, I was stuffed! The garlic potatoes were heavenly and thick and savory without any fat gravy on top. After the giant side dishes, I was greeted by a humongous rib-eye steak. I was unfortunately too full to enjoy the steak in all its glory but I can say that the key lime cake for dessert had me swooning by the end of the meal.   I'd recommend this place for huge steak lovers but if you like a lighter dinner, don't be too ambitious and order an 8oz rib-eye like I did... A smaller steak with scrumptious side dishes and key lime cake at the end of the meal will more than suffice.

IOwJtHjfqUDoBBFBJ0bn5A.text: You mean I can't give them 6 stars?  Food was amazing.  Service was phenomenal.  I intended on giving the full on review of everything I got, but I'm just too full.  If I ever travel to PHX, I plan on stopping here.  Amazing!

DxuyJsIRg6KOS9DV0mheEw.text: Best food I had for a long time. It was so good that I dreamt about it lol a bunch of my friends and I are going there soon

fOpSNXu428KjQFN9BW1EqQ.text: I love Durant's, I've been going there since I moved to the Valley 11 years ago.  My husband and I love sitting at the bar and enjoying the ambiance, the great cocktails and food.  I knew about the famous dessert chip, but I never tried to get one.  Every time we have guests from out of town, we love to take them there and guide them in through the kitchen.  It is always a hoot to see their face.  We went for our big dinner this past October and I had as usual my lemon drop martini and my husband had his margarita.  We started with the shrimp cocktail, it is really delicious, the shrimp are huge and the cocktail sauce has a lot of horseradish.  We decided to split the larger fillet and have it with the mash potatoes and some steamed asparagus.  The fillet was delicious, super tender and flavorful.  The mashed potatoes were creamy and garlicky.   For dessert we had the strawberry shortcake, it was good, but not my favorite.  I like their creme brulee much better, but I wanted to try this one.  I got my chip! I just need to remember where I put it, haha.

3DlYiw3h5e0IqHe6ZIwDEg.text: Very unassuming place. From the outside you wouldn't give this place a second glance. I found out about it by asking one of the guys at the hotel i was staying at and im glad i asked. Once inside this place reminded me of an old style steak house. Dark woods, dimly lit and the wait staff and bartenders in traditional black and white formal wear with bowties!! Ive been in these places before so i knew i was in for a treat.   Onto the food. I started with a half dozen oysters on the half shell. They were delicious. While eating the oysters they brought out some bread which i didnt think twice about really. I dont typically eat bread when i got out because it just fills you up. That said, after the oysters i decided I'd have a piece. The bread was so f*ckn good. Its a small loaf that sitting in a mix of oil chives garlic and shaved parm cheese. I couldn't stop eating it. I may go back after writing this just for the bread. Its phenomenal! Dont pass it up. I ordered the bone in ribeye. I was praying that the bread wasnt going to be the best part of the meal and it wasnt. The steak was cooked to perfection. If you even think of putting steak sauce on a steak here you might be asked to leave. Now I travel a ton for work and have ate in some nice steakhouses but this place ranks right up there with the best ive ever had.   I didnt get into dessert unfortunately and the place is pricey but break open your wallet one time if your in the Phoenix area and youre a steak lover. Its a thing of beauty. You will NOT be disappointed.

UW6slYEc7ke5VkA56-ZBfA.text: I haven't been to this place in about seven years. I decided to take my girlfriend for her birthday. And I always like the entrance to the kitchen. I think it's really cool and really old-school and I like that they have an updated it in a long time or at least made it seem like it hasn't been updated in a long time. I ordered the prime rib and I ordered the jumbo shrimp cocktail. They were probably the fresh shrimp cocktail I've had in years the prime rib was perfectly cooked the owes you was great and the horseradish was extra hot which is how I love it. The bread that came out was unbelievable as well and I can't believe I ate as much as I did we finished off with my girlfriend getting the Apple cobbler and I got the cheesecake. I love that the desserts are so homemade. Don't let down is that that they used to have the desserts on a tray that they bring out and then you just check it off of it but apparently that's gone. Anyway Ricardo is been there for about 19 years was a great waiter make good suggestions and looking forward to not saying away for seven years this time.  I use this with Siri so if something looks really messed up blame Siri
