u_yLUFbcEH53bks6ivWiuw.text: Solid 4 stars. Steak was above average, wine list is unimpressive (except for high end significant reds), service is average. Nothing close to del friscos or Jeff rubys.

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

9OdWQ_4r8L7VlqJIhvR8og.text: Last night we headed here for dinner.  Neither one of us had ever been, but my hubby had heard wonderful things about it.  They were right!  I grew up in Miami during the 60's/70's, and this restaurant brought back so many memories of my family going to fancy steakhouses, that I practically couldn't contain myself.  The decor is dark wood paneling with red brocade/velvet wallpaper, dark red leather booths, fresh flowers and waiters wearing vests and bow ties.  Honestly, I was expecting Sinatra and the rest of the Rat Pack to come waltzing in any second.  Now, onto the food...  When we sat down, we were immediately brought a crudite platter and bread (which was incredible!!).  We both ended up ordering the same thing, end cuts of prime rib with garlic mashed potatoes.  I got a salad and hubby got the clam chowder.    A little side story here...when I was younger, my dad told me to always order the end cut of prime rib, because I don't like rare/bloody meat.  This way, when you order, they know that you want medium well.  In most restaurants, whenever I've ordered the end cut, they still ask me how I'd like it done, which sorta pisses me off.  Our waiter, Robert (who was attentive and friendly), just said "a good choice", when I ordered mine.  That made me smile!  He knew exactly what I wanted, and that's exactly what I got.  The meal was so delicious and everything was timed perfectly.  We received our appetizers, which were very good.  As soon as we finished them, the busboy (who also made sure our glasses were always full), came by to pick up the plates, and as soon as he did, our entrees arrived around the corner.  I'm telling you...timing is everything.  I really hate when they bring the entrees and you're still attempting to finish your soup/salad or any other app you've ordered.  The prime ribs were so mouth-watering.  They weren't too fatty and melted in your mouth.  I dipped mine into the horseradish cream (they also had the option of raw horseradish, which we declined).  And, the garlic mashed were creamy and a perfect accompaniment to the prime ribs.  For dessert, I chose a raspberry sorbet (something light and refreshing) and hubby got the trio of creme brulee's (mixed berry, Bailey's and chocolate).   Overall, it was an experience that brought back memories and tickled the taste buds.

IvK2VbUOAr8nSTEYkwGCLg.text: Always had top notch service, the ambiance is unmatched, and the food is always on point.

m_4Gxsb3-PZEjuhRII7i7A.text: Old school joints are my fave, especially since everything in AZ is a chain. Steak was great, wine was good. Definitely will come back again!

eBHKZZN-gkCM66jIgX1h0g.text: My hubby and another couple of good friends went to Durant's to celebrate our wedding anniversaries. (45 yrs & 54 yrs respectively) What a great night. We had reservations, came in the back door were greeted inside the kitchen as well as by the host when we arrived in dining room. We had appetizers, Spinach Dip, Oysters Rockefeller and Raw Oysters. All were superb. We had cocktails with the appetizers (2 - Old Fashions 1-Cosmo and 1 Cabernet wine) Dinner arrived and it was hard to pick the best but I say it was the Lamb Chops that were divine. The Crab Cakes had a delicious dipping sauce sprinkled on the plate and the cakes were moist, meaty and delicious. The guys had a big slice of Prime Rib that melted in your mouth and a Rib Eye Steak that was medium rare to perfection. We know that its rumored that Durant's has the best martini's around so the ladies each ordered a Dirty Martini to go with dinner. We will definitely do that again! The guys picked a couple great glasses of wine from the extensive wine list. I might add our waiter was the perfect gentleman and catered to all our wants and needs. We topped the evening off with a couple Creme Brulee and a slice of Key Lime Pie. Thank you Durant's for such a memorable evening. The staff, the food and the ambiance can't be beat. Your the Best!!

W_UE2fjJbMXBaMpUwv5XJQ.text: Best steak place in Arizona by far. This is where the martinis are flowing and the steaks are cooking. I go there at least 3-4 times a month. Ask for Natalie or Ron. Those are my favorite  servers. From the moment you go into this historic restaurant (go through back door via kitchen), you are greeted with a friendly host. They all know me by name which reminds me of a Cheers atmosphere. Here is what I recommend. Start off with some oysters and shrimp cocktail, bone in ribeye (med rare), caesar salad with anchovies, either the waffle fries or garlic mash.A must is the martinis. Check out an extra dirty belvedere martini up with blue cheeses olives or get a bottle of their amazing red wine (Truly). And for dessert...the strawberry shortcake (massive). You can't go wrong here.

oWiREuAhPPpxmr4UOO0Vjg.text: This is one of those Phoenix landmarks you simply must experience.  Like a blast from the past, the old "mobster style" steakhouse with the big red booths and red velvet wallpaper.  You're just waiting for one of the Rat Pack to come around the corner at any second.   I must say that food is only second to the service, which is first class in this joint.    The food is top notch and, in my opinion, the best steakhouse in Phoenix.  But that service and quality come at a price.  I admit, I have never been there for dinner, because it is simply way to expensive for my budget.  My co-workers and I like to splurge once in a while and have a nice lunch, which (even with my free dessert token) costs around $25 dollars per person.  I go for the hot roast beef sandwich served with roast sirloin of beef with gravy, garlic mashed potatoes, fresh roasted vegetables and soup or salad.  And the fresh baked bread with the garlic, leek butter is just too hard to pass up, and you'll find yourself asking for more.  A lot of my co-workers go with the burger which, as they all say, is the best burger in Phoenix, and can rarely finish all of it.  We are lucky enough to be holders of the "free lifetime dessert" tokens they have and so how can we say "no" to a free dessert.  The strawberry shortcake is a no-brainer and, as all their desserts are, big enough to share.  The strawberries are fresh and ripe, with fresh whipped cream, however it is served with more of a "cake" than a "shortcake," which in my opinion makes it better.  So for a unique experience, this place can't be missed.  But if you are on a budget, plan to come for lunch!  Reservations are recommend, and in most cases necessary...

QUUOFYs0n_BFwBwr32GMGQ.text: My bf had made a surprise reservation for here.He knows that I've been wanting to go. Everything was phenomenal!I had the New York strip along with rice pilaf and a vegetable meat soup. He had the top sirloin with garlic mashed potatoes,those were the creamiest potatoes ever !!!!For cocktails, I enjoyed a Washington Apple and he had a Whisky Sour The server was highly attentive, very polite and kind with a sense of humor .They were accommodating as well they allowed a delivery of beautiful rose to be waiting for us at the table for me .Anyhow everything was up excellent!

xkIXudKBrF7tLTKh9aZHvA.text: Durant's provided exactly what they are known for. My girlfriend and I were there for Valentine's day. It was very busy but expected. We arrived early and grabbed a couple bar stools when they opened up, had a great straight up dirty martini and she had a glass of Cab. They poured her a couple tasters until she found the right Cab for her taste. Res was for 845, we were sat by 9 but it was very evident that the staff was working hard to get people seated asap so we were not phased. Dinner started with a great bottle of wine our server recommended, the crab cakes, soup and salad, then my prime rib cooked to a perfect med rare, and her grilled scallops in herb cream sauce (to die for!). Yes, place was crowded and busy but in our giant booth for two, we were just fine and unaffected by any excess noise. All in all great experience, and yes, bring your wallet. If you are looking for a quick cheap steak, I think there is an Applebees nearby.

Z2l0vba09Slo_k1Q9ot4pg.text: I called and made a reservation the day of and the person that answered the phone was very polite and accommodating. The mussels were amazing and worth the drive alone! Everything from beginning to end was delicious.

M98i7b_UVYezdIjpakqjnw.text: My client suggested I go to Durants by describing it as "kinda feels like an old whore house but the foods great". Its a dark place with red velvet walls. On the outside it looks like a club because it  has no windows. Once you walk in, you're blinded by the darkness. When you walk out, the blinding Arizona sun sobers you up while shaming you for going to Durants.   On the real, I had the BBQ burger for lunch. Big and messy. I was a little scared to get the burger less than medium because of my client's description. Wouldn't recommend it.

bi2K_IfPgdpUXcH9UY7g8w.text: Had a wonderful time with friends. Excellent service, there were even lovely ladies singing carols to the tables. Had the scallops which were just incredible. Tried steak and lobster at the table and it was all phenomenal. The servers never let me water go under half full which is so nice!

R2rIuFcRTgPG1iU7Q6jZZg.text: I loved this steak house.  It can get a little pricy, but it was a very nice dinner.  If you like intense horserattish, this is the place to go.   The waiter courteously mentioned that it is spicy.   I dabbed it and it was out of control!   I was hooked :)   I'll come back again!

2IT4xJE-tYS1jLIOsg1mYg.text: We ordered top sirloin steak, filet mignon, and prime rib. Service was great, but food was just okay. Honestly,  I have had better steaks that were more reasonably priced. With this price I would've expected the steak to be spot on delicious. My fiance enjoyed his filet mignon, but his friend and I were very disappointed in our food.

SJNLEhJQmUPionNr9X8AKw.text: Great food! The prime rib melts in your mouth and you can "split" with a friend making it a very affordable meal!

3G1w5uswPKU4az5OOoX5CQ.text: Stepping into Durant's feels like stepping into history.  If the walls could talk, they would have some great stories about all the notable Phoenicians that have shared a meal there!  You'll get a great steak meal, with a more unique ambiance than your typical steak house.  Great choice for lunch or dinner!

bGVXKbInnnIL6CcMmJnE-g.text: Meat, glorious meat!    I love me some steak from Durant's.  One of the best steakhouses in town, as far as I am concerned.  Have been many times over the years, and went again with a friend a couple weeks ago.  Entering Durant's is always the bomb.  Since there is nowhere to park in front, your best entrance is through the back door and the kitchen.  Talk about getting your stomach rumbling!  Walking through (on the red carpet), and having the cooks shout a greeting is always fun.  And the smell of all the meat cooking......drool!  The ambiance is always great, and the servers have always been very knowledgeable of their menu.  Food was there fairly quick, and absolutely enjoyed my medium-rare prime rib.  So goooooood!  I always recommend Durant's to any of my friends saying they are looking for a steakhouse.  Give it a whirl!  You won't regret it!

Na_CDy96s3kIomBbwVsMaw.text: Best. Chop House. Ever.   This place is a Phoenix institution and a must-visit for any out of two visitor who loves steak. From the meat puppets with your beer at the bar, to the amazing garlic bread, to the anchovies on your Caesar salad, to the lump crab meat, asparagus. and bearnaise on your 12 oz. filet mignon, to your very drinkable $30 bottle of wine, and delicious chocolate mousse, no detail is overlooked. The service is excellent and there is simply no better old school ambiance in the entire valley.

OI17HcdsHWlkq2RUyNoN3g.text: Great service, good steak!  Would also recommend their Caesar salad!

yW5v_95btSWTN3q2vEm7kQ.text: We have been to Durant's a couple of times and it was great. However, upon going for my birthday dinner tonight found that the service and the food was less than stellar. My steak was very dry, so dry that I had to ask for Au jou  to go with it and that still didn't help. Told the waiter that the steak was not right, he never even offered to get me anything else. He said oh we will take it off the bill and I'll send a manager over to check in with you. Well that's fine and dandy except said manager never even showed up to apologize. Then decided to order the creme brulee for dessert since I really didn't have any dinner, I could've made better creme brulee at home. The waiter never even asked me why I didn't eat my dessert and by this time, I am just too tired to mess with it.  For such a "high caliber "restaurant I would've expected better. What a $&$!? Birthday dinner!

BDbxmgQlo3OPuHU47thATw.text: GREAT local spot.  My manager was in town and we grabbed lunch here on a friend's recommendation.  Had the 8oz filet and it was cooked to perfection. Food, service, cocktails, and atmosphere were all excellent.  Can't wait to return for dinner.

ShPIR3jd0CVZk_IwJFx2zg.text: Durant's has fine steaks.  That's about it.  We were seated near the bar (it was the BCS game next day) and it was rawdy.  The booth was cramp that my back was pressed against the seat back.  The table will not fit all three dishes we ordered.  The waiter did not have a priority in servicing us.  In fact, we waited for several minutes before he came back to snap a picture for us.  The prime rib and porterhouse were delicious.  The plates were not warmed, so eat fast.  For the price, I would skip this one next.

vfWm7hA22c-BhTOrbutQvA.text: Valet parking was offered in Durants's ad but the valet employees just sat on his but not offering service.  When asks if he could park our car he stated you can park your own car. Informed management after that it just got worse. Service was slow waitress was rude if your black hispanic or any other race but white your treated like your not welcomed. Raceist employees work here.  Food was good I can't say that made up for treatment we got. Unfortunately  unless your white you will be treated like SHIT.  It so sad in this day & age there are still ignorant people like the ones working at Durants at 2611 N Central Ave. Phoenix AZ 602-264-5967

hHxT9VCb5iFP12w0O1mafQ.text: To really enjoy Durants you have to have dinner at the bar. The service at the bar is excellent and the Durant regulars know that the bar is where to strike up a conversation with your neighbors. And try a gin martini - it's excellent.  Like other reviewers have noted, the service expected for the prices is not experienced in the restaurant proper. While the food is the best. My favorite is the prime rib - medium rare - with garlic mash potatoes and asparagus.

DYjusKUsi-v0xMTHQ51M6A.text: I had to meet someone here because I had to interview him for this thing I am writing about him. You might have seen me. I was the guy dressed like pre-success David Foster Wallace. The contract scrawled on a napkin and signed at the bar before the passing of an envelope of money prevents me from giving any more detail.   Also this story makes me seem way more awesome when it's left a little blurry... blurry like I started to get after a few strongly poured cocktails at the bar. Thank FSM I had my tape recorder rolling.  Also thank goodness the meal was in the contract, because the place aint cheap. But a rare prime rib, crispy on the outside baked potato, oysters, crazy good bread, are worth it if you have it. I just soaked the front of my shirt with my Pavlovian salivation.  This place is classy as hell and all Rat Pack feeling. Yeah, I assume every review of this place has some reference to the Rat Pack in it but I didn't read any so I'm not going to feel bad about it.   I don't know how I managed to make it to 30 before my first trip here. I'm a Phoenix kid and it's a Phoenix staple. The crowd was a little Luby's but I like old people. It's cool.

fu4P0ncg8Y-DUsm-Li8uUA.text: Meet the newest member of The Porterhouse Club! I thought a 48 oz steak would be a challenge but when its perfectly cooked and seasoned... I even had room for some of the sides! Everything I had here was tasty.  If I lived in Phoenix, I would absolutely bring a lady here if I wanted to impress her but didn't want to spend a fortune.   This is one of the best steakhouses ive been to and i may have to upwardly revise my rating after a return visit.

3I2BY9g144LCeaUs17JEbw.text: You really do go back in time when you visit Durant's. It has been here as long as I can remember. We went for lunch last week and it was a visual experience as well as a good lunch. Entering through the kitchen  was something that doesn't happen at any other restaurant that I know of. The kitchen staff greeted us profusely. We then entered the dining room which was speakeasy dark. The red velvet flocked wallpaper and the dark red leather booths conspired to conjure up images of Capone and Siegel. The service was attentive but not overly so. Our server, Jeff, gave us ample time to enjoy our cocktails before ordering. The food was excellent. A bit pricy, but hey! I had the "Italian" sandwich and hubby had the Patty Melt. Both were delicious. We will be back soon. Hope to see you there!

VIGqcYfjHKUwmiwJeH5_Xg.text: This staple of Phoenix history is one that cannot be missed. I always feel like I'm in the movie Goofella's when entering in the back door through the kitchen. Upon entering the restaraunt sites bring memories from the Rat Pack erra with a dimly lit dining room.   The thing I love about this place is that they have an awesome Lunch menu that's still pricey but you get great food for the money you spend. If you want a dinner experience that will never be forgotten then come and try one of their steaks. The Filet Mignon is amazing as well as the T-Bone Steak.   Be prepared to pay top dollar for a top dollar experience that you will not find at other chain steakhouses. If the walls could talk at Durant's there would be whisperings of business deals, power lunches, and romantic interludes. You can have all sorts of experiences here that will be memorable.

5-isJbDrEiUYrvmEOmZksQ.text: Underwhelming - that's the only word for it. I was really sad about that, too. I went with great expectations of an "old school" evening out. The decor didn't disappoint. The dark, heavy furnishings work well in the dim lighting. The nail-head accented upholstery looks right at home against the velvet flowered wallpaper. The host wears a tux and the waiters were similarly attired. The service was, for the most part, excellent, though they did have a hard time keeping up with us on the water. But they figured it out.  Really it was the food that I'm giving 3.5 stars. It was good. But for those prices in that atmosphere with their reputation and history ... well, good just doesn't cut it. I could have had good in a couple of dozen places for half the price. For example, I had salmon. It was good. It came with mashed potatoes that were reputed to be garlicky, and a salad that was mixed greens, three croutons and half a bottle of dressing. It cost about $30. The thing is, I had an equally good piece of salmon recently at Arcadia Farms for around $12 or $13. We shared a fruit crisp for dessert and it was the same thing. We paid $10 for a scoop of ice cream, a bowl of granola and a hint of apples and peaches. We could have gone up the street a block to Fez and had a much better dessert for less.  So I guess what I'd say about Durant's is this: go somewhere else - twice.

EpaSDUKmH3OfURu1x7Q7OQ.text: Durant's. A Phoenix Institution. An integral part of our Valley's history. Famed for old school red leather and Mafioso charm. Not to mention, the steak is pretty darn good too. Hard to write further about what other Yelpers haven't covered. If you haven't been, its worth the trip into Downtown Phoenix to experience a classic. Enter through the kitchen, step back in time and savor your dirty martini. cheers!

Lf1Tu5a0YOjnQcKD575Dxg.text: This was our first visit to Durant's. It had been on my Bucket List for a while and it seemed like the perfect place to celebrate our first wedding anniversary. And I'm glad we did. As you enter through the back through the kitchen, you step back into the 1970s. We dressed up but other folks wore shorts or jeans; no flip flops. Valet parking is available. The petite 8 oz. filet mignon was delicious; tasty seasoning. We definitely suggest adding a half order of sauteed mushrooms to complete your entree, which includes soup or salad and a side dish. The waiter surprised us with a complimentary dessert for our anniversary; we chose the original house cheesecake & it was a-maz-ing!! So creamy it melts in your mouth. Better than the Cheesecake Factory. I only wish I had left more room as I overindulged on the main course. Yes, it's pricey (for the 2 of us we spent $175 w/o alcohol and including tip), but the meal was delicious, the service was first-rate and it made for a memorable celebration. I expected Durant's to be hoity toity and I was pleasantly surprised to find it wasn't. The only negative is it's noisy inside and hard to hear your dinner companions. But ... that could be a good thing.

63XUsYbPRdqqG6CAtwoxpA.text: Arrived in Phoenix for a quick trip and did some research on historic restaurants.  Durant's kept popping up.  It's been going strong since 1950!  As soon as we walked in we were greeted warmly by the host , Kenny, who then led us to a nostalgic cozy red booth. I was immediately impressed by the service from the get go due to Kenny's demeanor.  The atmosphere and decor of the restaurant are of a different time period (in a positive way not like your crazy aunt's house).  Our server, Corey, was the consummate professional.  He started us off with cocktails and did not rush us at all. His knowledge of the menu as well as his recommendations were excellent.   The martinis were prepared in a perfect manner.  The appetizers (wedge salad and chicken livers) were tasty.  I went with the ribeye which was cooked to perfection.  My girlfriend had the scallops which were prepared in a garlicky cream based sauce.  Both entrees were amazing!  We also ordered a nice bottle of wine off of the extensive list. We had notified management via online booking that we were celebrating a special occasion and they generously sent over a tray of desserts which included two types of Creme brulee- it was so good and so appreciated !  What a meal!

Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Booth
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dessert

pmLv6M6h2YxS7NKvCEou3A.text: My absolute favorite (late) find in Phoenix! How on earth did I wait so long to come here?!? The restaurant is gorgeous....the decorations are so classy & transport you to another era. Personally, I love to dine alone so I sit at the bar...Every bartender has made me feel so welcome...Gail especially! This restaurant is a bit on the pricey side, but they are so generous with the complementary bread, veggies etc it's 10000% worth it! I recommend the mussels & also the boozy cheesecake. This spot is for dates, business meetings, casual nights out or just for grabbing a cocktail. Enjoy!

cjScISMx_XWzsYBBW91NBg.text: Pros: attentive, friendly service, cool old school atmosphere   Cons: food is mediocre   Can't see revisiting.

aFLM1wajwNAUiT65Cy_yjg.text: So much history at this venue.  Normally I dine at Capital Grille but for the nostalgia I will meet friends at Durants.  On Monday 6/24 we met another couple there for some work celebrations. My hubby & I arrived a few minutes after our friends and we waited over 10 minutes to place our drink order.  Fyi, the place was NOT packed. So the meal comes, and we're sitting at a booth and both of us girls are along the backside and the guys are on the ends. A HUGE cockroach is walking along the top of our booth & both of us feared it was going to walk on us & we frantically pushed our husbands out of the booth. The wait staff was a bit upset at us for causing a commotion.  No employee attempted to kill the bug & they were annoyed with us for causing a commotion.  They moved us to a table and neither of us could finish our meal. No remedy was made and we decided to never return here. Such a shame BUT their lack of reaction to the cockroach makes me think that this is the norm. Under no circumstances do I believe that dining with huge roaches is OK.

1HHLlE0vw5YV8nlV301ovw.text: Yes, it's definitely got a unique sort of atmosphere that recalls Mad Men and 77 Sunset Strip, and sure, the food is good, but where one person's meal without alcoholic beverages can easily come to over $150, my standards are pretty darned high, and the food here just isn't that fantastic for the exorbitant prices they're charging. As steakhouses go, this is no Peter Lugar's or even Ruth's Chris!

VGcKjPMED5snNW06n422aA.text: The best steak I have ever eaten! The service is flawless. The food is amazing. We took our son on this trip for his 8th grade graduation. He loved that they treated him like an adult and were so attentive to him. I had the New York strip with sweet potato fries, my husband had the crab Mac and Cheese and my son had the Filet with a baked potato. It was all perfection. As we were ending our meal, the waiter brought my son a Strawberry Shortcake as a graduation gift! I love this place and we will be back soon.

JyKw3FUcbvG4uFqa0CrhNg.text: If you are in Phoenix & want to pamper yourself to a full course / full service red meat meal in a historical setting, Durant's is the place to be! It is everything a steak house is supposed to be......gaudy elegant complete with the velvet wallpaper & polished leather booths! The steaks go from big to bigger and the servers daunt on your every need. It's an Olde Phoenix original to be enjoyed!!

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Family!!
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bone in Ribeye
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Strawberry Shortcake for the table!

iH5xdqOLZMPp7rF8mYESCQ.text: So I'm sitting there cutting my Ribeye steak with a fork.  WITH A FORK!  I had heard a lot about Durant's, from the old school feel and ambiance, to the celebrity guests (like the Governor), but when the rubber hits the road, it's all about my steak.  And my steak was unforgettably good!  'Nuff said.  Oh, but wait, try the Creme Brulee sampler for desert!  OK, 'nuff said.  Why am I hungry all of a sudden?

JkyqW64W1vRYiFKVAxOaWQ.text: Love, love the ambiance here! I got the filet mignon and it was so delicious. Best steak I've had. Martinis are amazing also and so is the wait staff. Everyone from the initial phone call was very nice and accommodating. We celebrated a birthday and they surprised my friend with a delicious dessert trio. Such a great experience with amazing food! Highly recommend.

y5A0EKMiixWQMAEibRWRIw.text: The point of entry to this establishment starts your magical evening. Upon arrival you enter through the kitchen and begin with a sense of the behind the scenes motion.  The menu is loaded with classics and radiates a feeling of the old Rat Pack or Capone days. The lighting is dim with dark wood notes that paint a picture of what is yet to come.  I had the Bone-In Ribeye with loaded Garlic Mashed Potatoes. For an appetizer, we tried the sauteed chicken livers, Jumbo Shrimp w/ Atomic Horseradish and the calamari. All were delicious!   We chose three decedent desserts and split them among us. Booyah! Lonnie, our captain, led the charge and kept us on track for our experience.   The wine list is deep and offers many fantastic options. I kept it simple with the Freemark Abbey Napa Valley Cabernet. It was wound a little tight, but once it opened up it was fantastic!   The entire staff were cordial and very helpful. There are so many items on the menu that I want to try, so next time I'll have to bring Twyla. It is not an every day stop but for sure resonated a calling to come back.  They will see us again sooner than later. My hat is off to the entire crew!  #Durants #Vino2 #vino2ultimate #vinosquared #IrishcatV2

UF6tY2fDOXRt5i2Qng0xHA.text: I was treated so poorly by the staff for my dads birthday. We were not bad customers no phone calls very quiet. But when only my father was handed a desert menu. How does one not upsell desert?I was very offended. Every time I drive past I say I will never eat there again.

QuKfr1T2X-y6U68moPEqDg.text: I'm sorry, the food is good but not for that insane price! I've been to many amazing restaurants in NYC where the food soars above Durant's and not at this cost. Nothing spectacular stuck out to me about the food. Nothing wow'd me. The atmosphere was old world Italian out of a movie type. The waiter was rude and I felt very discriminated against being an interracial couple dining there. I've never had that experience at any other restaurant! Disappointed. I wrote a review on their website but they never posted it! Will never go back.

TKcU2PcSwERZiPiQfDttXw.text: Dear ass-covering manager for our server. You informed us we couldn't have another drink during the meal. You were informed by a server or our server that we were intoxicated.  Our server was unable to handle his guests, overstretched and absent. So when I asked another server for a glass of wine and was told a few minutes later that we would not be served anymore I had you come over and explain the reason. I asked you to sit and have a conversation with us, you gave a horrible performance of having to be responsible seving drinks. When pressed why you thought we were intoxicated  you said the martinis are strong???. One Booker's at bar 45 minutes before our table and one martini at dinner, that was for myself. I'm guessing the server was covering for himself and lied as to why I had to flag down another server, his lie was we were intoxicated.  My girlfriend is embarrassed as am I for your behavior and ass-covering.  Not once did we cuss, speak loudly, or bad mouth anyone. We dressed nicely unlike others in shorts and t-shirts.   Congrats, you treated us like we were a nuisance. You admitted we we're  not intoxicated but no apologies, no, I'm sorry for the misunderstanding. We  were half done with our meal but soon it was all boxed to go, a sign we were to go. You offered to "comp" our food, that was your apology.   We chose your establishment and you chose to be God. My name is Mike Woelfel and I'm far from done with this as we have never experienced anything like the way you treated us. On our way out, your employees all standing outside and smoking we're decent enough to pickup the boxed leftovers which happen to be deposited across your parking lot. We don't eat tainted meat.  You ruined a special night, so please go fuck yourself.

t0Mld_2f25GBvgBt52p1Eg.text: Best steakhouse in Maricopa county hands down. Love the decor and the service is always exceptional

t_yOqsMrB95QwAmN1y-qZg.text: Durant's is awesome. I love the "Mad Men" atmosphere... and I came from that era... those kinds of restaurants and bars. The service, food, and drinks are the best! To some, it's Phoenix's well kept secret. I almost always go alone, sit at the bar, have some drinks, and order a meal. Sometimes, I go light with filet mignon tips... a kind of shish kabob. Other times, I go for a large steak or prime rib. All are incredible!

wIlqws19zGEMqkritNyuiw.text: We dined on 02/17/19 and enjoyed the finest meal I've had in Phoenix. Prime rib 8oz was more than enough. Soup,salad,potatoes and spinach rounded out the main course, strawberry shortcake and a latte for desert along with their famous martini made this evening a memorable occasion. The service was top notch and prices are a tad high but worth every penny. I'm looking forward to returning soon.

2ksWu0MgdZvpkbU20dS5LA.text: Went here for my 28th birthday; I was told they had the best prime rib in the valley, what a lie that was. This place smells old, the decor is awful. Way over priced for what you get. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone.

kH7L3bqZC6IwIs5vFJOPlQ.text: Love this place. Excellent steaks and that great mobster ambiance. Eaten here several times and never been disappointed. Service is also top notch.

E6FwfRLK7bzXrYxXPxjLAw.text: Always a perfect meal and service is top notch. We go for our anniversary every year. We have never waited to be seated when reservations have been made in advance.

DgxAqzNdB-NPV_xLH-AEhw.text: What can I say that has not been said this place is unique, you will not find a cooler experience in phoenix dinning.  It's a must go if you want a steak and want something unique when it comes to atmosphere...  Enjoy.

R68vXtPFflLQk4VvQwSnDQ.text: I love the unique feel of this place and the prime rib was excellent. The prices are high but the meal and service was great. I look forward to trying the filet next!

ws1si_kBmyXHvdhPKyZABg.text: While our meal was incredibly expensive, not a thing was lacking in terms of atmosphere, presentation, and service.  Staff is incredibly polite and attentive, and the food is amazing!  It was like going back in time, in a very classy way!  I had scallops, and my friend had chicken piccata.  The bread with the garlic and leeks was different and delicious.  I'd love to go back here!

muKlEYlKWXmXt-QGEfstzQ.text: Honestly the best and oldest steak house in town!!!! There's a reason this restaurant has been here forever!! It's absolutely delicious!!! The decor inside reminds me of an old movie lounge which reflects the history of this restaurant perfectly w giant booths to sit in. The garlic bread that comes out is so hard to resist which is why by the time my main dish comes out, I'm already full but come on! You have to try it. It comes out warm covered w butter and leeks. And w each dish you get a Cesar salad!! So good!! The lobster is to die for. It's huge!! Almost the size of my arm. And I usually get the filet mignon medium rare and ask for a side of horseradish. They bring out two types. A creamy horseradish sauce and one just raw horseradish. The steaks are delicious always cooked to perfection with such flavorful spices that explode in your mouth. You also have to try the baked potato which is topped w bacon bits, sour cream and chives. And the broccolini!! I usually eat so much that I have to be wheeled out!! I highly recommend this place if you're looking for a good steakhouse.

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Durant&#39;s cheesecake and chocolate brownie pie
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Feast time!! Filet mignon, lobster, New York strip, potatoes au gratin

UDrADgtF52o_PFFWGivCJw.text: This place is legendary and outstanding.  When my colleague told me this was the place we were taking our lunch meeting and he explained we had to walk through the kitchen to get to the dining room I was thinking "what kind of joint is this".  When I got there and saw it I was amazed, truly feels like the 1950s.  You sit in the dark leather soaked dining room and wonder how many multi million dollar deals have been done in this establishment over lunch/dinner.  Food was unreal delish.. I had the roasted pork chop and mixed vegetables, cooked to perfection.  The service was over the top great.  I would highly recommend this location to anybody who is visiting Phoenix, the locals all know about it already been here since 1950.  I will definitely return on future visits to Phoenix!

T6oS6UH-e90Nc_qbs1bkcg.text: Wonderful way to enjoy the end of the day after working and need a little pampering.the food was out standing and was followed great decaf coffee and desert. A little pricey but good service and food is worth it . Only one draw back is there isn't a dress code . At the next table there was a young man (25-30) wearing flip flops and shorts.    Would I go back.  YES.   Enjoy

oRZRymd52LYhW2kbshUpsA.text: The atmosphere is nice, but it's small inside and other customers chairs are right up next to you. It's darker inside and I would say romantic if you get a circular booth.  The service was great, our waiter was very friendly and accommodated our special requests.  Parking is in the back and you enter through the kitchen. Sketchy neighborhood too unfortunately.  Food was good-very good.

GxzzX_C4gbvWSP__0-HXNQ.text: I received very poor service. My family and I drove from California to attend my graduation and stoped at Durant's restaurant after. The waiter seemed upset with all of our request. We waited for than 2 1/2 hours for our food. Mind you I am 5 months pregnant and tired from the long drive. The food was also mediocre for the high price ($235) Anyways at the end of our dinner my husband card got declined because he forgot to tell the bank we were driving out of town. So I gave the waiter my card instead and, while he walked away, I heard him say " hope this card works" in a demeaning way. If you want to have a good dinner with friends and family do not  eat  here.

-f_cliVcQRzvgDGLsCpKoA.text: First time at Durants! A gift certificate brought us in. My husband and I got the 48 oz. porterhouse steak, baked potato, onion rings, and broccollini and for dessert their fruit cobbler with ice cream (Apple was the fruit). The service was great, people were very friendly and our server was friendly and even gave me extra ice cream! Yay!!  We ordered our steak medium rare. The outside of the state came back almost medium however the middle was medium rare and delicious. I totally understand that cooking a steak that thick and large is not easy however for over $100 for that alone I would expect they have their system down.  I also added more salt to it which hit my tastebuds a bit better. Overall I enjoyed the steak but after I added more salt and butter.  Potato hit the spot and the broccollini wasn't warm or seasoned. I like plain veggies so it worked for me but it could've been warmer. The onion rings were delish! Crispy and light! Yum!! The apple cobbler was warm and tasty and not super sweet so I was diggin' it.   Overall, Service was great and the people were very nice but when paying that much for a meal  I would expect that it comes out almost perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The bread is sooooooo good! Doused in butter and green onions
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 48 o&#39;clock. Porterhouse steak
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Onion rings were the bomb!!

ipS1GWF3qNpWDEP-cyWZiA.text: Had an amazing delicious meal. Two beautiful steaks which were cooked perfectly, loaded baked potato, salads, bread, and creme brulee to end it all. Excellent food. Nice glass of wine and scotch on the rocks. Thank you Durant's for making available a nice, reasonably priced glass of wine to enjoy our dinner with (cheapest glass of red wine at steak 44 was $30.00 per glass, which really made me mad).  Waiter, Andy, was wonderful. Perfect service...not too little or too much, kept an eye on us and knew when to ask if we needed anything. Really nice birthday meal. A little spendy at $200.00 for two people, but it was really a perfect steak. Greeted by maitre'd upon arrival...very friendly. Overall great splurge.

HIkZeNM0GrH4szK8HYa2AA.text: Nice experience and worth the money. For (2) about $200 We both had the filet and it was prepared as ordered and an excellent piece of meat. Service was a 10 This location is old but you feel like everything is being maintained. The decor is from another time but seems appropriate We will be returning

_FcVNPerOSMgcCJ4sB9yaQ.text: "Good Friends, Great Steaks and The Best Booze are the necessities of life".  (Jack Durant) The ambiance of the restaurant and its quintessential staff is the same as it was decades ago.  The best of the best and still the best.

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. &#34;Good Friends, Great Steaks and The Best Booze are the necessities of life&#34;. (Jack Durant) Martini &amp; Birthday cake, perfect!

VdmAdDTog6jfsrkh3JFHFw.text: Durant's, all you would expect and more. Martha and Ricardo make the difference.  Enter through the kitchen and you walk right into  1950.  Well worth the trip.   Excellent prime rib.   Strawberry shortcake.  Yummy.

S4gOJq4u0oNgZnfPDBv4iw.text: FANTASTIC! Very fun decor, the food (filet, ribeye, scallops, crab mac n cheese, salad, bread) were all delicious and our waiter was delightful. The salad with blue cheese dressing was exceptional. Wish I lived closer so I could go more.

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Straight up vodka martini
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bread.. sooo good
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Blue cheese salad

mkyap3-_lqynqPqRJeWfJA.text: The combo filet mignon and stone crab claws was a good combination.  The filet mignon, while it was a bit salty on the outside, the inside was very tender, tasty and juicy.  The stone crab claws were good, but could have been a little sweeter.  I chose steamed veggies to go with my entree instead of the variety of potato based offerings.  The bread and salads were a good compliment.

mGlUF9LPoG6E2gKrovY2Lw.text: The best steak you'll get in Phoenix. The service is superb, too, and it's always fun walking in and out through the kitchen. Last night when I left I burst into applause. They deserved it. The fresh oysters are excellent, too, amazingly, but avoid the Oysters Rockefeller--way too much of whatever the sauce is. And they serve a great liver and onions.

XxgOFF11dIN2nKfROTCJCQ.text: First time here. Very good service. I had the Delmonico stake and crab cakes. Very good New Year's Eve dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

azdemnXcAHfo3dJqp1avuQ.text: If you want to experience the difference between an average restaurant and an excellent one, go to Durant's! Went in tonight with a friend just for desert and and drinks. The place was packed but we were accommodated and quickly seated and served, without exaggeration, the best strawberry shortcake I have ever tasted! I've dined at other much more expensive restaurants where the management acts as if they are doing a favor by trying to get you in! Durant's treated us as if we were not just customers but important customers! That my friends is what customer service is about! Durant's never disappoints and you simply can't beat them for excellent food and service to match!!

RVF2xobGagkX5JIdR6EQLA.text: Last night we celebrated our anniversary at Durant's. The experience was great, from walking in to the bright kitchen to stepping on to the darker dining room.    My boyfriend ordered the porterhouse and got his name on the wall (but it won't be available right away) . but he fell in love with his steak steak. I got a filet mignon. My filet was tender and juicy i really enjoyed it. I'm not one eat steak as a preference but I really did like it, but if you want it with bacon wrap you must ask for it since it's not something they automatically add unless requested.   I was told they had the best martinis in town so i tried them,  mine was a dirty gray goose martini. Very good, strong olive taste but so good on the goose, just like i like it.   For dessert i has the creme brule; the tray confess with three , a chocolate, vanilla and blubbery, my favorite one was vanilla, so delicious. I can still taste it!   Yet our main highlight was The service , our waitress was so welcoming and so kind, being our first time there we had so many questions but she was just great at answering them. Thank you Durant!

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. So worth it !!
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. We were almost the lasts one out
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chocolate, blueberry and vanilla creme brulé

2YUDp0SjtLT9tgyOkf5TkA.text: Great steaks and great service.  A little on pricey side despite the $$$ signs, although it did come with a side. my wife and I split the 22 oz Ribeye and was plenty of food.

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

RSxMEEUx90aoaF9wp0K-tw.text: There are few restaurants that can manage to live up to the hype built by obsessive fans. Durant's is one of the lucky few that more than meets all expectations.   Everything was delicious. Service was fantastic. The furnishings are well kept and classic. I love that red wallpaper - I just want to touch it! I loved how the ladies' bathroom still has a payphone in there with a couch. The whole place gives off this amazing reminder of an era of class that is long gone otherwise.   We had the shrimp cocktail for an appetizer. It has a huge clump of strong horseradish, so there's your fair warning. Anyway, our entrees came and our steaks were absolutely cooked to perfection. The husband usually inhales his food before I can blink, but this is the one meal he happily savored. Somehow, we saved room for the strawberry shortcake and I think I died a little. Bye-bye, diet! And I wasn't sad about it.   I recommend you save this place in your back pocket for a nice dinner when you want to look like a baller. Unlike husband who suggests coming here every single day for dinner to eat the porterhouse for free with an end goal of spelling out a whole sentence on one of their plaques. More likely is that we'll be back just to chill at the bar with one of their flawless gin martinis or a glass of scotch and take in the ambiance. And I can't wait.

DkklUSFdOfl4SAX-k_n0HQ.text: we celebrated my 70th birthday here. Greg was a perfect waiter, a consummate professional. I had oysters Rockefeller to die for, peppercorn fllet mignon, two shots of McKinchie scotch, chocolate cake (free for my birthday) and a special gift. Finished this feast with coffee keoki. I cannot imagine a better dinner experience (and I've had thousands of dinners in seventy years).

kCGy6rtWWlbJjlq2LNv0AA.text: Went tonight for dinner. Food was great. We both had rib-eyes which were cooked medium well to perfection! Service was good... our glasses never went dry! Cheesecake for desert was a great choice. This is not a fancy place. More of an old steakhouse... that said, what it may lack in decor, is made up for in the service and the food.

f1VUTYBNlpk39iV512EwGQ.text: My gf and I came for date night and we had such a good time. I'd been here before, but it was her first time. From walking in through the kitchen, to sitting down for dinner, our experience was 5 star. I made our reservation from Yelp (easy as hell) and even though we were late to dinner, we were accommodated in every way.

pBczEUD5GSlRmwTlEt6oCQ.text: Horrible service..and (3) $40.00 steaks that were a bit dry and tough i...we personally had a bad experience an will never in this life time return..so don't believe the hype..Believe me folks the place look nice but ain't all that..!

3_asKczuPn9RIzOZo19fdQ.text: Amazing steak! Definitely pricey but worth it. Atmosphere is relaxing and friendly. Lovely cocktail bar area.

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

mSFm0OttwoeIYiC536zneQ.text: This is one of the best restaurants in Arizona.  The food is amazing, the atmosphere is terrific, and the service is always great.  I have never had anything but a first class experience and amazing food here.

joRUSuac9bKGui6n2aV_Dw.text: There's nothing like Durant's. Especially if you want a little piece of old Vegas (red-on-red velvet wallpaper? Hello...) awash in history and unique charm. We've never stayed for dinner (suspect it might be a bit overpriced for what you get), but the desserts and cocktails are amazing. Just sitting in the bar is amazing! No night out on the town in Phoenix is complete without a stop at this priceless throwback landmark of Old West money gone so bad, it's right again.

MnGNQ6PVYOFx6aGAw7AM7w.text: LOVE THIS PLACE!!!  I am not rich, I am the average guy a little extra spending money like to go there on special occasions.  Being in the service industry, I know ALLOT of the servers.  Every time I go in I feel like a ROCK STAR!!!    The service is always great the staff is always wonderful and when I leave, I am full and happily wined.    Good wine good meat good god lets eat~!

BVvj5oxvsXO4bSlCY1ts2w.text: With the new modern steak houses popping up all over, older steak houses like Durants become a flash back in time. Most of the clientele was well over 60, all the sides were bland and heavy. Honestly felt like eating at a retirement home. Steaks were over priced and just not worth it. Our waiter along with another near by were completely obnoxious, pushing deserts like they were trying to make a used car quota. Skip this place and grab a steak at another American Bistro. Most offer at least one great steak at a reasonable price and of similar quality.

t_WXmAwuUtdOP0k28h_rvg.text: First time dining here, service was great, reservation for 3 on a saturday night and they gave us an option of booth vs table upon check in.  Food was excellent, the steak was cooked perfectly to order.  I found the atmosphere warm and intimate, the red decor still works.  Would definitely go back.

366HPgT8NqrF3cR0P0NgHQ.text: went here for my bf's birthday and man oh man was it tasty!!!!!!! the bread they serve at the beginning of the meal was amazing...we had a nice bottle of wine, shared lobster and the special that evening with the cajun ribeye, shrimp, potatoes and asparagus.  such a great dinner and it totally takes you back to the mobster days :)   definitely a nicer dinner out price wise but you can go fairly casual-looked like a lot of people had come over from spring training games!!

Ji92HsjMfaPVAZ-W9KYNhQ.text: Had 6pm reservation for a special occasion.  Were seated immediately.  Server was very nice and personable.  The bread is amazing.  Had oysters for apps which were very good.  Spinach salad was good.  Shrimp cocktail was huge as were most of the dinner portions.  Free desert for special occasion.  Pricey, but we knew that going in.  Will be back for a martini.

y5JXKhdyxRTSeLzgzKDWzg.text: Excellent service and amazing food.  They present themselves as the old time steak house and do a great job with it.

4ORT-Y_KOiC9ML-4aUTu2Q.text: It's been my birthday tradition off and on over the last few years.  Quiet, great service and selection, cool '50s vibe.

T8uVVD2aoXD_zZtVsjV93Q.text: So maybe I am partial because my hubby makes their grills... Excellent food in a very old school establishment.

3mS3eduxNQJiUHBhh-nH7g.text: This is the second time we have been to this restaurant (we are from Flagstaff).  This time we had 6 people (last time only 2) and the food, service and ambience were still 5 star!  Three of us shared the 48 oz porterhouse steak and still had some to take home!  We had the sauted mushrooms and they were the best we have ever had.  Other steakhouses are all a la carte but Durants provides a wonderful salad and your choice of a vegetable (all included in the price of the entree).  One last thing: we went there with a $200 gift certificate generously contributed by Carol McElroy to benefit the Flagstaff Symphony Orchestra.  She and Durants deserve a special thanks!  We will make more special trips to Phoenix to eat here.

K0DbsV0M9cbsQogf9PNDhQ.text: This place is a time capsule.  You almost expect to see Frank Sinatra in here!  Awesome steaks!

IJJvFrEmtrbOkgCWC5oM7w.text: I've been to Durants a couple times now and the food is always consistent.  The steaks are great and the garlic mashed potato's are my favorite side.  The service is great too.  It's definitely on the expensive side, but it's worth it!  If you have never been to Durant's, you have to give them a try!

eGIjmGUzOLsXSlRsaKa5fQ.text: I will be back. Service was great.  Prices reasonable.  Food delish.  Yes, I will be back.

xubBd4dIOFzC_O9IeKLBzQ.text: Durant's totally hit the spot when my girlfriend and I craved some fine dining. She had been to this place a few times before and raved about it. So I finally made the trip to Phoenix along with her (she was on business) and had a great meal at Durant's. It really is a wonderful restaurant. Fine service, great presentation, nice and large bar area with every spirit you could imagine, mood lighting, lively atmosphere, free AND valet parking, centrally located. Are these enough reasons to try it?  I had grilled swordfish and mashed potatoes. Very yummy! Girlfriend got grilled bacon-wrapped scallops. Those were the best. I could have eaten 10 of them. The leftovers were even good the next day.   Drinks were strong but pricey. The dish of celery, carrots and radishes on rock salt and ice were a nice touch too.   Definitely worth the price.

-JZCuhcLQTBRTLFurHNq8A.text: I love steakhouses and was excited to try this one.everything was good except for one thing.the calamari.it was awful .greasy and the breading fell off the calamari.the oysters were amazing.steak was great.service wad good.wouldnt go out of my way though. but all in all it was a good experience.

lwK3gt58w2u-7UDsJKDg6g.text: I felt like I was in a classic Mafia movie walking into to Durant's! You enter through the back, and go through the kitchen where kitchen staff are friendly, clean and hard at work. Dining area has Mafioso decor and intimate table settings (as well as not-so-intimate larger table settings for groups). They have a nice wine selection, and help you pair up the right wine with your food. COME HUNGRY!! They give nice, ample portions! For our appetizer, we got Fresh Oysters on the Half-Shell and Crab Cake with Chipotle Aioli. WORTH EVERY PENNY!! Very fresh, savory and delicious! I wish they sold bottles of their Chipotle Aioli sauce. I would drizzle that on everything!! We got the prime rib, which was cooked and seasoned to perfection!! Their au jus is heavenly, and their horseradish is creamy but not too spicy. Their Roasted Garlic Mashed Potatoes is their signature side dish with their prime rib. I can see why. It pairs beautifully!! My dinner companion had their stuffed baked potatoes, which looked to be a meal in and of itself!! Not a steak fan? Durant's also has a nice chicken, seafood and liver (yes, liver) menu. The prime rib leftovers are even better the next day with some over-easy fried eggs! Durant's will also fill sauce containers with their dressings/sauces to take home so you have even more than you got with your dinner! I highly recommend Durant's for an intimate romantic dinner free from kids or noise. It's also great for large groups from work, family or a special event for friends! I will definitely return. I wish I had tried this place years ago!! I have been missing out!! encrypted-tbn2.gstatic.c...

uqUgGlF2IbjJk77nupWvFw.text: So not worth it. Please don't waste your time and money here. I thought it would be better than Flemings but it isn't better and is much more expensive. I got the chicken. It tasted like egg. I had to send it back. I never send food back!  The reason I'm giving this place 3 stars is because of the look and the rest of my party. It looks awesome on the inside as if you're stepping back in time. I went with 4 others. They all liked their food. Oh also the bread is amazing! I took some of that to go.

ve_35roa1IA4HRgSirpMAA.text: Perfection ! Dirty martini out standing porter house perfect shrimp cocktail out standing Blue points on point ! And our server Evan was just delightful and perfect in perfect in every way not five stars ten !

Lnd5u-VJ8B_lNwcYwT9grw.text: Classic. Old school. AWESOME!  This place is in my neighborhood and I'd go at least once a week if I could.    The service is impeccable and the steaks sIzzle and are cooked to perfection every time.  I highly recommend this place.    Valet parking is in the back, and it's an old Phoenix tradition that you enter the restaurant through the back door, through the kitchen.    Check it out.  It's retro and amazing.   Also they have a decent selection of gluten free items.

AWKt2c_lcv38oiajPBO_HA.text: In a town like Phoenix where just about everything is new ..... Durants is the old-school , historic steakhouse dating back to the 60's ......... we went with 7 other people on a Weds. evening ..... everyone had a great time and had great entrees ..... place was packed .... service attentive ..... steaks , prime rib were excellent .... we enjoyed the Durant's signature strawberry shortcake which was so huge all of us were able to get a slice ---- just a cool restaurant with friendly staff and good food  !

CMXojzssWLiHSRylnwo4MQ.text: We ate at Durant's last night for the 1st time. The "old school charm" in a world of who can build it bigger & better was such a nice change of pace! We had oysters on the 1/2 shell w/ the best horseradish on the planet.....Atomic. They were awesome! The bread & fresh veggie plate was delish! Salad & soup (shrimp bisque) great! Filet & prime rib.....filet was really good, but the prime rib is possibly one of, if not the best I've ever had! Incredible flavor!!!! We finished w/ a brownie dessert. Truly wonderful, the only thing I would change,  is the brownie being warmed up would of put this incredible dessert over the top! Our serving was very friendly & well versed on the menu. Our cocktail were a nice pour & refreshing! All in all....when I want prime....this IS where we will be going in the future.

IHfzgs4WY0dlN9_bsXAEdQ.text: Love Durants. Entering thru the kitchen is old school gangster. Must do! Then, straight to the bar for a drink. Old school bar with excellent bartenders. Ok, now the food; bone in ribeye...perfect, slice of rare prime rib that is tender , cooked perfect. Sides of mashed potatoes, mushrooms, and creamed  spinach were great. Finished off with keylime pie and chocolate brownie fudge. A real dining experience with a ton of chacter...far from inexpensive but worth it.

tuNGFc5EQil0TU-ccu0btQ.text: This is your proverbial "special occasion" restaurant. It's the place to take someone you want to impress. You may see politicians and judges in one corner, football players in another and maybe even a socialite or two (you'll know them because they don't take their sunglasses off, either because they are too cool, or the botox hasn't settled yet)  The valet parking is free, which is cool, but you don't have to use them, the parking lot is huge and you can self-park. Entering through the kitchen is a unique touch, but remember to open the door on the right to avoid bumping into a server coming the opposite way!  The interior is old-school and dated, but harks back to the days of old. Red plush couches and velvet curtains. Dark wooden tables and booths.  Robert was our server and he was excellent. Very personable and engaging. He knew when to come to the table and when to stay away. An awareness skill that other servers could learn.  The food was very good, which is only to be expected given the history of the place, but the prices were outrageous! The shrimp cocktail was $17.50 (5 U10s or U12s), served on the rim of an oversized martini glass over cocktail sauce, just like your grandma used to make back in 1976. The crabcake app was full of meat, priced at $19.95.  For entrees my gf got the salmon ($33.50) and I got the 12 oz filet ($60.50). To be fair, the entrees do include soup or salad and starch, but no sides. Robert asked us if it was our first time, and when we said it was, he bought us a dessert. That was a nice touch.  The bargain of the night was the wine list. We selected a 2003 Jordan cab, which was only $63. Robert expertly decanted the wine and it tasted great.  Would I go back again? Absolutely! But only if it was on an expense account or a long-lost rich uncle was picking up the tab.

eag1Dq-2KLkcSPf9Q5n9ZQ.text: In love with this place! My review is a little late since being here in October but I still want to give the recognition they deserve. Came here on a short trip to Arizona. My boyfriend and I were trying to find a place near by while in the city. We were originally on our way to a different restaurant in our lyft. But we asked our lyft driver what she recomended for steak and she suggested Durant's! So we changed destination. And I'm so glad we did! We entered through the kitchen area which was really exciting for us. I was a bit nervous at first because in the past when going to fancy restaurants we are judged for our excessive tatttoos and being younger. I've noticed people don't take us seriously. But not here! Kevin (pretty sure that was his name) did a phenomenal job as our server! He was really attentive and had great suggestions, conversed with us when he had time and got really excited with our Polaroid camera. The place is dated but tastefully, having served for decades and having famous guest I felt it had a lot of character! I never felt disappointed once. The food is pricey but it has every right to be, you get what you paid for and beyond. To this day when my boyfriend asks where I want to eat I jokingly say Durant's even though we live in Chicago. Probably my 1# steak place in the country!

KNcmRb77lOFo2qz_a12usg.text: It doesn't get much cooler than Durants! Love the atmosphere, here it makes you feel like your in a movie. The service is professional and attentive. The food is amazing and if your not sure what to order the staff will guide you in the right direction. Ask about the Jewl on the menu. The price is worth it. Enjoy!

cK9lXaaE8NiaAKNHxgyFPQ.text: Never fails! This place always has good food and good service. Been here several times. Tried the NY strip this time. Cooked to perfection.

Rr9MuDilnVXiAoYe164l0w.text: My husband and I have dined at Durant's often for special occasions. Our last visit this past weekend was the best. Our waiter, Ron, was attentive, thoughtful and efficient. Durant's has a well deserved reputation for food and ambiance, but thanks to Ron, our recent experience was over the top!

S1WDIx4gZPjkXRBvlRNoZA.text: This place is so classic. You walk in through the kitchen and the dining room is straight out of the '60's with dark wood paneled walls and red leather booths. The menu is as classic as everything else, featuring steaks and seafood. No frills, just exquisitely prepared food served my staff who know what they're doing. I've been going here for years & it never disappoints.

FCiYxZ0eZMK3-stv6u87tg.text: Came here during restaurant week and was a happy girl from start to finish. At first I was a little disappointed that there was no steak on the restaurant week menu, but that soon passed. Our server was on point for our entire visit, drinks were always full, and he had a sense of humor.   First of all, that garlic bread they give you is super special, very original. Topped with leeks, garlic, herbs, marinated  in olive oil, it was  gone quick. I had the baked brie with a raspberry reduction w/ toast.....this was sooooo divine, it could have been a dessert. I could eat this everyday and love it each time. My entree was the citrus glazed salmon, it was cooked perfectly and the sauce complimented the fish. The husband had the pork chop w/ au gratin potatoes...that pork was slammin'!!! Wow, it was thick, juicy, and ooh so good. The potatoes were yummy as well. For dessert we had the creme brulee and the chocolate cake. The cake was my favorite, chocolate & raspberry goodness served with fresh whipped cream.  We paid $40 per person and this included the 3 courses, glass of wine, and any other non-alcoholic beverage ( soda, tea, coffee ).   This place is not cheap, but the food & service is worth it, we will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. baked brie in a raspberry reduction : )
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. salad

cLCbRjAGF3zB3WY9r2Dtxg.text: I am pleased to say the Phoenix landmark is alive and well! Me and my family had a party of seven to celebrate a birthday party and were treated like family but one person in particular stands out in my mind! The bartender (mark) I believe was his name!  Best drinks in the city and I have been to many upscale establishments . I urge anyone who wants the absolutely the  BEST steaks in the valley to make a reservation and create memories. Thank you Durants for maintaining a reputation that has stood the test of time and is a remarkable as I remember 15 years ago.

YvWUTlg7oKjf5GxwMj5IzQ.text: Went  again last night to Durrant's.  Had the prime rib. It was yummy. We went for my boyfriend's birthday. I surprised him. He has the coins that they give out every five years. These are good for free desserts.So we got a dessert for there and a dessert to take home. Our waitress was friendly and attentive. Definitely I would go back to Durands time and time again

Pw7Q__wBRYrnORq5qQmkJQ.text: Didn't love it. Service was so slow. We had to keep asking for our server. Food was ok,  but extremely  salty.  So glad we went just to see the restaurant itself.

3LAtF1d8Q_XpnGIhqACHCA.text: Great service.  Greg was great waiter.  Manager checked in w/ us.  The disappointment was that the steak was requested medium rare and was served as medium.  We didn't send it back because we knew the meat would be tossed and a new steak would have to be prepared.  It was a birthday meal, we told waiter and manager.  No comp.  We didn't ask, they didn't offer.  We'll go back, but next time....we'll be sending the steak back if it's not prepared as specified.  Shame on the chef.  Otherwise the place is to die for.  Love Durant's, go there.

hZUgolCIAfPI0H6O5Ldptg.text: A throwback to the old mob days, this place rocks.  It reminds me of old school Vegas restaurants that I remember from years ago as a kid.  You park in the back of the restaurant and walk in through the kitchen, how cool is that?!  Before I took a bite of food, I was a fan of this place.  After my first meal, it went to the top of my list.    Since that first visit, I've been back several times for lunch and dinner.  It never disappoints.  Some items I've had here:  Wedge Salad w/Gorgonzola Beefsteak Tomato Salad w/Bleu Cheese Crumbles French Dip 12 oz Filet Chop House Burger w/Cheese Side of Rice Pilaf  For lunch, my 2 fav items are the French Dip and the Chop House Burger w/Cheese.  They're very good and fill you up nice.  For Dinner, I always get the Filet.  It's my favorite cut of Beef and Durant's does a great job with their Filet.  I like to have it with a side of Rice Pilaf....yum!  The Salads here are pretty big, so I recommend splitting them.  The Wedge Salad is my fav....crispy, juicy Lettuce and creamy Gorgonzola....yes!  Service here is spectacular as well.  Its always been perfect for us.  I wish I lived closer to this place.  Return Factor - 100%

soFP0Gqf___hvUU8exQ9gA.text: Durant's gets 5 on ambience. Think Goodfellas and old ganster movies. Red vinyl seats, wallpaper, dark lighting.  I had the primerib with fresh horseradish, it was good but a bit expensive  Great character restaurant - good for dates and special ocassions!

I44twC-GM5q37M1Gv2BBDA.text: One of the best restaurants I been to. Greatest experience. A bit expensive on the wallet but a great experience nonetheless.

4gFpEWmUR2YT-95s2kVc2w.text: Cool entrance, fancy table, awesome wine...that is all. Must have been an off night but the place was not crowded - so I would expect the kitchen to be extra careful. We started with the Oysters Rockefeller. Just diaster. Looked like an artichoke spinach dip with oysters at the bottom. Waiter noticed and took them off our check. My girl and I shared the $100+ Porterhouse Steak. As soon as it hit the table (it was cooked right medium-rare) the fries were cold and the steak was dry. The entire top was extremely dry...no moisture, extra chewy, and it lacked seasoning. How does medium-rare steak not have a juicy texture. It was almost like a dry Roast beef. We sent it back and passed on dinner. Unfortunately, we just had the asparagus. Celebration gone wrong, but the drinks were good. We also noticed that the table across from us had a similar problem. The kitchen was not on its A game. Huge upset.

oMD856V_D5j_tWPNrS69Dg.text: Went there twice this past week. The first night the service and food where great. We had clients in town so we wanted to take them out for a nice dinner as a thank you for their hard work. The bill was almost $1,000 and well worth it. We decided to go back again on Friday and all I can say is the mood was completely different. The older gray haired man working the hostess counter and his entire crew were useless and act as if we weren't good enough to be eating there. The acted as if we were invisible. We asked questions about seating in bar area and were completely ignored. We ended up leaving! You liked us when we were in our suits but not when we were dressed in our casual clothes. Your loss of another $1000 sale and all potential sales. We will never be back.....  You lose!

Iny3puoKr3pESNidqtvkhA.text: Dining here is like going back in time. It's a for sure go-to when we are in Phoenix. Unbelievable steaks and atmosphere.

2M6XVnpvqBgxqkDRWsb_Kw.text: Went to Durants during restaurant week.  I love the old time steakhouse atmosphere.  The relish tray is a nice touch.  I had a  T-bone which was cooked perfectly and the baked potato was served piping hot.  It is interesting that 6 of the 8 people we went with commented on how good the baked potato was.  Normally I would say a baked potato is a baked potato, but this one was good.  A perfect score could have been obtained if the service was better.

5r8_t18kyDeyLPRA0cYeHg.text: Durant's - I love you. I really love you, but please don't do Restaurant Week next year unless you really want to make a go of it. The point of RW is to entice new customers, not turn your regular customers off.   My friends and I do the RW thing every year. The values and the opportunity to experience somewhere new at said value is pretty enticing. We made reservations on Thursday night around 8 and the place was more full than I have ever seen it on a weeknight. This made me happy, because I want this place, with it's cozy atmosphere, above and beyond service and fabulous martinis to remain the Phoenix institution it has become.   We chose two different entrees, ordered a martini (no let down here - see above - fabulous) and settled in to the big burgundy booth surrounded by coordinating crushed velour wallpaper. I just don't have a kind word to say about anything that came after the martini. Our appetizers were very very okay. I received possibly the most over cooked steak I have ever had. I've never done this, but I sent it back. The service was, for the first time in all my 10 years of visiting, sub par. I am not sure how our waiter wound up in a fine dining establishment, when he couldn't serve his way out of a TGIFridays.   I suggested Durant's to several people for restaurant week because I really couldn't believe such a great spot could have such an awesome deal going. Based on this dining experience I would really have to say this was a 2 star dinner, but that 10 years of 4-5 star dining experience is causing me to round up. In retrospect this may qualify as more of a rant than a review. But, I'd prefer to pay full price and have my previously pretty high expectations met.

AFuqCcDNGW1mpMDUkaYx1A.text: Best hidden gem of Phoenix! Traditional old school steak house, the kind where you can't use your phone. Best two things on the menu are the oyster rockafellar and the strong drinks!  I come here every time I'm in town!

3Ko7Q0261iFoyuQzb8h9LQ.text: We wanted to treat newlywed friends and I'd never been to Durant's. Thought it a great opportunity to see if it warranted all the good that I've heard about it.  It did and then some. Perfect prime steakhouse atmosphere, from the kitchen entry to the deep red leathers and dark woods that fill the surprisingly large place. We sat in the main dining room, but it appeared that the dining area near the full bar seated nearly as many. Lots of talk, laughter and fun everywhere without the noise level ever being a factor.  Service was impeccable. I want an attentive staff that will listen to what I'm expecting, not one that hangs over my shoulder to scrape every miniscule crumb from the table. We indicated to our server that we were in no rush. She timed everything prefectly, giving us time to enjoy our cocktails, appetizer, salads and meal without ever rushing one course on top of the other. Just the way it's meant to be done.  The food? Exceptional. The fresh oysters were just that, and I loved the spicy horseradish. I'm not much of a bread eater, but all three companions swooned over the garlic bread. Salads were all fresh, plentiful and flavorful. My medium-rare prime rib looked like a cookbook example. Truly didn't even need a fork to cut it, wonderfully trimmed. Superb. KT had the filet medium rare. Outstanding crust, yet so delicate and pink inside. Our friends each had the same (filet and prime rib). They preferred theirs medium and well (I love them anyway), and raved about how fantastic they were.  Durant's is a Phoenix dining experience that should not be missed. Can't recommend highly enough. Bring your appetite and your wallet, but quality of food, service and presentation of this sort is worth every penny.

pSESWurgLjp_k55encW3qg.text: Soo good! Wonderful food and drinks, great service and lovely atmosphere.  Highly recommend eating dinner here!

5a2nv8r5C3r0OAIGFlGVFw.text: You just can't go wrong with Durant's.  I've been a customer for 30 years and still love everything about this place.  The atmosphere, the service, the food...all 5 star!  Whether you are just stopping by for a few cocktails on your way downtown or spending the evening eating dinner in the restaurant, Durant's will never disappoint.  Great dishes include Cocktail shrimp (fresh daily), Chicken Marsala, Pea soup, Oysters, and of course, their Onion Rings!   If you're looking for a quiet yet elegant, place to take a date or even the family, that place is Durant's.

RRNWDJe9b-wf-R2nvjbSjg.text: This place is by far one of my favorite steakhouses around! I got a plain old steak, and boy was it good! Nice and tender, just perfect. Came with a group of 5, and we got great service, our food was delivered within 10 minutes, and the waiter was quick. I will recommend this place to everyone, and will be back!

SIvwkK1F5OKVt3NvKVlqrw.text: We try to get to Durant's every couple of months...and needless to say have NEVER been disappointed.  Tonight was the 12 oz Filet and Crab Cakes (which we shared) and of course several Manhattans.  Finished the evening off with the a cappuccino and  the chocolate brownie pie...delicous.  So, if you live in the Phoenix area or are visitilng and want a fantastic steak and old world charm...check it out, you will not be disappointed.  Don't forget...park out back and enter through the kitchen.

hmCDSx9xEg2EnX8bQV3trA.text: Had dinner Friday night. Great meal and service. Have visited a dozen times over the past few years and have always had a good experience. Highly recommend to anyone for a great steak dinner in a semi formal setting.

yMMkhU-HyYZ7eUpapWL4IQ.text: Durant's is old school cool. I really dig the vibe inside. Very dark and red-velvety and retro chic.  The service was top notch. Our server was on his game. Our wish was his command. He even offered to run across the street to the convenience store and grab us a Twinkie for dessert if we so desired. He was joking, but I bet if we really did ask it would have been so.  Superb wine list. Massive and filled with great offerings. The sommelier was very new, but he was knowledgeable enough to confirm my hunch about '06 Cabernet Sauvignons from Napa Valley (they're good).  Get the shrimp cocktail. Do it. The shrimp are gargantuan, and they're served with an atomic-level cocktail sauce that will singe your nose-hairs and make you slap your knee or pound your fist on the table. That's a good thing. Life is too short for wimpy cocktail sauce.  The table bread was unlike anything I've had before. It was cut up into chunks and drenched in melted butter and leeks and other seasonings. Very tasty. Comes with the salad course. Oh yeah, order your salad with the Garlic French dressing. Don't ask questions; just take my word for it.  There were less appealing details about our meal too. The sides (of mashed potatoes and fries) came out lukewarm at best. That's a shame; and should never happen in a fine dining situation.  Also, the the steaks are cooked completely on a grill -- not a completely bad concept, except that when cooked even to only a medium rare, there ends up being a huge ring of well done meat surrounding the juicy red interior. What a way to ruin a delicious Filet Mignon. Other steakhouses will sear the outside of the steaks briefly and then finish them in a supremely hot oven for more even cooking. I doubt if Durant's wants to change the way they're doing things; but it's also why I won't return there for a steak.  I would like to return though. I found my dining experience at Durant's very enjoyable. I'll go elsewhere for a delicious Filet Mignon, but I'll be back to Durant's for the wine, and shrimp cocktails, and maybe I'll try those scallops I've heard good things about. Also, it's a Phoenix landmark, and just very cool Rat-Pack-ish place to hang.

wYHOzg3wBm1RH4cbE7kzIg.text: My wife and I came here for an anniversary dinner. The ambiance, food, and service were all top notch. We had a ribeye, a filet, and some scallops. We also ordered an appetizer, dessert, and moderate bottle of wine. Out the door with tip ran us 300 bucks. I anticipated spending a good deal of money for dinner. I wasn't disappointed with anything but I can't help but think it was a bit overpriced. Anyway, everything was great....especially the bread, and the scallops were insane.

ehH7CVAYtrA5NK7slJZvrA.text: You expect to see the rat pack hanging out in the corner when you walk in the door, red velvet wall paper and star shaped lights...it really is a cool experience.  Best martini in town, always poured perfectly to the rim and topped off with a cheesy olive.  We started with debris and a giant wedge salad...finished with scallops and a giant mashed potato, all incredible.  It was our friends anniversary so they brought us a strawberry shortcake tower, four of us tried to eat it but sadly left half on the plate...it could be a dessert for 8!  Love this place

tICO41-rD2b6JBQUUE95yQ.text: You like old school? Downtown restaurants don't get more old school than Durant's. The decor and the atmosphere haven't changed in all in the decades they've called this building home (I know this only because my parents told me so).   I actually took a trip here as a matter of curiosity (and the fact my folks were treating me to a birthday dinner and it was therefore free). I didn't really have much knowledge of the place but I had been told it has the feel of a mafia hangout. They're right about that part, and you'll understand what I'm talking about if you go. Aside from that, I knew little about the menu other than it was a steakhouse. Now that I've been, a few lessons I've learned.   First, I am the worst son in the world. I had no idea just how expensive this place was. I'd been to some relatively pricey steakhouses before, but yowzaa! $20 for a caesar salad??? $50 for fillet mignon??? $75 for a porterhouse???
