Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Old entry.

rNl12-WbjmAlmZADD9SNPQ.text: We decided to try Durant's because it was close to our AirBnb in central Phoenix and came highly recommended. So we made reservation for 8pm and arrived quite a bit early. Luckily there was free valet parking.  As we entered the door we walked through the kitchen and all we saw was meat being chopped and felt as if we were walking into somebody's home. We were greeted by the host with such delight! Busy night, we were accommodated even though we arrived early. The server approached our booth within minutes. Took our drink orders and shortly after took our food order. The ambiance is way overrated. Ordered an 8oz filet for $61!! that comes with a mediocre salad and your choice of carb. To be honest you could get a better salad at a drive thru. I had three bites of my salad and they had already brought the steaks!! For my choice of side we had garlic mashed potatoes that tasted like they came from a box. The steak was so lacking in flavor all you could taste was the freezer burn, so bad I wouldn't even dare bring it home to my Doberman. Quickly asked for the check and made our escape. Take your money elsewhere this place is overrated.

XRa4YkTfN8CbMyUJAqEHPA.text: The food is so delicious. And oh wow customer service on point. They really know how to take care of customers especially when you're being greeted

Nkt0-UpukM21BuXd7KFrWQ.text: JJ the bartender is the best, he makes the best lemon drop, this restuarent never dissapoints always good :-)We are loyal patrons we have been coming to this restuarent since 2004.

haVm3rtx7PrExqI-J3CWng.text: Even with the ever changing landscape of Downtown Phoenix, Durant's stands as an iconic rampart to change.  It seems to have eschewed all the conventions of modern restauranteering, to the point that any deviation seems heretical.  After all the years I've been dining here, nothing much has changed in this one story building that exudes the atmosphere of the former Las Vegas stalwarts such as The Dunes, Old Flamingo, Sahara, et al.  You come in the back. Are greeted with dim lighting. And are seated in red-velvet.   In spite all of this, one thing hasn't changed - the fabulous food, and the exemplary service.  We were leaving the Mesa Arts Center at a relatively late hour, and my wife and I were both famished. There are some options for late night dining in the Valley, but even on a Saturday Night, the options diminish past 9 PM.  Neither of us wanted to settle for sub-standard food, but we didn't want to eat a substantial meal this late in the evening. I contacted Durant's just to verify their closing time, and when their kitchen closed.  If an establishment's desire is to shore up as many paying customers as possible for the day, the person answering the phone should be mindful of their tone when questions are posed that could potentially be an inconvenience. In short, don't sound like it's a bother if we are asking what time you are closing. We can easily discern your attitude over the speaker phone, even as we are speeding down the 202!  The gentleman who answered the phone was cheerful and promised us that if we were here before closing time, that the kitchen would be open for us.  As we entered the premises through the rear entrance, which winds through the kitchen; we immediately noticed how welcoming everyone was - sans the eye rolls that we were expecting for arriving near closing time.  No sooner had we stood by the main reception booth, we had no less then 3 people apologize for taking so long to seat us. And at least 2 people proffering to hang my jacket. It made for a great initial experience, since it was us that were inconveniencing them for arriving so late.  Lonnie, our server, seated us in less than two minutes. You could tell that he wasn't a neophyte in his function. He was efficient, friendly, prompt, and his inquisitiveness towards our satisfaction - sincere. Even when he was taking care of other customers, he never missed a glance over at ours to ensure that we taken care of.  Durant's is known for its steaks.   There aren't that many establishments in town that are on equal footing. Steak 44, Mastro's are on par. Maybe Eddie V's, JB's, Orange Sky, El Chorro can potentially be a rival, at times, just to name a few that come to mind.  Such was not our desired course of dining this evening. We ordered a Ceasar's Salad with grilled chicken, and the Chicken Piccata. We also ordered the Shrimp Cocktail as an appetizer.  The Salad was cold and crisp. The chicken grilled just right.   The Sauce on the Chicken Piccata was rich and flavorful. And the accompanying Chicken was prepared in a manner that wasn't undercooked and raw, nor overcooked and hard. The texture and batter was just right.  The shrimp cocktail had an amazing dipping sauce that simply added zest to the large shrimp portions.  Times may change. Downtown landscapes may change. Urban sprawl may cause economic and dining centers to expand.  But, there is no substitute for the time honored masterful preparation of superb cuisine; as well as, the execution of professional and cordial service.  Durant's has both in great abundance!

lWQWsQgTAoV3XpF33bJJfw.text: No wonder why this place has been around forever. Amazing food, top quality service and ambiance. One of my favorite restaurants for a special occasion. Everyone must try this place

CqnUzqWMucBD1n05ZsFy_w.text: I loved the service at this place, as soon as I arrived I was greeted by Everyone but the one person that stood out was Kenny he kept checking on me and was very kind answering all my questions. It was my first time ordering prime rib and to be honest I felt out of place but he made me feel right at home and explained the difference from a ribeye to the prime.   Kenny I hope they value you at this place because you sure are the True meaning of PERFECT customer service.   Thank you for a great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The prime rib was good, even though I had not ordered prime rib before I was a great dish.
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This bred was amazing

7RuAQed0v_22PlVHRRHTMQ.text: I yelped this restaurant and it had 4 stars!  We got there & the outside was less than desirable...and they didn't have any windows.  We decided to walk in & OMG....everyone enters through the kitchen!  We walked in & I said, "Oh I'm sorry, we came in the wrong door"!  The gentleman said no you didn't and shook our hand and every other persons hand, that walked in the restaurant.  We got into the dining area & it was absolutely amazing.  The candles were lit on every table, along with wine glasses & linens.  The staff was very professional, knowledgeable & extremely attentive!  The food & dessert was amazing!  Ask the waiter/waitress about the history of Durants; the story is fascinating!  We would highly recommend Durants!  Higher end, but worth every penny!

i2cJ_0uSKY98NjMte15rsA.text: Great ambience, food and service! The bread was delicious, our steaks tasted perfect and the dessert was the perfect breakfast (as we had no room left!) yeah. Walking through the kitchen was a bit strange but I love it and this place was excellent!!

95Cx9huTSVcOT-22eOraZw.text: What can I say that hasn't been said before. Best steaks in town. Impeccable service. Love the bar and eating in the big booths in the bar. It's my go to place for taking guests.

yh8CMRqUZmeEqKi6VJBTNQ.text: Came here tonight with my dad. I made a reservation for 4:30pm and was seated right next to the kitchen when we arrived. Very old school steakhouse with a lot of history. The meal started with some crudites and bread. They were both unique options. We started out with the calamari and the Kobe sliders. The calamari was fresh and tender and the marinara sauce was delicious. The Kobe sliders were served on a pretzel bun and they were pretty good, probably wouldn't order them again though. I got the bone in ribeye as my entree with mashed potatoes. Their soup of the night was a shrimp bisque and I ordered that. The soup was creamy and rich and it was filled with small pieces of shrimp. The ribeye was fantastic. Cooked perfectly and was very juicy and tender. The mashed potatoes were decent. Finished the meal with their famous strawberry shortcake which I don't really get the hype about. It could have been because I just got done eating 20 oz of steak but I really didn't care too much for the dessert. Cappuccino was just okay as well. This place is obviously known for their steak so that was the highlight of the meal. Great service and very cool old school atmosphere. Not sure how soon I will return but it's definitely worth checking out.

TFWZDWCu_ErjSPWKaW08kA.text: My mom and I decided to go on a vacation to Phoenix. She wanted to do it up big and go to a steakhouse on our first night on the town. Saw Durant's and thought why not. We pull up and she asked if it was a strip club. Small, unsuspecting joint. We get in and the ambiance is real - red lighting and vintage vinyl-style seating. Felt straight out of a Quentin Tarantino movie. I knew we were in the right place. It was a busy night, but we were seated right away. Service was phenomenal - always attentive and super down to earth. Great people. And, let's not forget the main courses - delish. I got a 6 oz. filet mignon. Mom got the prime rib. We polished it off with a white raspberry cheesecake that could've put Cheesecake Factory out of business. All around great meal, great place. 10/10 would go again.

DJa6yw2cXsork15XSwNZPA.text: Never disappointed.  We had a group of 6 and really enjoyed ourselves.  5 of us got ribeyes and loved them.  We only come a couple times per year but you're paying for the ambience and a night to be with classy people.  The drinks and wine selection are excellent.

ANBUG12vcHcz5JU67OuyWQ.text: It's been almost 10 years since my first visit to Durant's and I gotta admit, they've grown on me.  So much so, that after deciding to marry a bf of 12 years I couldn't think of any other place I'd rather have dinner afterwards!  As my dinner for 18 swelled into 30 and after multiple calls of shame asking for more seats, I was touched when Durant's went from a business that wasn't sure about being able to satisfy such a large group to a committed partner in making it all a great night to remember.  I'm a fan for life, and we'll definitely be back for our anniversary dinners!

jAihCX9_N2s2nINRGDN0xw.text: Whether you are just looking for an amazing steak house or you want an place that makes you feel like a 1950's mobster this the answer.  This place is amazing, the steaks are so good, the atmosphere is amazing and the staff is top notch. I can not say enough good things about this establishment.   Also unrelated..... One time I went here after Comic Con and saw Ron Pearlman at another table. I mean come on, if hellboy eats here than why wouldn't you?  Last thing, Always order the soup instead of the salad. They have a new soup everyday and they are all AMAZING.

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

6xzB8I-ghwJurBGzmAyvBQ.text: Back to Durant's to celebrate a special occasion and dinner.  Another exceptional experience.  No surprise really.  They are spot on here all of the time.  Thanks to the staff for making sure everything was perfect.

iJe4lAkaSstrP7FqbSRakw.text: Every time we come here, it is an amazing experience. The ambiance is wonderful with the thick leather seats, dark wood, and mood lighting. The service is noteworthy. They are never pushy or make you feel rushed. The food is incredible. The steaks are always perfectly cooked and the desserts are outstanding. This is definitely one of out preferred date/celebration locations.

dHH3-Zw0vsP2Oi5Mna9lWw.text: There are plenty of restaurants with great food or even better food for a fraction of the price. It's just ok... My shrimp on my salad were so overly salted that they cut my tongue. Scallops were great, steak good too... Just not worth the absurd prices.

3PUEsU-KGJaBbfyElUIOZg.text: This place is super hip. It has an old retro/Mad Men feel with low ceilings, red lighting, damask velvet walls, & dark maroon leather booths. You really feel like you're in a time warp eating amongst Italian mobsters. Love the ambiance & the place has a central bar area which makes it easy to people watch. The cauliflower soup is to die for & the basil, olive oil, butter, bread is super scrumptious. The raw oysters were also surprisingly fresh & delectable.  They are also known for their martinis which they did not fail to impress with their dirty martini. The old fashion was mediocre.  Nevertheless, the bartender sure knows his desserts!!  The key lime pie was out of this world!  My mouth is watering just thinking about it!

uVs_nNSjPjRqYNM7fE1tpg.text: what can I say ....gotta love "old school"...food was excellent. I dig the mobster feel.

90gEjD1QFFafVvWnkrkTZg.text: Chicken Marsala was awesome. Entire meal and experience was exquisite! Not just good steak.

2VxZF8MNXIHJ6KOPG89FtQ.text: Not impressed.  Went a few weeks ago and sat for over 20 minutes with NO service or even someone to order my drinks.  Not to mention, they appeared annoyed when me and my partner went in and didn't have a reservation.  The overall treatment made me feel less than welcome, little did they know I was prepared to indulge myself with a great deal of seafood and drinks.  Too bad for them, we ended up leaving after we had literally no attention at all from anyone.  For those prices, they should be worshipping you as a customer from start to finish.  Couldn't even get a reasonable "hello" from anyone.  My suggestion, stay away.  Donovan's on camelback is a much better option.  Go there, they will treat you like royalty instead of trash.

YqFO-AM0nnEhlzS5qVdkCQ.text: Step back in time at Durant's.  Great steaks & great environment. Service was stellar.

zYnusi4mi62Pml6RFxoguA.text: Loved Durant's! It was everything we had hoped for. Dim lights, fabric booths, excellent customer service, amazing food! Loved the artichoke dip that comes with the bread.

3USwFFTPqT_jSOi4xhzQ9A.text: Love the ambiance of Durant's.  Like the rest of the reviews mention, think mafioso.  Think Mad Men.  Think old school Phoenix.  The lighting is dark, the wall paper is red velvet, and the entrance is through the kitchen.  Marvelous.  The food and drinks weren't bad either!  I had one cosmo that put me at just the right "level," which I'm not sure if that says more about Durant's or my ability to handle alcohol.  In any case, the drinks were great.  I also had a New York strip, which was cooked at a perfect medium as ordered.    To sum it all up, the mood of Durant's prompted my boyfriend to propose to me at the end of the night.  Can you say romance?

LrNTGZ9RCdCjerRNXXgPQg.text: AAAAAHHHH!!! Oh my gosh!! The BEST rat pack style walk through the kitchen top of the line steak house AMAZING!!!! C:LASSY!! Dress nice!

03V_4Labw0S47oo8o-kMcQ.text: Service is impeccable- and the food along with it. The ambiance speaks of  by gone era when dining was an event best shared with friends and family.

YrJSL_4a1neVnT7GuqZ1Pg.text: How you doin'?  You doin' awright?  Did you tawk to da guy?  About dat thing?  I just didn't see the 5 stars here.  I dug the old school atmosphere.  I could almost see the Rat Pack in the corner.  The service was very good.  Maybe if I was a steak eater but I'm not.  I've heard the steaks are great.  Service was 4 star, atmosphere was 5 star, my food was only three star.  I guess that averages out to 4 stars...  I would give them another shot at a 5 star review but at Durant's prices they won't see me very often.  I tend to spread my $$$ dinners around when I do them at all...

rBaYIVU4j17i-dW7zNG4gQ.text: This place looks like a dump on the outside. My boyfriend asked me if it was an old strip club as we walked inside. He was serious.  They greeted us with "two?" And after we said yes, they again asked, "for dinner?" Well of course for dinner..After my boyfriend's first comment I started to second guess what else they might offer.     Literally the only cool thing about this place was the kitchen entry. However, upon entering we apologized because we thought we went through the wrong door. Apologizing for entering the restaurant. Weird.     It was our anniversary on a Sunday night. We were there, as well as two other tables. We didnt make it a point to tell the waitress of our occasion,  but she didnt ask either. We exchanged cards with eachother near the end of the evening. Our waitress seemed to not care as much about us, as she did the older folk that were seated next to us.     The steaks were decent. I have had better elsewhere for half of the cost. Please upgrade your cutlery. I have seen sharper knives at a dive bar. I got a workout while trying to cut my steak. Extremely frustrating and killed my mood. I was unimpressed with the Delmonico. Skip it..no flavor. Waitress did not come back to see if our steaks cooked properly (although the were to temperature.)     Ive read in some reviews that the decor is old school, mobster-like. Well I wish I had read that before I went, because I did not get that vibe at all. I got the vibe of a cheap, old place in desperate need of rennovation.     Extremely dissapointed in every aspect of this place. If I had known how to properly exit, I wouldve left before ordering. (Although I guess the kitchen was the main exit, just awkward not knowing as a first time guest)    This experience was so lousy, that we decided to do a "re-date" to celebrate our anniversary

XLkklJw-qWFP3Iv6HLQrKg.text: One of the best steakhouses in Phoenix, hands down. I've been twice and the food was flawless both times. Service is spot-on and the drinks are top notch. The staff has been here literally for decades, they don't leave. The guy who cooked our steaks had been there for 50 years. My one word of caution would be to be careful of going with too many people. 2-4 is fine. We went with 5 and got stuck in a half-shell booth that was not conducive to conversation and it appeared others were struggling with the same dynamic. Overall worth the effort and price, wonderful restaurant.

BhwTTeHuITgM4GKtkwUlzA.text: Only alright....we were sat in the children's section....the dress code and cellular phone policies are not enforced.   The food was average and overpriced.  The environment is very very loud. Our service was excellent but an overall disappointed.

mC1XRX3Uz0PMndmI1M9Fiw.text: Went to this place after eating next door at Switch based on the reviews. We didn't eat since we were full so this review is just about the bar. Sorry. You walk thru the kitchen to get into the place, which is cool. The restaurant is very old school feel, mafia like, dim lights, waiters in vests and bow ties. We did try some bread that looked amazing, even though we were full. Couldn't help myself as bread is a weakness of mine. Ciabatta loaf with a sauce poured over it of butter, leeks, shallot, garlic and basil. To die for. Their wine list is incredible, screaming eagle and sine non qua. Awesome. We definitely want to go back for the Delmonico steak as many restaurants don't even carry this kind of steak. The place was packed on a Sunday.

Cia27nTnjX97n0Dl-CFjlw.text: My husband and I LOVE this place.  The first time we went a friend had recommended this place to me, and I decided to make a reservation on OpenTable and we got in with no problems.  On the outside this does not look like much, and at first it throws you off that you have to walk to the kitchen to get to the dining area.  The staff is very friendly and knows the menu very well.  We order the Seafood Sampler and it is delicious.  Some steakhouses are hit and miss and this one is a hit over and over.    It is never a disappointment.  The Australian Lobster Tail and the Filet Mignon are the best that I have ever had!

33DdZOMuIkM6cAjTJPQqXQ.text: A step back in time. Great Bar, Great Food and Great atmosphere. Dark wood and red booths make this a nice visit to an earlier time.

zj6fHKZNPxCCeNHtJdd5Pg.text: Fine dining isn't very popular in this day and age. Most of the time a server is hired on their looks and on how well they can coax some bro into buying pitchers of bud light.   Durants is the pinnacle of fine dining in Phoenix. Straight up classic steakhouse fare, from oysters and crabcakes to filets broiled to perfection. Take a cab or come with a DD, because they have the most knowledgable bartenders ever. The only place where I can order an old fashioned and not feel like a jerkoff.  Save room for dessert, so far I've had the creme brulee, ny cheesecake, and tiramisu. All were excellent! Enter through the kitchen in the back, and tip your waiter well, these people really bust their ass to provide great service!

0SqHsYuDAwXvEYRuZxjafA.text: This place was pretty cool overall.  The entrance takes you through the kitchen and then into the restaurant.  The restaurant has an old school design to it with the leather booths.  The food was pretty good as well.  I really enjoyed the bread and the garlic mashed potatoes.  I bought prime rib which I only have done maybe 2 or 3 times in my life.  It was ok but I wish I would have gotten a steak now.  My friend ate the 48 oz steak which was huge.  Then as a "reward" he was given a mountain of a dessert that was pretty good as well helped him eat it.  I would go again for sure and try the steak next time.

wtpucQXbCjB9xpA2v4BEjw.text: If it weren't for the ice-cold A/C, this place would definitely get 5 stars! I just got home from dinner with my brother-in-law, who's in town for a conference.  He said "pick a nice place" and, of course, I chose Durant's! Valet parking.  Cute as a button, and I gave him the "I wanna put you in my pocket" line.   See, my sister and her family live in the OC.  Not much for flavor there.  When we walked in through the kitchen, the first thing the bro-in-law said was "Awesome!  Just like old Queens mobsters, walking in through the kitchen!" We were early for our reservation, but it didn't look like we needed it for a Monday night (come on, it's football season!) so we were promptly seated. Decor reminds me of my Hungarian/Polish grandparent's house.  Red velvet wallpaper and dark red leather booths.  Really plush and the booths could sit 4 comfortably.  There were some hotties in there, so I made sure to sit across from the bro-in-law!   One of the thing you KNOW means class is them giving out BLACK linen napkins if you're wearing black.  Nothing ruins a good night out more than white lint on your lap. The bread came and it was doused in an olive oil-basil-onion concoction.  I only had a little piece, but it was awesome!  It was already pre-cut, too.  Convenient! The BIL (keep up, that's brother-in-law and I'm gonna type it a bunch of times and that's just ridiculous) had to order the fried calamari, his staple.  Breading was light, but a bit too salty. The soup special was an onion-cheese and really rich and creamy.  I had the 8oz filet with a side of garlic mashed potatoes.  BIL got the scallops, which had pieces of bacon around the edges.  Both dishes were perfect.  My steak was done just right - medium rare.   We shared dessert.  Strawberry shortcake.  For 2.  We couldn't even finish it.  Topped with homemade whipped cream. The best touch, though, was the ambience.  Oh, and members of "the Family" at the table right next to us.  Ah, to hear that Queens accent again!   Definitely my top high-end restaurant in the Valley now!  I'll be back!  Not with the BIL, though.  I'll bring one of my boys.

JIshajYpedcWmh09Kn08OQ.text: The emperor has no clothes.  There.  I said it.  I had one the top 5 WORST dining experiences of my life eating at Durant's.  The food was average.  I had scallops that were slightly overcooked, poorly seasoned and somewhat gritty.  I tasted my fellow dining mates steaks and they were well below average compared to other steaks in this cost bracket (Flemings, Ruths Chris, Capital Grill).  And at $30 an entree I expect my food to be served without a side of attitude.  The service wasn't bad, it was offensive.  Our server was rude, sarcastic, flippant, and completely disrespectful. My husband actually got up halfway through the dinner to pull him aside and alert him that we were not happy with the service and to give him a chance to step it up.  We were quite polite and discrete about it.  The server proceeded to come back to the table and make jokes about this and announced sarcastically to the table that "he heard we were in a rush to get somewhere" and he was going to speed things up.  Um.  Wrong.  We weren't in a rush.  All we wanted was to enjoy our dinner.  It was bad enough I brought my parents to this place.  But I would have been truly mortified if I had brought a client here.  I will never go back.    If you have read my reviews, you know I am not prone to writing harsh reviews unless it is totally deserved. This one is.  Durants seems to be one of those old school restaurants that is skating by on its history and once-deserved reputation.  My advice?  Don't bother.  I can think of at least 5 other steak houses in the Valley where you will get a better meal for about the same or less money with far better service.  Lets review:  expensive mediocre food, horrible service, loud chaotic atmosphere...  really?  Your still going to give it a try?  Okay, don't say I didn't warn you.

fh2ChxKTVhY_UOmduesn4w.text: Having lived in Phoenix for over 13 years now, I am well acquainted with Durant's. It is not possible to live here without being told about the place, so unique is it in the land of strip malls and chain-fueled palates. Everything you've heard about the place is True - inside it is a temple to the masculine Hollywood of yesteryear, replete in red velvet and leather. I remember my first experience with the place all those years ago and if my memory serves me correctly, you could expect top-notch food and top-notch service for your top-notch bill.  Not anymore. Durant's has clearly become so enamored with itself that it is of the opinion that it is the destination alone that you will drop a Benjamin per person to experience, and the quality of the food and waitstaff are afterthoughts, annoyances. Their appetizers and sides are criminally paltry, but you won't care because they're terrible. Dry, flavorless, uninspiring. Except the crab cakes, drat it - they're still good - so good that after I ate my forkful-sized portion I was in such bliss that I didn't even think about the fact that that bite and my companion's bite cost me twenty bucks. Their steaks are prime cuts made well, but then again, they ought to be, no?   The real kicker here though is the service. When I'm laying down the kind of smack that Durant's commands, I hold my waiter to a higher standard. The tips are (or could reasonably be expected to be) exponentially higher than average, therefore they should have fewer tables and be far more attentive than average. I'm a very easy guy to get along with and I tip well, so it's not like I'm expecting a backrub or anything, but in both of the last two trips I have taken here, my order has been incomplete or flat-out wrong. In both the last two trips I have gone for ten or more minutes trying to even FIND my waiter, much less ask them for something, and when I did find them, their attitude was absolutely flip if not downright rude. I chalk it up to the casual attire I had on because everything about the waitstaff's behavior indicates that they engage in wealth profiling. In a place where a bad tip has to be somewhere around twenty or thirty bucks, you wouldn't think it would matter. Not so much.  Sorry to have to say it, but I won't be back. I give it two stars for what it used to be.

fEs-bRlMUOYAAxx0kyPqvQ.text: I had another fantastic meal at Durant's on Tuesday!  For me, Durant's the best steak house in Phoenix maybe in the South West! Excellent food and fantastic service, can't wait to go back!

1g6kGXoDMPIExElgP3lwxQ.text: i had no idea durant's was so cool baby when i decided i had to go there. here's the story.  in my last semester of college i did a huge invetigative thing on don bolles (the reporter who was murdered here in '76). anyway, when interviewing all the old school reporters who were tailing the mob back then, the name Durant's came up every time. most of the hotels, restaurants, coffee shops they talked about for insider tips and secret rendevous didn't exist anymore, but this one did. so i thought how cool it would be to see this part of az history.  two years later i finally made it (god, i've been out of college two years? whew). it was nothing like i expected from the seedy stories i was told that went on here 30 years ago.  first, the entrance through the kitchen kind of rocks - it's hotter in there than it was outside in august, the chefs look annnoyed and it feels awkward, but  damnit where else can they charge nearly $20 for a caesar salad and make you walk through a hot ass kitchen to do it?  i had heard the martinis were the bee's knees here, so i ordered one, with vodka, dirty. i'm not just saying this - i was ready to have to defend my love of this place despite their overpriced whatever because i had decided two years ago this place was awesome - that was one damn.good.martini. not too dirty,  not too strong, BIG and about $10 (happy hour price). i almost didn't get it because i was hot and thirsty and dirty martini didn't sound refreshing, but it was somehow still delicious.  i only made it to the lounge, which is probably where i'll spend most of my future visits. long bar, great plush, vintage decor, wonderful service. the server was unpretentious, friendly, chatty and professional, right down to how he offered their dessert options. you know how most servers disinterestedly prattle off "double chocolate lava cake, ooey-gooey caramel cheesecake" ? not this guy, he sincerely offered up some of the most delicious concoctions as though he handmade each one as his chosen form of artistic expression.  this place is a time warp. it' still dominantly male business crowd, but i didn't let the polos, silver hair and understated expensive shoes and watches kill my mood (it was tuesday at 5:30, what can you expect?). plus it's on central, and i feel it's my duty to go uot of my way to support biz's stuck in the light rail construction mess.

_dnhLFpyWRhiwO88TN7rqw.text: A classic that will never be replicated in Phoenix.  You can feel the nostalgia from the second you walk in, which helps since you walk through the kitchen into a scene straight out of Boardwalk Empire.  Steaks were fantastic.  The server was close to 70, but knew everything on the menu front and back and did a great job.  I'd pay money to see one of the Scottsdale nightclub service brats try and keep up with her for a night!  What you would expect from a classic steak & chop house.  Will definitely be back time and time again.

HD_HUlNhcPphRcEq9ltuvg.text: Hands down the best steakhouse/fine dinning experience in Phoenix.  If you are in the mood for a True experience Durants is the best.  I love entering from the kitchen, it is nice to see where your food is coming from.  The ambiance reminds you of a scene from a 1940's movie, you full on expect Frank Sinatra to sit down next to you and order a martini.  Not to mention that the food and the staff are amazing.  I come here for all my special celebrations and make it a point to let out of town guests experience Durants as well.

5YTVmBKkItlcpsfWkVo5kg.text: I really like Durant's.  A couple of my best memories were made here.  I've had the coconut shrimp and also the crab; both were fantastic.   i've also gone there just for drinks, and i have to say that Durant's is probably the best place to sit down and talk over drinks with a friend.  It's like entering a different world.  It's just so cozy, with those low lights and plush red velvet.  I especially loved it because with the two of us at the bar, it felt like we were the only two people in the world.  The staff is so incredibly attentive, and the bartender is very jovial and friendly.

PfI9vqpE8vA6lh9xz0erGA.text: Service - 5 stars (which is so rare). Food 2.5 stars.  My husband and I are a little picky when it comes to steaks (we eat Morton's and Mastro's) but we wanted to try a new steakplace while visiting Phoenix and Durant's had great reviews.  When you get to the restaurant, you walk through the kitchen (pretty cool to see everything) then you're greeted by the host. We came for a pretty early dinner and literally every single person - host, kitchen staff, waiter/waitresses greeted us. The decor is pretty cool - kind of burlesque-ish, all walls are a deep red, there are huge vases of roses everywhere. Our waiter Fred was awesome!! Very friendly and professional.  I had their vegetable beef soup (good but salty) and my husband had house salad. I ordered the trout with lemon caper sauce which was very bland. My husband had rib-eye and it was also bland which was surprising. Their dessert - trio creme brulee - was the best part of the meal! So from this meal we decided if we want steak, we're sticking with our usual Morton's.

Pn93-y1jaCzgwKcDlKG9OQ.text: I really don't know if I can put into words what I love about Durant's without posting some photos of it as well. A vegetarian at a steakhouse...and I love it! I came here for late night drinks and I found the staff to be great. I stuck to cheap G&Ts and smokes at the bar, but transferred to this luxurious round tables for martinis and steak abound when Aaron and his crew arrived. The soft lighting, paintings, clean but totally time-warp feel, wallpaper with velvet touches, a ladies room with a lounge sofa to die for, a bar straight out of the Shining...I mean, this is a classy place to bring grandma or someone you wanna get in their pants or just friends to shoot the shit all adult like. Right on.

xHgTkIk_kNJsGi0NYaOLmQ.text: Pure classic Phoenix, a must visit with out of town visitors. The food is always excellent, and I love that the decor probably hasn't changed since the 70s. The service is top-notch, and they make some of the best martinis in town.

aRzFeBf-hUCr4dkNQl-P3g.text: This is my favorite steak house of all.  They have their parking lot in the back and you can enter the restaurant through the back door that leads you through the kitchen.  The cooks all stop to greet you before you are escorted in to the seating area which is covered in glass, mirrors and red velour.  The food here is just amazing.  The seafood is fresh and incredible.  Hard to imagine in a land locked state but I guess they fly it in on a regular basis.  This is *must* on any meat lover's list of destinations to visit if you are in Phoenix.

caC98T81Z2Co6N0WGV8ANg.text: This has been my favorite restaurant for the last 20 years.  The food is always excellent, and entering through the kitchen just adds to the ambiance.

hQ4C22EG15kMG5FgT5mmEw.text: The original downtown "power" restaurant.  I could start a cult based solely on their bread with the garlic-leek-butter drizzled on top.  Everything on the menu is tasty, but don't expect Mastro's style steaks, great quality, just more of an old school broiler style.  Don't miss the "debris" as an app, delightful little skewers of grilled beef and veggies (they make a perfect lunch as well).  The red velvet walls, red leather booths and throwback waitstaff only add to the authentic Rat Pack feel.  Growing up in AZ every great story involving local politics seemingly involved the bar here.  Truly a local treasure.

k6TQ7tDWrBmm5qh8jtcsww.text: While I'm no steak-eater, I do think Durant's is a cool place to go for drinks or dinner every now and then.   They also have awesome desserts.  And if you're into steak, chicken or the like, you'll probably love this place. It's over 50 years old too, so that makes it somewhat of an AZ landmark.  It's said to be Arizona's first steakhouse.  I would describe it as upscale old-school.  I think I just invented a new category for restaurants, thank you very much.    The restaurant is nice, but a little retro and it definitely reminds of when my Grandma Mary used to take me here. She'd put on a sequin dress and her floor length fur coat and we'd head to Durant's for dinner. What? Grandma Mary is really glam, okay?

3LCUEnUVkVH1tIq_0ynhww.text: My family has dined here since the late 70's when I was a kid growing up in Phoenix. It's a point of pride for locals, serving outstanding steaks, chops, etc. it has ALWAYS looked the same and I feel right at home in the Rat Pack "themed" dining room. Enter & exit through the kitchen back door to see the busy, well-managed & friendly kitchen. This place is expensive, but the outstanding quality of food and superior service make for a fine experience. The restaurant is employee owned (at least it was... when Jack Durant died decades ago he left the restaurant to his employees along with $1 million to be divided up amongst them and rumor has it that some of the $ also went to his prized bulldogs, who are also honored by having their portraits displayed in the bar. For years & years the wait staff remained the same, and familiar to my family.)  They really put everything into their service. I sincerely hope you love it there as much as I do.

u6P4M5thBHYy56OsYqUA_g.text: This steakhouse in Phoenix is a historic landmark!  Step into the walls of this establishment, and you'll be whisked back in time to an era where you could imagine Frank Sanatra and James Dean dining on steak in the corner booth.  The service, food and ambiance is not to be missed.  They do steak the way it should be done, and many amazing dishes!

T0dLc0CA3HWdQF0Ov0dQMA.text: I'd give it 5 stars but the oysters were bad... really bad. Ambiance is really cool in a retro way and the prime rib was superb. The staff is attentive and reminiscent of old school American steak restaurants from Chicago or NY. If you're looking to drop some dough on a good steak dinner with more character than Morton's or Fleming's, this is your place.

oQgA0B0GdrnqE3nA-C3qBA.text: The first time I went to Durant's was with my little brother.  What makes this interesting is you have to know that when we go to steak restaurants with each other we order the biggest piece of meat on the menu.  Usually that isn't a problem but at Durant's the biggest steak is a 48 oz porterhouse.  We looked at each other and knew we were in trouble.  Luckily you can order it for 2 but that is still 24 oz a piece.  Also, whatever is on their bread is amazing I can never tell because it is so dimly light in the place.  But it is delicious.  Even more sweet is that they have servers walking around filling your glasses with Evian water.  The piece de resistance is when the steak came out and we were in awe.  It was freaking great.  The best steak I have ever had.  I also had a several chocolate martinis and as the other reviews state they were strong.  I was so blitzed at the end of the night I don't even remember if we finished the steak.  I know we ordered dessert because I found it in my fridge later in the night.  I love that you can walk on the red carpet through the kitchen into the restaurant.  Can you say Goodfellas?  Although no one brought us our own table.  The red velvet walls and the dim lighting make it a very relaxing environment and I love the booths.  This is the best of Phoenix history. What else can I say!!!

WrDQiEMO5S2QM6_WGQbjDA.text: Got severe food poisoning at this place back in 2015. Just remembered I forgot to Yelp about it. No one else got sick at our table, so I assume it was my steak which was the only thing no one else touched.

e1evRWCMRUqLfBRSdDmAyQ.text: So, I visited Durant's after viewing the menu online and reading some reviews.  The place is old school, which I love, and looks as if it hasn't changed much in 50 years.  Again...totally cool, and if you like the retro, Sinatra, Goodfellas vibe, this place has it.  The service was great, no complaints.  I ordered an 8 oz filet (medium), an 8 oz cold water lobster tail (surf and turf), a side of mushrooms, a piece of cheesecake with strawberries, and a coffee.  Bread and some pickled veggies come with dinner, and the entree came with a cup of soup and a starch.    Everything was cooked nicely and presented nicely, nothing to write home about, but it was all done as you'd expect.  The steak was a little more "bullseyed" than I'd like...the outer "well-done" ring of meat was a bit thicker than I'd expect for a medium steak, but it was OK.  Had I done it again, based on how they cook their meat, medium rare would have likely been ideal.    Now, the part that garners one star.  My total bill, with a 20% tip, was $185.  This was for one person, the meal I listed above.  The surf and turf was $118, if I recall.  The prices for the steak and seafood entrees were absolutely nothing short of highway robbery, in my opinion.  I've dined at many steakhouses, chains and smaller ones, and the prices at this one were so far out of line that I'd say they are probably 1.5x to 1.8x what they should have been.  Furthermore, the prices are NOT on the menu posted on the "menu" section of their website.  Had they been, I never would have gone there.  I checked other establishments, and the prices posted for Phoenix steakhouses were on par with what I'd expect just about anywhere.  I'm from Philadelphia.  For a comparison, in a top Philly steakhouse, and I mean one of the top rated in the city based on things like Yelp and Zagat, you can get a THREE POUND butter poached lobster, plus an 8oz filet for what I paid for an 8oz tail, and 8oz filet.  The prices are just unbelievable, and again, this is from someone that dines out often.  That, combined with the fact they don't post their prices online, is why the one-star rating.    So, if you're willing to pay for a retro kind of place, and I mean PAY through the nose, by all means.  Otherwise, there are plenty of other steakhouses in Phoenix with perfectly acceptable pricing that would be just as good, if not better.  These people should be ashamed of themselves.  Had it not been 9:30pm, I absolutely would have walked out and gone elsewhere, but having no car and no other reservations on a Saturday night, I had to suck it up and deal.  They got me this time, but never again.    -J

wTIvznkKjih8n47ZmswU7A.text: Great retro place. Plus the drinks they poor are legit!!  Worth checking out if you are the area or looking for a great night of food and drinks

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

leLpx0TMvlF-ib__kjKl4A.text: I hosted six for a birthday celebration.  We had hoped to sit in the bar but the tables were full.  Later that day James called us back and said he found a way to accommodate us in the bar!  How lovely!  Ron our server was part of the festivities.  All the women wanted to take him home!  After a lovely evening I left my credit card.  I live in San Diego and didn't realize I left it until I got home.  I called and of course they had it.  I asked them to drop it in the mail.  No, they said, they would Fed Ex it and would not let me pay for that.  One day later I had my card.  You can't do better than Durant's.

TkRKAgtV7GbOlb8mF3I6AA.text: Went here with my son for Christmas Eve dinner. We both had steaks and they just melted in your mouth.  The service was really good and we want to go back there again.  It is on the dark side though lighting wise, but a wonderful experience and meal.

gyt5uyPmXztbVPFLeAzhWg.text: What a great place! I never would have thought that I would love a restaurant where I had to enter through the kitchen.  This is it!   Amazing place with amazing food!

pbAWU17oFRUCKSvcwEC5_g.text: Ya ever feel like kickin' it old skool? I'm talkin Brat Pack dayz - where you can hear some Sinatra crooning in the background? And, patrons (donning fedoras and suits) enter their favorite place for a bloody steak/Martini through the kitchen?  Durant's has this. I promise. I feel like an O.G. when I eat here, due to the aging, red seats and dimmed red "mood lights". It really makes me feel like always having my back faced to the wall, as if a thug would bust through the doors and cap my azz! It has a dramatic vibe and I adore places with such personality.  I haven't visited in awhile, but they do serve up a very good Crab Louie/Shrimp Salad (generous amounts of seafood).  Hmmm... perhaps I'll suggest lunch here w/my friend on Saturday?!

K28qrIYCSOlb9_cQDWqvfA.text: Great old school Resturant that understands HIGH QUALITY service & food is a great combination

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

p8FWrJalO1jS4vy1tVJTFg.text: I love the Nostalgia! the location is fantastic! The customer service here is great. Nice happy hour ,fantastic food! good place to have a nice dinner or a place to hang out.

8zLzewLQAKhqfsUtMmQRWA.text: My name is Luke I am 10 years old and this is a amazing  restaurant 10/10.  When I walked inside  It looked so amazing inside. The first thing I noticed was the  amazing art  and lights when I went in the kitchen the cooks weren't mean.  Our Server was a man named Chris very nice. The food was so good and it didn't  it didn't take long to make it was 2-3 minutes it was amazing I'm still on my appetizers buts so far was amazing  My favorite part was the jumbo shrimp scampi  And the soup. I would recommend this restaurant to every one who is close to it. 10/10

zPgh2U6_WzL0OvkWZ51V7A.text: This is my FAVORITE restaurant me and my girlfriend have been together for ten years, we always have our anniversary dinner here! Strawberry shortcake is the best

Igh0qKRF_71dH-60YnRchw.text: When I looking for a steakhouse to celebrate my anniversary with my wife, Durant's came highly recommended thru some friends. I'am So happy I took their recommendation. My medium rare 18oz ribeye was perfect. The appetizer bread it's addictive, and if you come to Durant's and fail to leave room for dessert you'll miss out. We shared the peach cobbler and was just too delicious not to force down in gluttony.  Thank you the great experience! Highly recommended!

MMWiAKMwHfzvBk7EtflmGg.text: Love this place. Yes it is "old school" Phoenix but with that comes GREAT service and great steaks.  It is expensive but I LOVE going in through the back door into the kitchen. The chiefs and staff acknowledge you as pass through their area.  EVERYONE is Proffesional. Sometimes you just need or want THE BEST! Thank you David.

-mO49IjhwwZ9VNrqXOOSkg.text: Ah, a Phoenix classic. Everything is consistent here - and approachable price points compared to other places in town! Friendly staff, great drinks, and a memorable atmosphere. One of my favorites in town. A Must Try for visitors! The bread is to die for - and you must try the strawberry shortcake!

C2rSYCzfatWRbb2qrylMcg.text: I've eaten here several times over the past few years and it's my favorite restaurant in Phoenix. The atmosphere is as good as the steak and the staff has never let me down. Celebrated my wife's birthday with some of her friends and they didn't rush us out even when we, unknowingly, stayed past closing time.   I always recommend Durant's to friends who are looking to do something memorable. I'm a loyal customer for life!

TkHUz9OzAfUta4McghmgXA.text: All the food was amazing. The steak and bread will be remembered forever. David, our waiter was a True professional and gave us 5 Star service. The whole team works really well together and walking through the kitchen is an added plus!

P_7U4QCk4vsco2bTd-eXHw.text: From the time we walked in this awesome joint, the meal just kept getting better and better. Cool old school steak place, red leather booths and all. Had the filet prepared Pittsburg style, and it was perfect! Great mashed, wonderful salad with awesome ranch dressing and delicious cheese cake. Crazy wine list and perfect atmosphere.   One of my new hang outs!!

vfIFjYBTrlr_g1dlSFzweA.text: This restaurant is a very entertaining and interesting place to dine. The food was delicious and the service was beyond outstanding.

JRcpHWH815NSOzd2pAYhWg.text: I cannot believe it has been this long since we've been here but it won't be long before the next visit Service- outstanding. Drinks, shrimp cocktail, filet, twice baked, bread- outstanding.  When we told our server that we had a "little problem" last time- he brought a comp dessert Class place. Great steaks. Perfect martini. Be back soon!

8pUS7JCExz6_Hmr2YzhBOQ.text: Great meal. Real "old school" steakhouse. Liver and Onions was superb as was the wedge salad.  Attention to detail in every respect.  Next time I am in Phoenix I will make it my first stop

xdYCT0pMNpEb7Vvq_Ot65g.text: I came here for my birthday dinner and I'm so glad that I did! Right off the bat when we enter the restaurant we're greeted by all the staff members that we walk past by. Their customer service is on point!   I didn't call in advance for a reservation but still managed to get seated right away. Just have to b careful if you come during the weekends because I heard it gets really packed! The waiter checked on us pretty frequently and made sure that our party was good.   I ordered the bone in rib eye which was extremely delicious and cutting the steak was like cutting butter. Mashed potatoes is a must! Just when I thought the experience couldn't have been any better, I decided to order the strawberry shortcake for dessert and it was the perfect follow up after enjoying a nice steak. Even when I was full, I wanted to keep going and eat my entire dessert because of how good it tasted! Overall Durant's is one of the best steakhouses in the valley!

SLeQbNkkoIcSW96DLRLX9g.text: You know the best part of Durant's?  The very best part?  You enter through the kitchen. Seriously. And when you enter through the kitchen at 8:30pm on a Saturday night, it's no reality show. It's a busy, functioning restaurant. I try to slow-walk as best I can.   After that, not so much. It's so old-school there's ice in the urinals. You're not gonna find that in many places.   To me the food is very average and priced at the top of the line. My 12 oz filet was quite good. No extra charge for the red-flock wall paper but I kept wondering what my steak would have tasted like at Steak 44, Donavan's m, you know.   In other words, you're paying as much is anywhere in town and what you getting for it is an old-school steak. You go. I'm done.   Except for the entrance.   8/10/2019 -- the guy sitting next to me at the bar was 93 years old. He told me. Couldn't hear a thing. But he offered up him s age and that "our"bartender was "Bartender of the Year". Hmmmm...  I question this because she took over 5 minutes to greet me. Well, to be honest, she never greeted me; she only "greeted" me because I put my hand up to order a drink. Perhaps the bartender of the year might want to greet people more quickly than that...for a $14 martini...  And here's the thing: I know she's got responsibilities, I know she's just working a job trying to keep food on the table and a roof over her head, but she's in the HOSPITALITY BUSINESS!  By not being hospitable, she's really just there to collect a paycheck. As a bartender, you can't be that obvious.   I don't mind contributing to her fund but the first order of business is hospitality!! Say hi!!  Be friendly! "I'll be right with you!" CAN last a lot longer than five minutes  Listen, I suspect there's DNA stuffed in the red flock wallpaper from the Eisenhower administration. You go there. I'm done.

_0cDXu3NqMb__-ykLYPcbg.text: We have heard so much about this place that my boyfriend decided to take me here for my birthday. From the outside, the restaurant doesn't look much to look at. However, once you walk into the restaurant, you are completely transformed.  From the parking lot entrance, you enter the restaurant through the kitchen which is both a little weird but also a very cool concept. The entire restaurant is sleek and sexy with a red room vibe.   Now can we talk about their specialty bread?!? OMG that bread.. it was garlic, chives, butter and I can't remember what else but it was HELLA delish. I ordered the Chicken Marsala with garlic mashed potatoes. The chicken Marsala had to be the thickest Chicken Marsala I have ever had but it was so juicy and flavorful.   My boyfriend ordered one of the steaks with the baked potato. He definitely enjoyed the cut and said it was perfect. We finished the evening with a Homemade Key Lime Pie.  I highly recommend this place for a sexy date night out.

uc28EFoX7Kvcavwh_aEEBA.text: In the words of Jack Durant , ' In my humble opinion, Durant's is the finest eating and drinking establishment in the world'. It definitely is in Phoenix in MY not -so-humble opinion! When there is something to celebrate in my world, I always turn to Durant's. Things in food don't have to be overly done, they have to be good, here they are superb. When you enter the iconic restaurant that has been housed on Central Avenue for decades through the kitchen back door , you are greeted warmly and the cleanliness of the kitchen stand outs. The bar is fantastic; we generally come before our reservation to enjoy something at the bar. We have seen the same bartenders for years and they are always great. The maitre de always checks with us to ask if we are ready to be seated. We always make a reservation so we can have a booth. The steaks here are just superb. The last time my husband and I shared the Porterhouse and two Lobster Tails! Such a treat . We started with sharing the Shrimp Cocktail, which is huge and has the most amazing cocktail sauce I've ever tasted. We also love sharing the Wedge Salad, this time we did not, as the entree we were about to partake in was going to be A LOT! The Porterhouse is served thinly sliced : filet on one side and NY Strip on the other, even for two sharing, we have yet to finish this steak when we have ordered it. You can have sauces brought , as well. But, this steak, as all Durant's steaks , need no sauce.. they are just pure perfection. The bread that you begin with is amazing too; that oil and garlicky leek! Mmmmm! I usually try to not fill up on this and save room for my meal. Entrees here are old school , in that they are served with the soup or the great house or caesar salad , a side , ( there are many!) , and veggies of the day. The wine list is out of this world .. so are the martinis. Now if you happen to be a very lucky person, you have one of the rare , famed 'lifetime' Durant's tokens in your possession. We have been lucky enough to have dined here when the celebratory tokens were passed out on a few occasions. If you have one , you know .. ;)  "Good Food, Great Steaks, and The Best Booze are the necessities of life!" , according to the humble philosophy of the great Jack Durant.. I happen to agree that they are three! Keeping it simple on food and fancy with flare while providing perfect service , steaks , seafood and drinks make this a perfect place for me. Next time you sip that great martini in the iconic bar .. cling your glass and tip the man : 'Hey Jack!' You can almost hear these walls beckon his name !

CjkjbxpOMvBfzdNJS8CuGg.text: I love Durant's for an occasional/special occasion lunch.   This time we were celebrating a birthday and the server comped us any dessert we wanted. The birthday girl chose the strawberry shortcake and shared it with the rest of us.   It was huge and delicious. We even got one to take home and they are so thoughtful in how they packed it so that we could reassemble it at home.   Everyone enjoyed their meals including hamburgers and chicken livers.

e_SHPI3MnbV1ZpTGIIxUdw.text: Good spot in uptown Phoenix. There's no free parking but they have valet service. There's a huge bar and tons of seating.  We were seated and attended to quickly. I ordered a broiled filet mignon open faced sandwich with garlic mashed potatoes. My meal also came with soup or salad. I opted for the salad. Wife ordered the grilled salmon with garlic mashed potatoes and broccoli cheddar soup. Filet mignon was tender and delicious. Wife also enjoyed her salmon. Broccoli cheddar soup, side salad, starter bread and garlic mashed potatoes were also very tasty.  We got a free dessert of our choice for celebrating our wedding anniversary. We opted for the tiramisu. It was delicious and infused with alcohol.

y6oTec4Yjy3peqlnUcsWng.text: Wow... this restaurant has to be in my top 3 of all time. Old school feel, but so classy at the same time. Enter thru the kitchen in the back and say hello to the wonderful chefs. Every time I've been here I spend about 3 hours here. I love the crudites platter, a nice touch. Their leek bread is out of this world. I've had the filet, ribeye, all been wonderful every time. Perfectly seasoned steaks. Desserts are great as well, strawberry shortcake is worth the try. Don't even get me started on their drinks! Durant's makes a STIFF drink I can only have 2 at the most and then I'm good for the night! I can't say enough about the quality and vibe this restaurant has, it really is the best.

4qJB8lrPsBF-l07G2vkmHg.text: A friend was in town and we were all talking about places we have been, and I stated that I have never been to Durant's and it was decided we had to go! Durant's is one of those epic dining experiences.  Durant's is lush! From the red walls to the red seating, you feel as if you have stepped back into time and just know this is going to experience and having been during the holidays with the lights and decorations all around just gave it more of special touch.  I was absolutely tickled pink when a small dish of crudite to nosh on was brought to table. It had carrots, green onions, olives and celery served with ice, and is totally something my grandmother use to present before meals. Loved it! Also brought to the table was some of the best tasting bread, it was a bowl loaf cut up and covered in garlic, artichoke and olive oil! So good!   I have been craving prime rib for a while so after checking out the menu I went with the 8-ounce prime rib with baked potato and salad. Even though it was a normal side salad, it too was fancy, it was fresh and crisp and for the dressing I ordered Roquefort dressing, simply the best!  The prime rib was perfect, the outside was crispy, the inside medium rare and juicy! The au jus was amazing too, but honestly not really needed, the prime rib on its own was outstanding. Even the baked potato was divine! This was an amazing meal!  I also tried the strawberry shortcake, and this put all other strawberry shortcakes to shame! It was light, fluffy and decadent. So dreamy!   Service was impeccable, everything about this dining experience was excellent. This is the place to go if you are wanting to impress your audience.  Amazing company, superb service and fabulous meal. Cannot wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

nFriXMTUpZQG9W4jF1aPPg.text: When you love something and you hold it to an expectation, it is hard to maintain a threshold. I know people that are legends in this place and have had chips passed down in families. I have personally decorated the wall and worked my way to where this was even an inspiration. Over time batons get passed on and another is deemed to carry the torch.   I will always love Durant's, but it is not the place I once knew. This is not a review to discourage you, it is simply the development of a foregone standard. The food will not disappoint you and the cocktails will carry on strong, but the reverence has dwindled a bit.

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Only chic on the block

PToBa0ISHY8r2sQc7Db2pA.text: Beautiful, beautiful restaurant (even it's super dark and you can hardly see anything). Looks intimidating from the outside, but the inside is beautiful. I didn't get good enough service since I walked in so that's a huge let down for a place that cost this high.  Atmosphere: (5/5) * Elegant and truly high class, looks like you're in God Father movie or any mafia type restaurant perfect for dating scene  Food: (4/5) * For the money you are going to spend I don't think they really deliver the quality, you can get a much better meal at Texas roadhouse for way cheaper, nevertheless the food was nice, taste wasn't great but not bad  Staff: (3/5) * I walked in the restaurant and wait for 10 minutes for them to even say "hi" which was a huge let down for me, they saw me but choose to ignore me anyway  Cleanliness: (5/5) * Clean and spotless  Good hang out spot: Great for date not for serious eater

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Soup
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

AJ3vwDX23ki2C1MmcbiFAQ.text: Wow-what an experience!!!  This place is fantastic from the service to the food to the interior lighting, it really was a special dinner.  The homemade horseradish sauce and raw horseradish to complement the already outstanding prime rib were great. The bread and garlic mashed potatoes were phenomenal and the cosmopolitan and strawberry shortcake were just perfect!!!  What a great place to celebrate a special occasion.

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cosmopolitan
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Prime rib and garlic mashed

cp8n-kOz83SDthOsc-vgYw.text: Food is delicious but pricey so COME HUNGRY!!  If you're up for some deja vu and open to experience a movie-like scene from Goodfellas, I'd recommend taking the back parking entrance through the kitchen...it's quite a trip.  Great spot with excellent, fast, friendly service. My company had a client dinner here one night during our conference convention. Recommend for smaller business dinners as the lighting is a bit dark and the restaurant is fairly packed.

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. As lmon with Mango Ginger Glaze

0snlN9KHzAeHaJbphdV33w.text: First time at Durant's celebrating a birthday.  Funny that the entrance is through the kitchen and yet one gets a great welcome from a management person and workers.  Despite being 15 minutes early, we were accommodated in a great semi-circular booth--red of course-- to go along with the red wallpaper and red flocking.  Really old school reminiscent of the saloon decor in westerns.  The bar was packed so there has to be a really good happy hour deal going on.  The place is dim so you better have a small flashlight to read the menu.  We had a bloody mary which was nice and strong just as we like it.  They gave us a small tray with chilled veggies and a dipping sauce. So fresh!  The entrees come with soup or salad and a potato side in various forms (garlic mashed, fried, baked and sweet potato fries).   We chose salads which were mixed greens with tomatoes--Again very fresh.  Instead of dressing we asked for extra virgin olive oil.  We were given very high quality olive oil which made the salads really delicious.      We ordered a ribeye with sweet potatoes and the cajun pork chop.  Unfortunately the ribeye was not rare enough and we sent it back.  They graciously gave us another ribeye which was cooked perfectly.  The sweet potato fries were delicious.  The pork chop was very charred on the outside yet perfectly pink and juicy on the inside.  Beautifully prepared.  I mustn't forget to mention the complementary garlic bread.  A ciabatta round sitting in a dish with oil and lots of garlic.  My husband loved it.  They treated us to a delicious chocolate ganache cake which was amazing candle and all.   Dave was our server and could not have done anything more to make our experience better.  He was an attentive, friendly and respectful server.  We will definitely be asking for Dave when we return to Durant's.

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rib eye
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork chop

jEjDq53XIZ49iXq1rgoXuA.text: Excellent food, top notch service and fun atmosphere! Really enjoyed the drinks and desserts!

pz-wwby-10wG4wHQ94jIUA.text: If you want to wow someone, come here. There's complimentary valet parking on the South side of the building.  There's different places you can sit. Some lit more than others. The atmophere inside is seductive, red interior with elegant finishes. Definitely a great date night spot. They say the best martinis in the valley are here as well.  Unfortunately, I couldn't drink and I just had lunch here since I had to return to work after. I had the BBQ Burger (Smoked Cheddar, Onion Rings, and Bacon) with Sweet Potato fries. I also ordered the Chocolate Indulgence Cake. Both were good.  My server was excellent, kind, and very patient.   The bartender was talking about the stock market with a customer. And the customer at the bar talked about their outrageous purchases, $1,500 - $30,000 priced items. It was interesting. Reminded me of being in the Financial District in NYC. But their steakhouses are not as romantic as Durant's. Definitely bring a date here asap!

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The working phone booth! :) Tried it and it works: $1.00 for long distance calls, 50c for local calls. Located near the bar.
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The 8oz Slow Roasted Prime Beef Rib, $35. We asked for it split for two, and they were happy to accommodate for us.
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The chilled veggies (celery, carrots, and olives), and bread (olive oil, chives, basil, and leek) which comes with dinner.

NhNeJrmJS1tdcxO6XwYH5w.text: There's not a better steak in Phoenix. Never had a bad meal there. Never had bad service. A classic steakhouse with a great ambiance.

qXfB06cx6VOFjvReu8jVrw.text: My hubby & I raved about this restaurant to our friends. We went on my hubby's 70th birthday. What a total disaster. We were seated next to a large table of guys that was a bachelor party. They were so loud, we could not carry on any kind of conversation. People were coming in with shorts, flip-flops & raggedy tshirts. All of our meals came at room temperature. Not even close to warm. Just pitiful. And, we spent $$$$$$. I was so embarrassed that I had recommended the place to our friends. None of us will every go back. They obviously now cater to the drunk clubbing kiddies.

2qgWS55yHpC-5kaStSkPHw.text: This place was recommended by a local...All I said was I want a steak! While a bit of a drive from Scottsdale it was totally with it. Being solo I was looking for bar seating. I found it and since Durant's has been in business since 1950  and still family owned I was excited for the drive and experience.  You enter in the main doors through the kitchen. Found a seat at the bar thankfully. It's dark, dim and red and wood decor but puts you back in the day. Bar was packed found a seat and the bartender was not happy or maybe a bad night.  Ordered the shrimp cocktail was delish....bartender was still not friendly.  Figured it was part of the ambience. Ordered a ribeye and mushrooms they were to die for. It came with a salad and veggies. Got the wedge was told it was a la cart ok....was told it came with 2 sides...ordered broccoli was told that was a la cart ok....it's what I wanted  Steak came it was amazing the mushrooms fabulous! No broccoli and a side of house mashed potatoes. I would have gotten a baked potato if I had ever ordered potatoes.  Food was amazing service not so much but figured it was part of the bar experience.  Steve was nicer at the end but why not giving 5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp cocktail app was yummy!

r5c9EIJuw8jy5OsEEdtmtg.text: $$ but experience---you can't put a price on first class service!!!!! Lorraine anticipated every need, onpoint with extraordinary response to request. Nick was attentive and detail extraordinaire!!! If superlative experience is what you are expecting THIS IS WORLD CLASS EXPERIENCE!!!!!

g_iepuawuIJQsX1Eg4abww.text: Great place, has a very old school vibe. I especially like entering through the kitchen, has that Goodfellas nostalgia. The food is absolutely amazing, the service is great, and the place is immaculate. The drinks are top notch, best Negroni I've ever had. Very soft lighting so it's perfect for a romantic trist. Have some decor when you're here, so leave your selfie sticks at home!

HORe1Gaf214OwoTuMf7t6g.text: The food was very good! We got the smaller filet mignon with mashed potatoes and the shrimp scampi. Everything was prepared very well.  Our server wasn't very attentive after he found out we weren't ordering drinks. He didn't come by our table much and pretty much ignored us when we asked to turn the air conditioning down. It was very chilly in there!  I like how you enter through the kitchen. The ambiance of the place is nice too.  We would return but only for a nice occasion. It was a bit pricey!

4df0t6EJ4VHLtVvZMcP9mg.text: In biblical times, they used to sacrifice animals to God.  One thing.  They only seemed to sacrifice baby lambs and goats, never beef. For some reason beef was off limits, although I'm not sure why but I do have a theory.  I think it's because God never had one of Durant's boneless ribeyes cooked Pittsburgh style with a side of atomic horseradish, pre-dinner crudites served with roquefort dressing, and a nice garden salad with a baked potato. Had he done so, I'm pretty sure Catholics would have never had that silly rule about not eating meat on Fridays.   I'm guessing someone back in the day, probably Abraham, did sacrifice a cow to God at one point, but because Abraham was Jewish and didn't know how to make anything other than reservations, he grilled and served up one bad cut of beef to God. The result? God punishes Catholics and Hindus. Go figure.   Durant's won't punish you. Not like Abraham anyway.

gmvz4zZanAA-yN_8rlcqiw.text: Went there for the first time for restaurant week even though I'm a Phoenix native. I was so glad we went. Not only was the service great, but so was the food. There were small and large parties there. Our server was was very helpful. A must see!!

pt_ymg-2IR3OSOW8NFc8sg.text: A very good and expensive lunch is available at this restaurant.  Our server was attentive but gave us plenty of time to make decisions. The cocktails were good and not overpriced. I felt the wines by the glass were a bargain.  I had a $21.95 cobb salad and it was big and good: I couldn't finish it.  I tasted others' dessert but had none for myself. My wife loved her shrimp cocktail and had a ham and brie with apple sandwich which was not too big. The brownie pie completed her meal. Friends had crab cakes as a meal and his spouse had pulled pork sandwich special plus shrimp cocktail.  Somehow our Pre-tip lunch cost $65 per person but we felt it was worth it.

Cb3gef24ARhyRK-826Rj3Q.text: If you're looking for a classy Goodfellas vibe this is the spot!  I loved the food here.  It's hidden on Central but once you find it enter from the back.  Quality of food is great!  I had a chicken and it was tender so no complaints here.  We were always checked on and drinks were filled.  Be cautious it's not the cheapest but-  if you feel like splurging on great food check this place out...

Ql77ZC8E56l-OeDJaJz4Mw.text: It was my birthday recently and my wife and I wanted to head out for some good old fashioned steakhouse meat! Meat served in what seems to be a set straight out of Madmen.  It is the quintessential steakhouse: windowless, velvety, leathery, a little musty, a bit smokey, a touch corny, and everything I ever want in a House of Meat.  Dinner began with delectable cocktails: for madame a Kir Royale, for monsieur a HUGE Manhattan. Lovely. We shared a 1/2 dozen oysters on the half shell with tangy house-made cocktail sauce. On to satisfying yet run-of-the-mill Caesar salads. Nothing new here, just chopped romaine, perfect dressing grated parm and anchovies. I prefer a whole-leaf experience with crispy capers and shaved cheese. But all around a good salad. She had a gorgeous 8oz fillet done perfectly med-rare. She got garlic mashed potatoes. I had a 14oz T-Bone that was also grilled med-rare to perfection. I also like them bloody: as in "If we got it to a vet it might have a chance!" But this day was a brown and pink day and what a joy it was. I had a baked potato that was  peeled and wonderfully crispy on the outside. We shared sauteed broccolini. Both steaks melted in the mouth and were delicately and perfectly seasoned. I cleaned the T-bone fully, disregarding cutlery at the end to mad-dog it into submitting all parts flesh. This feast was paired with a nice bottle of mid-priced red. The restaurant brought us a complimentary slice of cake as it was the 21st anniversary of my 21st birthday. I don't eat dessert, but my wife enjoyed a few bites. I don't actually recall what it was. I think it was kind of golden in color.  This is the type of place one chooses for special occasions or important business dealings. I wouldn't say date place as it's quite busy and a little brightly lit. Though for date night with a spouse who also loves kitschy steakhouses it's perfect! It was pricey. It was worth it. I lived 2 blocks from this place for a year and gazed longingly at the pink edifice in which it is housed every time I drove by, wondering what delights lay within. Now I know, and so should you. Durants, we shall do the meat dance with you again some day...thank you.

1dW-lO12b-Edoq5q5KjMjw.text: Classic Goodfellas type restaurant.  Gail the bartender of 10 years makes one of the best Grey Goose dirty martinis with blue cheese stuffed olives.  Chris our waiter was charming and professional.  You wait to for seating and then you really wait for your food.  Prices are a bit excessive for the showing but you can check the box on your bucket list,

G_gMFbgtKUjF0jIDeo9Oog.text: Heard about this interesting steak house from Lindsay, my Yelping 'go to' and I am grateful. What a fun night, feeling "Mad Men' ish as we walked through the kitchen when entering the restuarant.   Atmosphere was amazing and the food.... WOW. My fav had to be the amazing steak and bean chili/soup.... fantastic.  Steaks were our of this world and the mushrooms... devine.  When entering the restaurant we greeted by helpful eager staff ... with each one adding input into our experience.... especially Patti, our server. She was helpful, informative, fun and sealed the deal of a fantastic night. Thanks

aTcYC91Pv02y0tqhDjXe3g.text: Yes it is expensive. Period.   However, the food is on point. All my meals; appetizers, wine,  salad, soup, steak was more than solid. The only reason I give them 4 stars is because you enter through the kitchen when you valet. Nothing really bad, just that it could be adjusted to route customers another direction.   I will be going back over and over and over...

7vDkQhTb7OGZhUCdA-TaUw.text: I would say this is a definite four star!  Had dinner for New Years was delicious but very pricey.  Would I go back?  I think so.  Atmosphere was old time class like.

LJawDAxj09mTFjhMwh4i_g.text: A True Phoenix tradition. Love it and the martinis are awesome.

QAtsiFj0uBbDDPCgQ2gM4w.text: I agree with previous reviews on the fun of entering through the kitchen with the humble, free valet parking and the rich, inviting old school interior. I got the 16 oz prime rib based on popular support, and thought it was pretty good - flavorful on the outside but not especially tender. I'd highly recommend the accompanying mushrooms.  French onion soup was ok. I think the sweet potatoe fries were the same the I buy from the frozen foods section. Limited beer selection and the waiter seemed impatient with the somewhat limited dinner tab we rang up.

7vwpbckLbfPJP_BpdsLfXQ.text: Took my mom here for a special dinner recently and she and I were both pleased! My 75-year-old mom was visiting from out-of-state and got a kick out of entering through the rear kitchen. I also thought it was nice to see the kitchen and say hi to the the kitchen staff this way. We were both pleased with the service we got with our meals that included a couple glasses of dry white wine, filet mignon and a large rib-eye. The total came to a bit over $100, but the portions were generous and to see my mom enjoy her dinner experience this much was totally worth it! The only reason I'm not giving them 5 stars is because some of the tipsy and loud folks spilled out from the front bar to the dining area and detracted from our dining experience somewhat. Their gorgeous bar area nicely accommodates drinking revelry for those interested in that.

RgbaKxXyTbZdHNK7PrkBWQ.text: We had a chance to go there during the restaurant week. I love the atmosphere. It look so cool with all seat and tables, and the staff are also part of good experience. They are so professional. The food are so delicious and tasty. However they are a bit too salty for me. With the experience, it was good.

MkWSNydjx4MMN71hP-6sjw.text: Ok, now that you are reading based on the one star.... Went for a dinner for four on a Saturday night, and... The female bartender who is always there has no personality and is about as customer service oriented as an old shoe. Our waiter: took the males dinner order before the females, served salad and had to be asked what happened to our appetizer, and he clearly forgot.  The story goes on with forgot drink orders, and the delivery of desert to those of us having the prix fix menu, and the rest had to ask for a menu, and again he was surprised.  So he said "dessert    Is on me".  You guessed it, desserts were charge on the bill, as was a salad price doubled .  This was the second try with the same results in 2011.  So YES it is a land mark, and YES it is red walls and old school cool, but.... Food is OK, and service keeps disappointing ..... For the price, I will go elsewhere.

7XiPGZOfetrbrtXPd-bp_g.text: Very accommodating!  My girlfriends and I (about 8 of us) visited Durants on a whim but hadn't made reservations. The first hostess turned us away  pretty quickly. As we were standing there verbally pondering next steps, another host told us he could seat us in 25 minutes but we were seated in less than 15.   We each ordered different plates and sampled from each other's. I had the prime rib rare with baked potato. Later, after agreeing we were too full for desserts, a waiter went by with chocolate cake and cheesecake. Needless to say, we ordered one of each, and were not disappointed!  The food was wonderful!  Yeah, you're gonna pay high dollar, but the ambiance, the attentive wait staff, the food is worth it.

IE0Rg8h54QkygfOyscAHDQ.text: What you'd expect of an old steakhouse - decent food with typical starches to go with your large serving of protein, predominant taste is salt, crowded and noisy dining area, good service. A dining experience with absolutely no surprises.

5vTEAFR44CYCBoGEctde4w.text: Bottom line, you are not a Phoenician if you haven't eaten at Durant's. Perfect cut, perfect pairing. Prefect valet Chris! Lovely Serafina!

HE_b6l2_vm8ALLuJC-6AOQ.text: This place is so amazing that I cannot believe it only has four stars. I have taken extremely important clients here, had two anniversary dinners here, and just recently had my engagement dinner at this restaurant.
