The gravy helped with that, but there wasn't quite enough of it.  The vegetables served with the Pot Roast were very good.  I opted for the selected wine pairing: a very nice Pinot Noir, which i enjoyed  great deal.  The crab macaroni and cheese?  Marvelous!  I almost wish I'd chosen that for my main course (although it hadn't been an option).  Too bad I only had room for a couple of small bites of it!  At last, my dessert arrived - a chocolate espresso mousse with whipped cream on top.  It was thick, but still light, and only the tiniest bit too sweet - I usually like my chocolate dark.  I shared it with whoever wanted some, but we were all far too full to have more than a couple of bites, and the dessert went sadly unfinished.  Would I come back again?  If I ever find myself in Phoenix with a pocketful of money just itching to be spent, yes, I believe I would.

5zAkcrOc_uoVfT7ykNjuWw.text: So when five out five people in your group all walk down to the lobby of the hotel and each coincidentally say that they want to try Durant's AND the concierge recommends it - it's a no-brainer. Plus, it was only two blocks away from the hotel we were staying at (Hilton Suites) and we could just walk there.  When you walk into this place, you immediately go back in time to 1960... and you almost almost want to walk up to the bar, order up a dirty martini and turn to the guy next to you so you can plan a hit on your latest rival... So basically, it's dimly lit, the bartender and waiters are dressed in snazzy maroon vests and bow ties and the bartender talks to you like he's known you for years and makes smart ass remarks about the drinks you order.  The menu is fabulous!! Steak and seafood - heaven. I was conflicted with so much emotion! Crab claws? Oysters? Prime rib? Rib eye? I wanted everything! I ended up ordering shrimp bisque and prime rib w/ mashed potatoes. They brought out some fresh baked bread that had a nice artichoke olive oil dressing on it - rave reviews from everyone at the table! The shrimp bisque was magnificent. I am a HUGE fan of bisques and I was not disappointed. My only resignation was the prime rib. I made a mistake in ordering it medium-well and it was not fantastic. I love prime rib and I usually ordered it medium-rare, but went for a more well. Next time I'll get it medium.  All in all, I was pleased AND I have this really neat token that guarantees me free desserts FOR LIFE. Too bad I don't live in Phoenix.

7nMB9zqj3J0o4GBPs4qOSw.text: I can never get enough of Durant's  . Maybe it's because of the fifties vibe that make me envision men in dark suits and old ladies with fur stoles.  Maybe it's the walking into the kitchen with no apologies or awkardness just a big hello and on with the show. I love the traditional food of the place, my succulent shrimp cocktail , oysters  with hottest horseradish know to man , thick meaty prime rib and a lovely lemon drop cocktail that  begs me to keep sipping away.  The place just symbolizes a different style and era of dining and I love it. If  they get rid of that red velvet flocked wallpaper I will seriously cry .

u8PkK2uadYe8QthoXAdFfQ.text: Absolutely amazing! We had a great time as the food, drinks and service were perfect. We never had to wait for refills, the waiter was very attentive and he made us feel like we were the only customers in the entire restaurant.

J8rfTdEJ46CCPMJVfM22tA.text: 3 words- lemon drop martinis!  I had 2 of these yummy drinks & I could have had more.  I grew up on chicken liver & theirs just reminded me of my childhood. We also had the calamari which was delicious and came in a generous portion. Oh, and that dinner roll- if you like garlic, you will love these.  The atmosphere was very nostalgic- you enter and exit through the kitchen- kind of like Goodfellas.  This adds to the uniqueness of the restaurant.

xBxO5_xphB3v-_1kHo6GLQ.text: We have been to Durant's a few times, only to the bar. I love the decor and the old-school feel to the place. Yes, walking through the kitchen may seem strange, but that is one of the things that makes it unique. There are so many chain bars in this town, it is nice to have something that has a bit of character.  I found the drinks to be a bit expensive, although they fill them literally to the top and they spill all over, so it's more like two drinks. Service is mainly good, depending on who your bartender is. Overall, I think this is a great place to have cocktails. I have not eaten the food as I am vegan, so that pretty much cuts out everything on the menu.  The one complaint I have is they need to bring back the music. They used to play Frank Sinatra and Dean Martin on the stereo, but no more. Good music makes the mood, so PLEASE bring it back.

g_hVKoWIdOV-qfFIsarJ7Q.text: Not what I expected from all the rave reviews.   The positives =)    Our server was very friendly and attentive (he also brought out a chocolate dessert as we were celebrating my husband's birthday). I enjoyed the bread and the veggies with ranch as well as our bottle of wine.   The not so positives =/  The food is way overpriced.  Donovan's is better, tastier and cheaper in my opinion. Or if you can get to Florida, Berns is what's up!  I thought it was odd to be sat in the bar area with reservations.  Parking is not clear. Signs say valet yet no one was out there. I had to ask a guy taking out the trash if I could park wherever I liked.    Walking in and exiting through the kitchen ... what is up with that?  I felt lost and as if I came in the wrong way. At least have someone there greeting you or something to let you know you came in the correct way. It was a bit awkward to me.

R7F5bfxfRLfagJhXxvYGgg.text: Good service and friendly staff. Authentic indoor setting. Good steak and drinks. Particularly the Delmonico steak.

H-dnpkgQEY4uT52cicv0Fg.text: My husband and I had the pleasure of dining at Durant's again for our annual Christmas Eve dinner.  FANTASTIC!  Ron was our server (so polite) and did a great job!  We started with shrimp cocktail $15.95.  It was the best I've ever had (my husband agreed).  Salads were excellent.  Two filet mignon steaks later; $89.00 but were they ever worth it!  Our steaks were cooked to perfection and melted in our mouths.  Sauteed Mushrooms $10.50 were so good as well and lots of them.  One bottle of wine and our total bill was $140.00.  This is only our 2nd time at Durant's.  I'm going back again next Christmas Eve for sure.  Hands down, we had one of the best meals ever!    PS - I love going in thru the kitchen.  Durants . . . BEST OF PHOENIX and it's in my neighborhood.  Thanks Durant's you are really something to remember.

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Christmas Eve dinner 2012
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bread with leeks (so good)
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. House salad

6dl9qNmu1fV9fzEq3DtgAA.text: If there was a way to give more than just the five stars Durant's would definitely get as many stars as possible. I made reservations here for my girlfriend's surprise 40th birthday dinner and I can't say enough great things about the place. Everyone there were more than willing to help me setup the dinner and to ensure the surprise went off without a hitch. Kent was especially helpful from setting up the reservation, making sure we pulled off he surprise and in making sure we all had a great night. Along with the service the food was amazing as well! It is nice to find a great steak place. Durant's is definitely at the top of my list for a great steak in Phoenix. We will definitely be back!

abULLQgdxYcUaSYmh5eJjA.text: This is a Phoenix institution. The decor/ambiance takes me back a few decades but with unapologetic class. There is no better standard fare (steaks/seafood) in town. Come after work and you are liable to rub elbows with a power broker or two.

jo8ujWoenElCnKAd0djqQQ.text: This is a customer service review only. We were in town for a convention. We attempted to call (phone was not being answered) to make a reservation and we attempted to make one on Open Table and we were not able to book one. Our out of country guests wanted to eat early so we took a chance and went by. Upon arrival we were told that they were completely booked. It was a Wednesday and there were empty tables but I get it, I'm sure they were reserved. Being turned away is not a big deal. What was disappointing was that when my husband walked back in to request change to tip the valet, he was met with a dirty look and pursed lips by the hostess. This kind of restaurant is right up our alley and we visit Phoenix often so I would like to give it a second chance even though it is never appropriate to greet a guest with a dirty look. However I will say that the kitchen staff was very friendly and apologized that we could not be seated.

0vgaRspX1unXkFrNoJgtgg.text: My husband were in town for our anniversary and were given this restaurant as a recommendation.  The atmosphere is great.  Service, disappointing.  Our server was an older gentleman who was more concerned with discussing his time spent in Key West with the table behind us than taking care of us.  We were never offered a second glass of wine, sat for over 10 minutes after finishing our food for him to check on us and was quickly given the dessert menu and a check. The food was ok.  Very disappointed.

NSuwHnidG5Eps3xJTAbIfA.text: Amazing food, amazing service. Absolutely loved the salmon there. If it wasn't so far from me I'd be there everyday.

a_njE0TxEpuEIkOfnDHS9g.text: THE place to be and be seen in downtown Phoenix during weekdays for lunch. The portions are very large and the food is fantastic! Durant's is a part of Phoenix history. A unique dining experience. No windows, leather booths, great steaks.

eoF4ZFyvifIXyaBXWRX1qA.text: Nice place and great service however I order the patty melt and the bread was not crisp; in fact it was very soggy.  I had to picked the bread away from the grilled onions and meat with my fork just to be able to eat it. I had placed the wet bread on a side dish and mentioned it to the waiter. Sadly he ignored it and just took the plate away without a word. Very disappointing, I will never go back there and would not recommend it, they don't seem to care if you have a problem but my tea was filled to the top several times. Too bad they don't carry that attention to the rest of the meal.

sfKlAoDPO5dVddNIfRWTOA.text: Durant's is an institution and now that we live just 4 blocks away, the wife and I have been getting our prime rib fix from here far more often than we should.  Durant's knows how to steak. The meal begins with a lovely vegetable crudite on ice and their famous butter garlic leek bread, served by professionals who are friendly and on top of their game, and a support staff that ensures you never see the bottom of your glass.   Not content to simply deliver a solitary piece of meat on the plate like some ultra-high-end chop houses, their steaks include a salad and choice of potato, which is greatly appreciated.  We always upgrade to their Caesar salad, which borders on perfection: the dressing coats everything lightly, the plate is freezing cold as damn well it should be, and the lettuce is extremely fresh and crisp.  If you want to splurge, their shrimp cocktail, while a bit pricey, features four enormous, two-bite-each jumbo shrimp, with a stir-it-yourself-thank-god cocktail sauce with some of the hottest horseradish known to man. The details matter: the lemon they provide has a sheath to ensure that the juice goes on your shrimp and not your date.  The main event is fantastic, though I must admit I've simply never ordered anything other than the prime rib, rare, with a baked potato. It's seasoned beautifully, extremely flavorful, and always served to perfection. The baked potato is good, though I prefer when they're coated in just a bit more salt on the outside. My wife tried their garlic mashed our last time, though, and I think I may have to switch from here on out--they were that good.  Dessert, if your heart allows for it, is also typically great. The strawberry shortcake for two is actually for four, and, pro tip, you can order a half portion and still have enough for three people easily. Our last visit was for my birthday and they brought out their brownie sandwich, which was extremely tasty and appreciated.  We've always had great service, the decor is True to its roots, and if you haven't been during the holidays, Durant's does it UP at Christmas. Do yourself a favor and walk through the kitchen, and thank them for what you're about to partake.

VlrnQi6ZxxtVskd197qtEQ.text: I have been going here since childhood....50+ yrs. I still love everything about it. It has that old world charm I really love. Great food and service is 100% the best. Our Anniversary is coming up soon and I cannot wait to go again. I see a few posts about price...this place is  icon Phoenix. No price can be put on that! Every corner, every table and every place in the bar I look at and see the faces of grandparents, parents, other relatives and many friends that are no longer a part of our celebrations. It's wonderfully nostalgic! #myfav

XI6BbJTfP0_SSkP3DVoGUw.text: The bone in Rib-eye was fantastic and worth every dollar. The ambience makes you feel like you're in a 1950's mobster movie. The appetizers are a bit over priced and we were double charged for our wine which are the only things holding this review back from 5 stars. We will be back in the future.

u05Zyr7yryX0k-DFNDcpFA.text: Not much can be said that has not already been said...however..the bartenders are some of the best in the business...don't miss the chance to have the shrimp..and miss the temptation to have a second martini =)

53aD_7EW8mkyDCIUlAoVxQ.text: Went to Durant's three times and every time is better than the next. The prime rib is spectacular. The best steakhouse in Phoenix. Wonderful filet mignon! And the shrimp cocktail makes my taste buds dance

W91N_uxkW8uysSf9E88KTQ.text: The atmosphere of this place is old mobster & very cozy inside. The food is so good every time I come here. Their jumbo shrimp is so delicious. The bread they serve you in the beginning is soaked in olive oil & a seasoning & is so amazing. This time I got their chicken ricotta & very delicious. The sauce was a little on the heavy side but still delicious. The crab mac & cheese is very good. The steak is always amazing & very great service and food comes out pretty quickly. Bathrooms are very tiny but cute. It's always a treat coming here.

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Side salad, bread
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken ricotta, NY strip, crab mac and cheese

ZB-tEVPDSulf1R2Mx7fpHw.text: Durant's delmonico so tasty and juicy and They recommend me the 2012 Barone fini pinot grigio from Italy Great combination

-z2JV-tRxPyczwPdnai-VQ.text: Great food, great service.. Durant's is a very nostalgic experience.. classic mafia style steak house with dark ambiance.

af-c1Af05_VPkqSqZPDEcA.text: What a throw back. The entire place is covered in red. The carpet, the walls, all red. It is hard to get a booth since most of them are reserved.  I had the NY Strip. It was cooked perfectly and had a lot of flavor. I also had the calamari. It was nice as well.  The service was a bit slow and the prices are a bit high so I gave it 4 stars. If the food was a little less and the service was wicker it would have been a 5 star for sure.

PB-3er1NcU9DYenSArQH4A.text: I love this place. Old school...think Sinatra....steakhouse. Love everything: location (central), decor (old style), service, and of course the food. Quality and nostalgia your thing? Go here.

K64IzzDB_zKlzFURv-prvQ.text: Durant's is a throwback to early Phoenix - which is great if you like the time travel element. The food is great, though a bit expensive.   Regarding the last review, they're right - stay away from the seafood. If you want lobster, go to the Salt Cellar in Scottsdale. For Steak and martinis and seeing the way things used to be out here, Durant's is a LOT of fun.

I7Ehje9ZOnEt6lkjYRmgHw.text: Second best D steakhouse in town.  Donovans is definitely better.  Three Kilt Lifters into dinner we decided on wine.  Our waiter drops the opener on the floor and still uses it to open the bottle.  I'm like WTF as is our table.  Steak was okay, probably a little more medium than medium rare as I asked.  Oban 14 was a nice finisher to the evening but blah all around.

y9JZeg9SRRGMvwK3q53UJQ.text: Unfortunately, my birthday always falls right around Mother's Day.  Which means that every time I want to go out to eat for my birthday it is packed.  We thought we'd celebrate early by going on Saturday, but it was still packed.  We called ahead and the earliest reservation was 9 PM, but the person on the phone said that if we just came down, they would fit us in.  So we sat at the bar for maybe 20 minutes (IN YOUR FACE CHAIN RESTAURANTS!!!) and our beers came with a small appetizer of cheese and salami.  These people think of everything. And the wait staff is pretty damn attentive.  The hostess heard me say something about my birthday, which was passed on to the waitress so my super huge and yummy meal ended with a delicious dessert of my choosing.    The bread and relish tray would have been more than enough of an appetizer for me, but my partners in crime also wanted the spinach artichoke dip, which was soooo tasty.  My steak was SOFT but cooked exactly how I like it.  These are True professionals.  Asparagus was cooked perfectly.  The chicken pot pie soup was exactly what I expected and so yummy.  And the dessert?  Triple creme brulee - kahlua which tasted like a caucasian, chocolate which managed to be super chocolately but not too rich, and a mixed berry that would have been fabulous if I was a normal rasberry eating human.  Yes, it's a little pricey, but you easily get 2 meals if not more out of one dish.  Especially with the yummy bread and relish tray that is also presented before the meal.  The atmosphere is cozy and a little crowded.  If you are wierd about personal space, this is probably not the place to go.  Overall: I love this place and go every time I get the opportunity.

L6SkQ74I_QsUfqaVnfi_mA.text: My favorite restaurant in Phoenix. The old ratpack style atmosphere and gathering of local business leaders along with politicos just adds to the fun. Unlike most of the new steakhouses along the Camelback/Biltmore corridor, Durant's is not pretentious. In fact, I've even walked in after golfing while still wearing shorts and a windshirt and received great service. While not inexpensive, you also won't pay an arm and a leg for a steak at Durant's like some of the newer places. Don't want dinner or by yourself, hang out at the bar and have a martini - they know how to make 'em!

mwTRz9kytpyTqJzpR1Kv9w.text: Durant's reminds me of good lovin'.   Not your everyday, ho-hum go thru the motions experience.  I mean the good stuff:  smooth talking, old fashioned seduction followed by moaning, sweat, and fireworks.  Then perhaps a cigarette.  Dig.

__G9EH-N9u_2NOXf0Ugu-Q.text: We were downtown and looking for an uncommon dining experience, and on the car ride we were taking about crab, beef, wedge salads so Durant's seemed like a natural and obvious choice. My friend had never been, and its probably been five years since my last visit. It was destiny.  As I pulled into the packed parking lot (at 5:54 p.m.) on a Saturday night, the lot was filled and I giggled. Durant's has that natural 'it' factor that is such a nice pull and draw. I looked at my friend and said "Uh, we're probably eating in the bar, this parking lot is filled and all these folks are inside that little restaurant." I was right.  So, I led her through the door that naturally guides you through the kitchen and then the dining room before you visit the dining room captain. Its a great part of the experience. The pristine kitchen full of hustle and bustle, and kitchen employees that speak perfectly good English and greet you upon entering and leaving the restaurant. I love this aspect of the restaurant; it feels really good to me. It smells of dripping hospitality to me and not in a syrupy way, but more of a "yeah, we're proud of what we do, and we've done it longer than any other Mastro's-style-hip-newster in town, and we're still kick ass!"   So, anyway, I speak briefly to the dining room captain, did I mention that they wear tuxedos in the dining room. Ah! Love it! So old school and its just fine with me. I look at the reservation system that he has on his desk and I laugh, because, our visit isn't planned and he has names collected and color-coded all over the screen. We're having a spontaneous dinner, I don't think spontaneity and a full service-dining-room-table-type-of-meal-at-Durant's goes hand in hand. So, I ask if we could have the full menu in the bar and they're thrilled. "Sure, ladies, come on in!"  We belly up to the bar (which I love anyway), and I "sample" two different sips of wine before I settle on the wine I want with dinner and my friend has a Martini that is classically perfect while we wait for our dinner to arrive. Our bartender was incredibly busy, but remained proficient, aware, thorough and we loved her! For me this was the classic Chicago-Gibson's-style steak dinner event that we were hoping to find. We weren't disappointed.  The bill came. I thought my friend was going to fall out of her chair - its not cheap and on the way home, we had a conversation about value. She'd give them maybe 3.5 stars on value orientation. I'm not wavering from my five stars and here's why:   I don't eat like this everyday and I have enough left over steak to feed my steak and eggs this morning, my lunch and dinner for the day, and probably tomorrow as well. It was a huge, juicy, piece of cow and it was perfectly prepared and yeah, I won't need to spend $62/person for another several years.   We departed through the kitchen and this time my friend stops and blows the entire kitchen staff a kiss goodbye and I am pretty sure they fell over themselves admiring her, well, naturally, God-given beauty and two of them rushed to open the back door for her. That was the kicker, she'll pay for this type of attention again.   Classic...

okv6JNgBuHJKdxHgaete3Q.text: Yep, it's a good one! FOOD not fuel! Worth a stop, great beef quality.

gicfYeU3I-CDsGxlbUqItg.text: I really think that 2 stars is a fairly generous rating for this restaurant given my recent experience here.  Buy I will give points for the history and the ambiance, both of which I am very fond of.  The food, service and prices, however, were well off-base.  I took a group of out-of-town business associates here during a conference at the Phoenix Convention Center.  I wanted to take them somewhere that is "uniquely Phoenix", and I felt that Durant's fit that description.  I have eaten here before, and i thought it was OK, but many of my same complaints were consistent on this visit.  First, I hate restaurants where the bar makes you close the tab with them before you head to your table.  Any quality establishment should put the diner's convenience before the bartenders tip and allow you to transfer your bar tab to your table bill.  On a business function, this makes accounting very sticky, and is awkward when you have to stop, ask for the bar bill, run your card, sign it, then proceed to your table.  I know that bartenders do it to maximize their tips (I used to be one), but it is bush league, and should have no place in a restaurant like Durants.  Our waiter was flat out terrible.  This little weasel obviously did not want to be there and let the world know it.  Not only was his attitude poor, but his timing was awful.  We sat for almost 3 hours, most of the time waiting for him to take orders or bring food.  We never saw the guy.  Our drinks were rarely if ever full, but he was sure to try and up-sell more bottles of wine when the time came.  When you are paying that kind of money to eat in a place like Durants, the server had better be representative of the price.  He was not.  Durant's has a very, very strange pricing scheme.  some things are priced well, other things are absolutely obnoxious.  Specifically the appetizers are way out of line.  Apps were in the $15+ range which is flat out absurd.  I dont mind paying for food, but I do expect value, and you will NOT find it at Durants.  I ordered a stuffed potato with my steak instead of the standard baker and it was a $5 upgrade.  That is ridiculous.  The food was pretty good - the oysters Rockefeller were outstanding and were clearly the best part of the dinner.  My steak, a $51 bone in ribeye, was on the poor side of average and worth about $11.  Very tough and fibrous, I was not impressed.  It was tasty, but I have had far, far better elsewhere on many occasions.  Again, it was the value that annoyed me about this place.  Avoid the crab macaroni and cheese at all costs.  Horrible.  Barely edible, no flavor, the large rigatoni's didnt really go with the white cheese cream sauce and chunks of crab.  Pretty bad.  I will say that the wine was very WELL priced, and we appreciated that.  Once again, the inconsistency in pricing was perplexing.  The thing that really, really blew it for me though was the 48oz Porterhouse challenge.  The thing is like $85 and "if you can eat it all" your name goes on the wall.  We bet one of my colleagues that he could not finish it, and each guy threw in $20 as a prize.  The steak arrived and it was about 35oz of bone and about 12oz of meat.  My mother could have finished that steak and ordered desert.  This is one of the biggest marketing scams that I have ever seen in a restaurant.  The whole "challenge" concept is obviously designed to get you to order an $85 steak.  My ribeye had more meat on it and was probably harder to eat.  We should have known what to expect when we asked the waiter how many people finish it, and he said "about 5 people order it each day, and about 3 out of 5 finish it."  Pathetic.  So if you are going out for a drink in Phoenix, head to Durants and have a martini at the bar.  Order the oysters Rockefeller while you are there.  These aspects of the restaurant are really, really great.  Then finish your drink and head to another steakhouse for a great steak that will not disappoint you like Durant's.

0MR816N2iYYhpy1bi9-pDg.text: Went looking for a nice spot for dinner on our one night in Phoenix. Yelp came through. We made our reservations through Open Table. Even made a special request for a semi-circle booth (thanks to one of the Yelp reviews!).  Our reservation was for 8 pm on a Friday night. We were actually sitting in our semi-circle booth at 8:30- granted, had we not specified where we wanted to sit, I'm quite certain it wouldn't have taken so long.  Nevertheless, we got a chance to look at the restaurant decor and watch the staff in action.  Seems like this place gets a lot of longstanding customers and a lot of new people. An interesting mix- there was a guy wearing a bright yellow hawaiian shirt, brown suspenders and high water velvet tuxedo pants with sandals!  Then there's the date crowd, the middle-aged party animals, and random sprinklings of other like us.   I had the New York steak- medium with the baked potato and clam chowder for my appetizer (which came WITH the meal thank-you-very-much). The hubby had the Delmonico- medium rare with garlick mashed potatoes and clam chowda. We came to a consensus that my steak was seasoned far better than his...possibly his didn't have time to cook/marinate in its own juices since it was so rare? Who knows. We walked away satisfied for under a hundred bucks.  Side note- we came with a bottle of wine we were hoping to have...and quickly found out that since the restaurant has such an extensive collection of wines (over 450), they do not allow corkage. Back to the car we went!  Additionally, valet parking is complimentary and there really was no dress code. We came business casual....but found people in there in tank tops and jeans.

9KOk56y33t0fFYjsTmvCMQ.text: We went to Durants for our anniversary.  The service was amazing, the food was incredible.  We shared a steak that was out of this world. Then to top it off they brought us some sort of strawberry desert of which I'm still having flashbacks.  Had gone to Durants many times for drinks.....this was my first dinner here and it was awesome!

4AKxM9DQ68FIhF7co3yb-g.text: OK, let's face it: there are better steaks in the Valley. As a matter of fact, if you just took the steak at face value, it might not even crack the top 5.   But Durant's is not just about the steak, or even the food.   Durant's is a classic in every sense of the word, the type of place that can rarely be found anywhwere in Phoenix. It's also a lively and classy night spot, something that didn't exist anywhere in downtown Phoenix for years, and as several new places have developed around Durant's overe the past few years, it has remained consistent and cool.   And that's what Durnat's is really about. Yeah, the steak is pretty good. The seafood's alright. The bread with the hot garlic butter is awesome. But Durant's is just COOL. It's classic Vegas, Rat Pack-style cool, and you feel it from the moment you walk in.

p4DlXWuH5m38JSVIXh04_Q.text: Our favorite steakhouse and that is saying a lot, given the number of outstanding steak places in Phoenix..  Old school decor, totally knowledgeable wait staff, steak the way you want it, awesome crab cakes, super size martinis.  IMO there is no better dining experience! Back again for a special occasion......incredible prime rib, the best wait staff in Phoenix.....hands down, the number one steakhouse.

MEgsBlvqlAEKVTNbR5v_8A.text: This place is a special piece of living Phoenix history. Always make room for the creme brulee trio. Great service. Excellent martini.

j2L8z_Df74wOg-QJEgXpIw.text: Nothing like a good ole fashioned steakhouse.  Durant's is one of the restaurants that Phoenix truly tends to miss alot because of our young age as a city, and the amount of turn around in restaurants in the downtown corridor.  Many of the restaurants have gone out of business, so there are very few that aren't new and hip.  There is just something to say about a restaurant that has been doing it right for decades.  I went back this past weekend and really enjoyed my time at Durant's.  We started off with an order of Oysters Rockefeller and their wonderful bread covered in better and garlic and deliciousness.  The oysters were absolutely perfect.  Next up was the house salad with blue cheese, nothing special here, but it was done to perfection in a classic house salad manner.  For the main course, I went with prime rib, which is always perfect.  I went with the baked potato this time over the garlic mashed (both are great).  We have made this an annual tradition before a friends 50/60s Hollywood Christmas Party, and the atmosphere fits our attire absolutely perfectly.  I can't wait to come back.

-pO0hsi0xlF4FwqLGJUizg.text: I have been to Durant's a few times and Durant's never fails to impress.  The cocktails I ordered on my last visit were out of this world.  I ordered a Manhattan to start.  It kicked my ass.  The bartenders at Durant's can make the classic cocktails that is for certain.  For "dessert" I ordered a Grasshopper.  My bartender asked me if I wanted it made with ice cream.  WHAT WHAT!!?? Ice cream, that through me for a loop.  I had no idea bartender goddess.   I said no to the ice cream and yes to half and half.  My Grasshopper was awesome with the half and half.  Next time with ice cream baby.  People at the bar liked the looks of my drinks and asked for their own.  I felt like little miss trend setter.  If you go to drink at Durant's, do some research on vintage cocktails and most likely the bartenders there will make it perfectly.  It's fun to try the drinks of old men. Wink ; )  On that same visit I ordered the Kobe Beef Burger and mashed potatoes.  The bun was crisp and flaky.  The veggies were firm and fresh.  The burger was juicy and primally good.  Meat GOOD!!!  Durant's has been around for a long time.  It is the place for a power lunch or a sophisticated dinner.  The only thing better about the food at Durant's is the superb service.  I think the staff are telepathic and they communicate our needs to each other.  Even the valet guy had our car ready as my guest and I walked out the kitchen exit.  Have some fun with the bartenders.  Do some research.

WsYCFRwnbpr-yOhHEMJKxg.text: The greatest oysters Rockefeller made by Mikey in the kitchen and ask for crispy bacon on them, delicious. Mikey is in the kitchen until 3 so go for lunch.

TOan-nJmJaj3h3XdOrjp2Q.text: Tradition at it's most... er.... um.... traditional. Every time i eat here i feel like i have been transported to any number of old family owned steakhouses on the North Shore of Long Island, or Brooklyn. The plush red velvet, the dark wood and button tufted leather... The place just screams STUFFY BUSINESS LUNCH. My first experience here was with a bunch of lawyer friends who were dying for meatloaf or a steak with creamed spinach...   The entrance is through the kitchen. That may seem a little odd, but I'd bet it sells dinners. Who can resist the wonderful aroma. By the time you reach your table, you crave rare beef, as red as the decor.   It's the kind of place where you forgo the trendy drinks and have a Scotch with a splash,or a Rob Roy before dinner. The steaks are perfectly prepared, the garlic mashed potatoes are wonderful. I love the place. It isn't cheap, and admittedly, i have never paid for my own meal there. It has always been a treat from some friend who wears a suit to work, or some more traditional back easterner who wants to share their bit of meat and potato lovers heaven.

U7e0WOOTpb1tIpqfIdXN9A.text: This classic steakhouse has won me over.  I have been on a few occasions, both special and random!  As mentioned in the other reviews the decor has not changed a bit.  It still boasts weird pictures hanging on the wall of some unnamed man (hmmm? Mr. Durant himself)!? I always opt for the bar area weather having dinner or not.  I'm not one for big dining rooms and don't mind eating at the bar, especially with the excellent service the bartender offers.  This is a favorite among my friends for birthdays, happy hours, and of course Valentine's Day! (with your friends or your significant other:) My favorites on the menu: garlic mashed potatoes, fillet mignon, scallops, and all of the salads.   Go, dine, enjoy it is worth the extra dollars:)

DHDVJZqL4Dn_d_Susx1cvw.text: It's hard to write something new about this Phoenix landmark. It is great, the food is delicious, the service is old school class with modern charm. Everyone has their spot when asked where is their favorite place to eat, and Durant's has no competition for me. If you are going for a special occasion, make sure to mention that when making a reservation...

0K--a0bzf2bx-VgZqL1gNw.text: Delicious food and top-notch service. Very old school, and not much of a younger crowd (it's pricey) but completely worth it. We came here for an anniversary meal (if 15 months counts as an anniversary?) and loved it but were stuffed afterwards. I would seriously suggest fasting before dining here! You're given veggies and ranch to start, along with some super-creamy bread with garnish. Many meals come with a soup/salad and side so it's a lot of food altogether. I had the 8oz filet and mashed potatoes, with a Caesar salad. The steak and potatoes were perfection. The Caesar salad was standard. Also had some good red wine with the meal. I don't know how anyone could have room for dessert after eating here though! It's a unique dining experience, and especially cool that you enter and exit through the kitchen. Servers are sweet and not at all stuffy. Classy atmosphere. No cell phones are allowed (except in the lounge) and there's an awesome footnote on the menu that if you don't see your fave foods on there, you can ask and they'll do their best to prepare them for you- what?? Pretty awesome.

wyE5NLNvTndUt4XbVDUW-A.text: We have eaten here twice. Both times for husband's birthday. Steaks live up to their reputation. Old school charm. Would have liked a little more attention from waiter on second visit. But it was crazy busy. It is expensive. Love the bathroom settee and pay phone. Great Martinis. How the kitchen crew puts up with the traffic is beyond me... as I have been in food and beverage industry for over 40 years and the kitchen is our sanctuary! Kudos and will see you again soon.

XCpJLh9iHIdSsxwBXa0Mzw.text: Going to Durant's is like stepping back in time where the lighting was a bit darker, the booths leather, and the wallpaper a dark red with velvet. You get to the restaurant by walking through the kitchen which starts off your experience. You don't see many people on their cellphones and you can even find a pay phone in the restaurant.  Durants reminds me of dinner my mom use to talk about how they would last a bit longer. Your appetizers were brought out and you didn't get your salads until you were finished so expect to spend some time. People here are enjoying the slower pace and the extremely attentive wait staff and having fun talking to each other.  They start you off with some raw vegetables and then bring you this garlic bread that's covered in butter ( delicious).  We ordered the calamari as an appetizer which was very good, the breeding was very light and the calamari cooked perfectly. My friend and I both got the prime rib which was cooked perfectly and it was so easy to cut. We both got the garlic mashed potatoes and shared a side of asparagus which came with a delicious hollandaise sauce. The horseradish sauce was great as well. I opted to pay a little extra and get the Cesar salad which was good but their house salad looked perfect with dark greens (not typical ice berg). We shared the creme brulee for desert where you get a sample of three kinds; an amaretto, berry, and a chocolate. My favorite was the amaretto  This is a great place to go and experience but keep in mind the prices reflect the quality of food they are set of but it's well worth is from time to time

nyj9Pn2yuBZ4dEWY4T56Vw.text: ***Updated 3/9/16 I received calls from the owner and manager to apologize for our experience. They were very kind and wanted to make it right. If they care this much about what one person says I am sure what happened was not a common occurrence. We will indeed be back.***  I must say that I really enjoyed the food, it was cooked to perfection. My wife and I celebrated our anniversary there on 3/2/16. My only gripe is that it didn't feel special. Our waiter did not speak much to us and didn't offer any recommendations and once he knew we were not ordering alcohol, it was hard to get another drink option. It felt like we were a burden. Having said that I am glad we went to such a historic location. Not sure if we will be back, other Stake Houses have treated us much better. I still tipped over 20% because there are other staff that were more pleasant and wanted to be sure they were taken care of.

qUbqc6h2lptrIgGipv-kew.text: This was always my favorite. I hadn't been there in years and went in for an early supper with a friend last week. It is as beautiful as ever and the wait staff is exceptional as always, but the food wasn't even remotely close to what it used to be. We spend 100$ for a light lunch/supper break. We ordered a side of broccoli with cheese on it and was brought out some microwaved broccoli (under cooked ) with a SLICE OF AMERICAN CHEESE ON TOP. I was stunned. The cheese wasn't even completely melted as the last culinary slap in the face. For what we paid, that should have been seasoned broccoli with grated craft cheese and maybe some pinon nuts or something nice. I was so embarrassed as I had talked this place up to my friend before I took her in. Beautiful ambiance, nice place maybe to have a cocktail, but the food is no longer worthy.

7rqehnXQqCTLmPVxhHRi4w.text: Came to Durant's with friends because we heard that it was one of the best in Phoenix. If this is True, it doesn't bode well for Phoenix. I didn't challenge the staff as I had to catch a red eye to the east coast. --- Overall, it was very expensive for what we got.   The food - Salad was good. My 8 oz filet mignon was ordered medium rare and arrived medium well. Amid a tight travel schedule, I accepted it although it was cooked dry. My friends seemed happy with scallops and shrimp pasta. The pasta dish was just wastefully big.   The wine - 2010 Cervantes was great value at $40. (Store price in generally in the mid-30s)   Service - So so. Basically okay, but not pleasant.

nuNYpsyH4DUOhUofylsSuw.text: Went to Durant's tonight for 30th wedding anniversary. Durant's never fails. The food and service was top notch. My wife had the Prime Rib, I had the Strip. Both cooked to perfection. I want to give a big shout out to our waiter Dave. Super professional and knowlegable. Thanks Dave for taking care of us. Thanks to the kitchen for making great food.

Ham7nIfxIIkrziRbuyLOKQ.text: This restaurant has such a cool old school vibe, love how you walk into the kitchen to go to the hostess stand. I love the shrimp scampi, I haven't had better. Their cheesecake is another favorite of mine. Love coming to dinner here.

RENRKpb-hKgq2O60lKc-Lw.text: Hands down the best food the best service and the best Ambiance in Phoenix. Kevin was an outstanding server we felt like he was our best friend anything we wanted he did for us. Chris the manager was so accommodating. I think it was Paul the bartender another outstanding person. Not kidding the greatest restaurant I've been to in a long time well worth the money. Thank you for making our anniversary spectacular Dan and Bette Schultz

fh2ZdK9tXoxIJJ81eOtvkg.text: I took my boyfriend here for his birthday. After hours of research, I knew Durant's was the best choice. I'm sure there are a lot of great steak restaurants in Phoenix but this added the old school experience. I ordered the prime rib, rare. The best steak I've ever had. He ordered the ribeye - wow, amazing. The waiter brought out a surprise dessert for his birthday. A great experience! They really care about you here. I highly recommend!

Ejcw4ABUS8zCTIrTBnRjmQ.text: Very disappointing.  We went here for a special occasion and notified them of this when we made reservations but this was forgotten.  When you park in the rear of the building you have to walk through the kitchen which is totally confusing and distasteful considering the high prices they charge.  Hard to figure out where to even check in as no one seemed interested in our arrival.  Wait staff was mediocre at best, food quality was meh and the prices way out of line with the value provided.  The atmosphere is drab as they have not decorated since Phoenix was established as a city.  If you plan to take your special someone out and spend some big cash on a dinner avoid this place.  We will not be back. Extremely disappointed.

Q51SU3OK8L7uHci-dr-eig.text: What a wonderful dining experience. I'm here with my brother and his sons having watched baseball alkyl day. It was busy but we seeded seated promptly. The waiter was highly competent - I didn't expect him to entertain me out to have graduated first on his class from charm school. I expected someone who knew the menu, the good, the drinks and the menu. He did all superbly. The meat was better than I've ever experienced. All The additional foods - like relishes, bread -were good to great. Criticisms by others involve the 1960s atmosphere. Why is this an issue? That's poppycock. Great evening at Durants; try it. Now.

c962NpiR_GsDZNt0A2oTqw.text: Our first time dining out in Phoenix and so glad we chose Durant's!  Absolutely love the Man Men retro vibe.  My steak was cooked perfectly and the scallops my wife enjoyed we amazing!! Had the pasole as a starter and it was excellent.  We are moving to Phoenix and we will make this restaurant a monthly choice.  Bravo!!!

MaqtejjDUMN1QWOrWet5Yw.text: What do you get when you eat at Durant's? Atmosphere. Dark leather, heavily padded seating. Low lighting. Dark wood. Elements that would look appropriate in a Frank Sinatra film. It had a very 60's feel to it.   What you won't get: is easy entry/exit, or food and service to match the prices.   There are two entrances: the front is on a narrow sidewalk adjacent to a busy street on the opposite side of the building from parking, which is in the back. The parking is shared with other popular businesses, and is inadequate for demand. Upon arriving at 6 pm, the only slots available were held by the valets. There is no proper roundabout for valet service, with entrances from two streets interfering with traffic. Valets sometimes had to perform two and three point turns to get vehicles into the parking traffic lanes.   The main entrance is through the rear, which leads through the kitchen. This may be cute as an uncommon entrance for special customers, but seems ill advised as the primary entrance for all customers.   We were greeted politely, and seated quickly for our reservations, made just an hour before hand.   The service was good, but not excellent. The server himself was very friendly when facing you, but a little too curt. He cut off his sentences about 1/2 second too soon, always turning quickly to scurry away. He might have been overworked, serving four tables in approximately the same state of ordering/eating as our table. His assistant was more attentive and more pleasant, even though she was trying to be discreet: avoiding eye contact and being almost mute. She earned the tip.   The food was good, but not excellent. I had a bone-in rib-eye, with garlic mashed potatoes and a seafood bisque. The bisque was good, but unremarkable. The garlic mashed potatoes were the least impressive of any I've had in any restaurant. Better fare is available on this item from Texas Roadhouse. The steak was well trimmed, and cooked medium with a well controlled char, with a minimum of spices. It was good, but examples from The Keg are better. Oh, how I miss Monti's steaks.   My wife had prime rib, medium, with loaded potato and salad. The prime rib is in the bottom 1/4 of all I've experienced. A cafeteria provided by a former employer served better prime rib on average. Again Monti's won out in this category. Examples from Lawry's were also better.   The best item on the table was a side: the loaded baked potato. It appears to be a rendition of a twice-baked potato: the starchy interior is mashed, accompanied by bacon, cheese, and sour cream, and re-baked in the bottom half of the potato shell. It could be a little more creamy (Idaho native here), but the taste was good.   The signature "leeks sauteed in butter over bread" was the 2nd best item.   Several restaurants serving more traditional fare have closed in Phoenix in the recent past: Monti's, Pinnacle Peak, etc. The owners say that the restaurant public is moving on to new fare: lighter/more healthy foods, new menu items. This restaurant represents a conceptual and literal link to the past: it is a low slung, small building. Literally across the street are much newer sky scrapers with shining, mirrored exteriors. This building lives in their shadow. The customers seemed to be from the same era the restaurant came from: most were grey/white haired and Caucasian.   So to summarize: If you wanna feel like a (mob) gangsta, or want a piece of the past, eat here. But know you can have better food for 1/2 the price elsewhere.

XulYP04s46DegqZzpCj41Q.text: I've GOT to give this Phoenix restaurant landmark another shot. First (and only) experience was far less than impressive. My steak was over cooked (ordered Medium) and the bartender/server was far too busy to check on us...not even once. Hell, I couldn't even get his attention when/if I wanted it.   My expectations were so high! When I pay a premium for food, I sorta expect premium in return. Will chalk it up to a bad night.

M-O7Qt6zbrXlLwN4b4yKIg.text: Durant's is heaven. From the time you walk in (through the kitchen) you receive incredible service and a great atmosphere. I've had everything from their steak, crab Louie salad and oysters to their dirty martinis and desserts. There isn't a single thing that won't blow your mind. The only reason I did four instead of five stars is it's pretty expensive so unfortunately I can't afford to go as often as i'd like!

2uV3nAdfZWStBudWHyg43g.text: I'd love to give Durant's five stars because it does so much right.  It gets soooo close to "hitting for the cycle," but its home run--the steak--falls a tad short...   The unassuming exterior of Durant's is charming, in a way, especially when contrasted with the classic interior.  Velvet red decor, nostalgia captured liberally in framed pictures, power-lunch seating layout, a lovely wrap-around bar, adult-worthy martinis, a great wine list, and exceptional service.  It's just, the steaks...  You can walk into Durant's from the boring front door or through the rear, which takes you through the kitchen proper and to the hosting booth.  The kitchen would be right at home in a 1930's NYC spot, and it is oddly appetizing to see how the sausage is made.  I just wish, ugh, the steaks...  Every meal is preceded by bread, on the house.  It's round, has a dense exterior and soft interior, and is drowning in a rich oil rife with garlic and parsley.  It's quite a nice freebie for a steakhouse.  Have one or two of their epic martinis, some bread, and tell them to take their time on the main course.  Which will probably be their steaks....  If you want the full monty, take them up on their Oysters Rockerfeller or Stone Crab Claws.  The latter is flown in from southern Florida and quite lovely (though pricey).  Plus it's a model for sustainability:  the crabs are caught, the crabs are relieved of their burdensome claws, and the crabs are returned to the ocean where they will regrow those claws.  It's kind of a feel good way to eat crab meat, which combines so well with steaks.  Speaking of their steaks...  Did i mention that their desserts are phenomenal?  Doh, okay, I'll address my complaint about their steaks.  I've been many times, and have tried the range:  filet, ribeye, t bone, porterhouse, prime rib, etc.  Of them, my favorite was the prime rib, and that is the issue.   Every other cut should be superior to the prime rib.  I'm simply not convinced that Durant's is sourcing the best cuts.  The top flight of national steakhouses--and by virtue of price, Durant's intends to compete with them--source delectably marbled, prime steak.  And you can tell when eating it.  But Durant's doesn't seem to.  The steaks are generally dry and indistinguishable from something you could get at a mid-range grocery store, or at an otherwise fine restaurant that does not focus on steaks.  Those found at A-team alternatives (Mastros, Ruths Chris, Capital Grill, etc.) are consistently top notch, regardless of preparation technique.  Don't get me wrong, you wont confuse Durant's with the leather served at Applebee's, but I suspect you will question whether your steak was worth $45.  The prime rib is juicy, meaty, with a well-season crust, and very satisfying with au jus and creamy or raw horseradish.    Durant's gets A marks in all categories but one -- and the miss is in that most important category.  If you're into prime rib, it's all A's, no question.  If you're not, I recommend going elsewhere for your steak.  I didn't elaborate on lunch, but it may be the way to go.  Come in for a martini lunch on a weekend and try the prime rib or a steak sandwich as the main.  All the frills without the price tag of a choice steak masquerading as prime.  That sounds harsher than it's meant to be because Durant's is an experience worth having, but temper your steak expectations.

Q3fK4lBclpJ3B6dlz-8WkA.text: Filet mignon and scallops were on point. Thick cut, dry aged beef. Not the best steak of my life, but very good and well cooked. One of my three scallops was still quite sandy, which was disappointing in a restaurant where you would expect a better food preparation. 4 stars on steak, 2 stars on scallops. The garlic mashed potatoes had too much butter and cream in them for my liking, making the consistency and texture a little too smooth and pasty. Good flavor still, but probably only ate 3-4 bites out of a VERY good sized portion.   The Manhattan clam chowder was perhaps the best I've ever had. Tons of clam meat, perfectly cooked potato, and a nice thick (but not too heavy or rich) broth. 5 stars on the soup!  The bread was amazing. Great texture and the dipping sauce was fantastic. Hate filling up on bread, but I did have two pieces. :-) 5 stars  Had a piece of key lime pie for dessert. Had a much more subtle, subdued flavor than I usually find with key lime, which I appreciated, as it can often be too tart to really want to eat the whole slice. Very smooth custard ended up having a texture more like a good cheesecake, but still with good citrusy flavor from the lime. Would have liked a tad thicker base crust, but I'll give it 4.5 stars!  All in all, it is one of the more expensive places I've been from an entree standpoint. $75 for an 8 oz and 3 scallops? It better be dynamite. It was very good, but maybe not enough for me to come back, considering the higher price compared to Mastro's, Capital Grille, et al. But my mouth is happy, so I'll give it 3 stars.

MVwF6H7G1lw4w_txFKB3CQ.text: Had lunch yesterday and their specials are still outstanding. I enjoy the decor very nostalgic and reminds me how things have changed with the new restaurants. Great service good drinks and a great place for a business lunch or special occasion.

K327-AS5gJ8o5QQNnwIddw.text: great place "old school" style great steaks and atmosphere fun times for sure.

Qz5fAmz9d8mJ1lMwDhgMxw.text: Wonderful food, service, and atmosphere. I will most definitely be coming back to this gem. It's an old school steakhouse that is still hitting on all cylinders. I came here with 3 business associates, and all were universally satisfied with everything we had.

Cr_8olrOro8_YJ6JmniwZA.text: This place is amazing! Such a cool old skool vibe with fantastic food and outstanding service! The staff could not have been more on point with friendliness and professionalism. The calamari was so tasty followed but perfectly cooked steaks and THEN! Kenny our waiter surprised us with the most fruitilicious strawberry shortcake after we hesitantly denied dessert. Couldn't resist the mountain of fresh strawberries and cream!! Seriously, go to Durant's, ask for Kenny and prepare to be rolled out the door after a deliciously gluttonous meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

TYkFfFo8HVX35kMdPI0Ilg.text: This is a great location for a steak! My family has been celebrating special occasions here for years and we always get great service and great good! I strongly recommend the Delmonico!

0aCg0mJArNChBXLMDpM-Eg.text: The atmosphere is great here. Drinks are great. My steak was a little dry for my liking. The chicken picatta (sp?) did not blow me away. Side dishes were awesome. Overall, over priced for food quality but great service, atmosphere, and drinks.

TNph7vciR9hvND5oBwdL-A.text: Durant's is always a favorite in Phoenix.  Great steaks of several kinds & sizes.  Near-perfect cold water lobster.  Excellent old-time bar.  The atmosphere is that of a long-ago southwestern speakeasy/steakhouse, but with air-conditioning.  Don't miss this great classic eatery !  Rick

Pbxbn3es0P8tIJ8lXDPWLQ.text: Great ambiance and excellent service.    My wife and I were out for a nightcap and wanted to have a really good steak.    The Gentleman working the valet at our hotel Recommended Durant's.    We showed up at 10:20 and we entered through the back.   Walked straight to the kitchen which gave us a mobster feel.   Main Entrance you walk through the kitchen.  Brilliant!    The courtesy and proper way they wait on you is like none we've encountered before.  MARCELLO was AWESOME.   Our water stayed filled up and they even came out to change the napkin in which our water was set on because it had picked up moisture.    AWESOME.   At this point we were already loving the restaurant.   Figured we would a good steak and call it a night...    we shared a rib eye (medium).   It was the BEST STEAK I have ever had.     HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!   You will leave happy...   WE DID!

HF7uOhiUqq6xVh5lYaIepw.text: I brought my boyfriend and 2 other friends to Durant's this past Friday & we were all so excited as it's been a restaurant we've heard many things about. Let me just tell you the experience was terrible! The 4 pieces of steak that we ordered separately were disgusting. One was charred so black it was inedible, the others were cold. We ended up sending 2 back only to have a less than appetizing replacement... to top it off we ALL left the restaurant very sick and my boyfriend & 2 friends ended up getting food poisoning.  I did call the restaurant as soon as they opened and spoke with the manager - who was less than helpful other than to tell us that he will "pass the information on...." what's that supposed to mean?  A very expensive dinner with little to no help when we left as sick as we did! Unacceptable! I am utterly disgusted and upset with this whole experience and lack of help after getting food poisoning.

SEvPLTBnNFB_qKNqud9JgQ.text: We were in town, house shopping from the Seattle area. I came across Durant's on Opentable and booked it.

4H9CvcuMlU_LYbMrbAInrA.text: My favorite steak house in Phoenix..  has personality not like the big chains. the rib eye steak is marvelous and the prime rib is never a disappointment. The decor is the old school and the staff is always so friendly.. come through the back door and get the full experience. the martini is always a must have.

koVBY04Vv0Co32own06Fog.text: My bf and I went to Durant's last night for date night. We enjoyed everything and had a great time with delicious food and wonderful service!   The entrance is a little strange... is there 2? Maybe. Idk. We came in through the kitchen? I swear that's the entrance! We almost turned around but luckily someone caught us and told us we were in the correct spot, lol!   Our waitress was so sweet and accommodating! Our food was cooked perfectly! I recommend the spinach artichoke dip, the chicken piccata, sweet potato fries, au gratin potato's and cheesecake!   Durant's has been open since the 40's so it had a really cool vibe to it. It's a classy place but many people were comfy classy (it is Az after all)!   Definitely check out Durant's for your next date night!

dOpTFqFFTckt9NGBwyFwIw.text: Came here for my birthday this year. I have to say this was one of the best steaks I've had in a very long while. As my friend described it to me, it has a very 1950s/ratpack/mobster feel to it. The entrance is by the kitchen so you go through it before you enter the dining area. The dining area is a low lit area with booths. The booths have red leather couches and the tables are covered with white linen. The servers very attentive, most of the time I need to ask for a water refill but I felt like my water was refilled almost unnecessarily here when I had only drank a third of the glass. If anything it's a good thing.   The food here, in particular the steak, is exceptional. We got the Oyster Rocketfeller which were very generous portions. My friend go the filet and scallops and I got the bone in ribeye. Most of the time I actually don't get ribeye anymore because it's too fatty. Not the case here. It's incredibly well marbled but with very little extraneous fat. It was purely marbled cow attached to a piece of bone. Incredibly flavorful and done to order.   The steaks came with a small dinner salad and a side of your choosing. I got their waffle fries which were a little less crispy than I would have preferred but still good.   If you're in the market for exceptional steak and price isn't a concern definitely come to Durant's. Great steak at a great establishment. Terrific for a special occasion.

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bone in ribeye
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oysters Rockefeller
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fresh garlic bread

lzht5LB1hcL14-7QOieSZw.text: Fantastic steak, old school atmosphere and best of all...you enter through the kitchen...wow. Everyone was attentive to making us feel welcome and our waiter was top notch. If you want a great steak and are willing to pay some extra money to be pampered this is the place.

0U2eT5H-WEVyDn4IX7hlxw.text: Very old school, fancy + proper.   It felt pretty neat living the Goodfellas movie and walking in through the kitchen.   The staff was second to none.  Extremely kind and perfectly attentive.  Even the chefs say welcome and good bye as you walk past the grills. Waiter was extremely knowledgeable.  We even asked him questions about the surrounding city. The steak was fantastic.  I had an 8 oz fillet.  Cooked perfectly.  Absolutely mouthwatering. Lemon meringue pie was perfect for dessert. You'll spend a pretty penny but its definitely worth visiting.

XccdCbqhK2cskM_1TZQDlw.text: We were in town on business, and wanted a steak and baked potato specifically. Found Durant's on yelp and it did not disappoint. Old school look, perfect steakhouse on every way. Our server, Lorraine was very hospitable and non pretentious. We split a delmonico New York bone in steak and it was prepared perfectly and not over seasoned which is refreshing. With all of the sides and dessert it was the perfect proportions. Old school feel when you park in the back lot and walk through the kitchen. Will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

kjfKHcN40zyDx9zekQCWHg.text: I love "Old Style Steakhouses", always heard and wanted to try Durant's. We came partially for AZ restaurant week. I made the reservation for 7:00 on Saturday. When we arrived there was ample spaces for parking, no need for the valet service. Atmosphere was "Old school", great feel., busy, tables filled and moderately loud.  Our waiter Craig introduced himself, we ordered drinks while reviewing the menu. I took advantage of the AZ Restaurant week menu: A glass of Red Wine, House salad, 12 oz. Prime Rib w/Mash Potatoes, Chocolate Indulgence Cake and Coffee, all for $44 (good deal). My dining partners ordered the Shrimp Cocktail and shared the 48 oz. Porterhouse.   Service was a little slow in the beginning, long wait to take out drink order and then long wait to place our orders, but then picked up after we did finally order. Steaks were done to perfection (needs more seasoning though), mash potatoes (not good). Relish Tray, Garlic Bread, Salads were all good. Dessert was very good.  Service good, food good, definitely worth going for the experience at least once.

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 12 oz. Prime Rib w/Mash Potatoes
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. House salad
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 48 oz. Porterhouse

JkflEK61_Tjpym9UUq1guw.text: So, it's not bad by any means. Apparently it's a great dinner spot judging by it's other rave reviews and awards. We only ate lunch and kept it simple so I can't comment on the steaks and such which are probably amazing as I'm sure are the desserts. Four of us ate, sticking to sandwiches--the turkey and avocado bacon for me, different burgers for two of us, a Reuben for the fourth. The sandwiches weren't bad--mine was pretty, pretty good. I had a bite of the burger my wife ordered and like her, agree it was great beef (but the bun was stale and there weren't any toppings on it to write home about). For sides we had a variety (fries, sweet potato fries, potato salad). All were---fine. However, none were worth the $15-$20 they charged. The decor is, again, ,okay-- (like my dining companion in his 60s mentioned it looked like it hadn't changed since the day he was born). Valet parking is mandatory (but free). So, I suggest you stick to dinner and go all out with steaks, desserts, drinks and plan to drop a few hundred. It's not worth the price for lunch, really, with so many great choices in Phoenix.

wYy2f27xgbKAYNp9-RJh7w.text: Hands down, FOH to BOH is ALWAYS top-notch! Steak was absolutely perfect, service was even better.. Couldn't say more, Gail was amazing.. as always. No better way to celebrate my wife's Birthday than DURANT'S!

ibn65oFT9RxXJCkvnNdcEA.text: This is not your typical restaurant unless you go back 50 years.  It reminds me of the kind of places my parents would take us to as kids.  It was dark with red leather booths and all of the servers were career servers, not college kids working their first gig. Our server and the various busboys were exceptional.  We never felt rushed and they only came by to make sure the table was cleaned of dishes and we weren't in need of anything.    We ordered the stone crab and mussels appetizers.  The stone crab was just ok, seemed a little small but may have been out of season.  The mussels were exceptional!  For dinner we ordered the calf's liver and onion and the ribeye steak.  It's hard to find calf's liver but if your a fan this place does it right.  Thinly sliced and smothered in onions and bacon.  The ribeye was perfectly cooked and seasoned well.  Two things of note on the negative side.  This place is expensive!  The stone crab appetizer was $33.  Steaks ranged from $48 to $108.  Two Tito's vodka drinks at the bar were $18.  Having said that, this is quality dining where the atmosphere, service and the food is truly exceptional.  Then there was the hostess.  She was nasty.  Not to us but to the poor women that took us to our table.  She chastised her for not standing in the right place while we were ready to be seated.  She must have been an owner or a family member.  Other than that 30 second exchange the entire dining experience was fantastic.  Everyone should experience this place at least once!

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

rM9ocxvUADJNgYTZJIC5gg.text: Old School, oozing with class and a menu your grandpa would absolutely fall in love with.  Perfectly prepared steaks, check.  Ice cold oysters on the half shell with killer cocktail sauce: check.  Utterly fabulous sides like sauteed mushrooms and mashed potatoes: check.  Original and very retro decor make the entire experience worth the visit!

U1aVfvPXplGcTzyshlO7yg.text: I had dinner there on Monday night, and I have to admit that this place was wonderful!  There is a lot of history that has gone on here, but I won't attempt to try to write about that.  It's a charming restaurant.  I was a little concerned when the cab drive dropped me off in the rear.  I walked into the kitchen and they led me to the desk where the hostess was.  Apparently that's the correct entrance, because when I left, that's also the way they had me leave.  Kinda different.  The food and service was outstanding.  My waiter was wonderful.  He brought me out first a small vegetable platter.  It had celery, carrots, radishes, onions, and 3 huge black olives with ranch dressing to dip it in.    The Bread was HUGE and so yummy with garlic and butter running off of it.    I ordered the Ribeye steak and it was cooked to perfection.  I had a loaded baked potato to go with it.    All the desserts sounded awesome, but I was already stuffed to the max.  I definitely want to go eat here again.  Thanks to the Phoenix Yelper that told me about this place!  I highly recommend it!

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Pot Pie Soup......OMG...... best soup ever!
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lamb Chops, Mint Jelly, and Mashed Potatoes
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lady&#39;s Bathroom

2vC3KGTaKdmFNFOhRndSnw.text: We come here often because our experience has consistently been excellent.   Tonight, we were seated in the dining room near a large party.  As it turns out, the party became more and more rowdy.  I don't mind people having fun... and I tried not to let it bother me.   Our server came up and asked if we would like to move because of the noise.  At first, I said no.  After a moment, I realized maybe it would be a good idea.  The manager came over, apologized, and quickly moved us to another room.  Our server was able to follow us.  Service continued to be excellent.   The manager came by to insure that we were taken care of.  I'm impressed by the fact that the team at Durant's went above and beyond by offering to move us (without being asked) and following up in such a 'caring' and professional way.   We love coming here for the food, service, and a relaxed "on point" atmosphere. Not too many places provide this kind of experience on a consistent basis.  Good job, Durant's!  We will see you soon.

fBBxYA40lDBVuXXKIuNCQg.text: Yelp took down my 1st review for not "following the guidelines." They don't care about the truth. So i am revising my horrible experience.  I am giving this place a 1 star because they have gone down hill by disreguarding all approproate dress code attire. It doesnt matter how disrespectful the outfit may be.  This place has lost its class and still charges ridiculous prices.

s_ZW2EL-vFKbjTrkh45wtA.text: I was so impressed. I heard it was old school in decor and service and (mistakenly) thought it would be musty and stuffy. I was so wrong!  This place is hopping! And the steaks were peerless. Perfectly cooked. The maitre d' was personable and the waiter was fun and professional all at once. He clearly enjoyed his job. Noisy and busy and crowded but excellent anyway. We will be back!

lU2UkGV1Y25J83piZtuJxA.text: This place is always a favorite! Business lunch or a date night, it always is a great choice. The food here is top notch and you have to love the decor and entering through the rear to come through the kitchen. Bring your dessert token if you're lucky enough to have one like me for an amazing way to top off a meal!

pSWFMI5AADoh85UtNun9cQ.text: Probably one of the oldest restaurants still serving up quality food and a walk Into the restaurant from the kitchen unique. We came here for lunch and Governor Doug Ducey was there so we walked up to walk in and there stood secret service. Anyways I got the hot open beef mash potatoes and mixed veggies. It was okay, meat was tender I won't complain I love the ambience of the Resturant waitress and staff very attentive. Next time I might just stick to what I like best calamari and fish. The corn chowder soup was very good. It's a good experience with a $$$$ menu so be prepared and happy Eats! enjoy!

ySVBwpVqyyXbXNJU2SWOqw.text: Great old time staple in Phoenix. We were seated a little late but the service made up for it. The ribeye was the most tender cut I've ever had and I've had a lot of ribeye. It's a must go if you're looking for a good steak with an old mafia vibe.

BHoOpiTZRv-aU6yEWToQuA.text: Durant's is a household name in the valley when it comes to steakhouses and fine dining; unfortunately our experience for my moms birthday the other night left much to be desired despite the $250.00 bill.   Starting with the positives, the atmosphere and ambiance is absolutely lovely and wonderful. The red velvet walls, gorgeous old fashioned red booths, and the overall charm of the restaurant cannot be beat; you will not find any place like it. The traditional environment takes you back to the good old days and leaves you feeling relaxed. We had a reservation and did not have to wait at all. the table was ready for us right away. Our waiter greeted us promptly and took our drink orders which came soon thereafter along with the crudite platter of beautiful celery, carrots, onions, and olives (best olive I have ever had). We studied the menu for a while and then decided to go with the prime rib/side salad/garlic mashed potatoes, large filet mignon/side salad/twice baked potato, ribeye/chili/garlic mashed potatoes, and onion rings. Once we ordered our waiter brought us the leek and butter garlic bread which was outstanding...holy smokes I could eat that all the time. It all went downhill after that...  We waited and waited and waited for our food to arrive. We also were without drinks for a long time on multiple occasions (we were drinking water and diet cokes, so it wasn't a bar drink we were waiting for). Our salads and chili arrived and they were very mediocre. Oh well, we had enough bread to tide us over until our real meal came. We waited and waited some more and finally our meat arrived. The prime rib was cooked well, but it was so chewy and rubbery that it was pretty difficult to eat. I am a prime rib aficionado, and this was definitely lacking in flavor and texture. The filet mignon was WAY too done; it was overly charred and close to burnt and tasted awful. The twice baked potato was over done as well and was difficult to eat because it was too hard. The ribeye however got decent reviews, but wasn't anything to write home about. The garlic mashed potatoes were good as well, but they weren't anything fantastic either. However the onion rings were crispy and flavorful.   For the steep price tag and reputation of Durant's we were expecting greatness both in food and service, but we were extremely disappointed and left wanting more. We all decided that we would much prefer Ruth's Chris, Flemings, or Capital Grill next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Warm, traditional, and charming inside

THlwSZOebhGZoMR_VTH3Ag.text: This place is so classic. They told us that it opened in 1950 and hasn't changed since then. You by can tell the old school wallpaper and lounge chairs. Their record were kept very well. It really brings you to another decade. I love it!   The food was really good. They give you complimentary garlic onion bread before your meal. It was a must try. the bread was so soft and garlic sauce tastes just right. Our first order was the clam chowder. I don't think I've had any chowder better than this! So many clams in there and the flavor was on point. For our entrees, we got the Friday special of fried cod fish and chips, iron steak over cord salad, and the pastrami burger which was recommended by the waiter on the regular menu. I tried all of the entrees and my favorite was the pastrami burger. It was so meaty and I am a meat lover so it just hits the spot. Oh and the fries that come with it was so crunchy!! My second favorite was the fried cod, it melts in your mouth! My least favorite was the Cobb salad with iron steak. I don't know what about it I didn't like, maybe it was just because it was a salad.

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Garlic bread that comes with the table
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pastrami burger
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pastrami burger

cIg7xsXMB_BuJRCEI3rhBQ.text: Just had dinner here after a show and as always love this place one of my favorites!!! Its good to have a place that never disappoints with service A! and food. Yes, a steak house but you can't beat the ambiance and vibe no matter your age. This will always be one of my go to's.

ZpNcDcR4SKVeU6yap3Oufg.text: My husband and I came for our 15th anniversary. We were not disappointed.  It's a classic style steakhouse with vibes of days gone by. This is a historical place where many stories could be shared by the walls, if only they could speak. The entry through the kitchen adds to the ambiance as if it were a tunnel through time to the past. We pictured mafia families sitting in the round booths speaking softly about 'operations' in the dimly lit room. We ordered the Ribeye steaks as well as sauteed mushrooms to share. 18 ounces of tender meat grilled to order and perfection. The mushrooms are a generous serving - an entire bowl of scrumptious delight!! They were a wonderful addition to the already delicious meal.  It was all too much to consume for these two hearty eaters. We both asked for boxes to go home.  All in all, a very enjoyable experience.

Ff4DnDrx4gpNs4vQDQF8mg.text: My first time,  ilove how you enter the 5he kitchen, everyone was super nice ands the food..OMG they bring you this bread with leeks and butter... amazing

HIKqSn1EwwALnUyIvjlRlQ.text: Always good. My girl enjoys this place!  Go when you can!  I was there when they issued the 60 year anniversary coins which meant you get a free dessert as long as you bring the coin. Great idea!  Love Durant's!

0xN1BLhGly3Kc1Pg4yCREQ.text: This place was such an experience! I went here with my family for my mom's birthday and we were not disappointed.   What's really cool is that you walk in through the kitchen! Like the real, completely working kitchen. The chef's and waiters and everyone wave and say hello. I thought it was very unique and definitely added to the experience.   The interior gives off an old-fashioned, velvet walls, leather booth, old-timey gangster vibe. It's super cozy and you can tell the interior hasn't changed much in the many years they have been there.  When you first arrive, they bring cold vegetables and ranch for the table. They were very fresh and delicious! We ordered drinks - first, a classic gin martini with an olive. I'll admit it was too much for me, but my family enjoyed it! I ended up ordering a lemon drop and it was fantastic.   After you place your order they bring over delicious bread with olive oil and some kind of herb/vegetable topping. I ordered the Catfish, but my mom and grandmother each ordered the big ribeye, and our other guests had the liver and onions and a large Caesar salad. We all enjoyed our meals and everything was cooked to perfection! The sides are hearty and flavorful as well.   For dessert, we ordered the Creme Brulee trio and WOOOOOW. There was a chocolate one, a berry one, and a classic one that honestly tasted like butterscotch to me. They were all fantastic and it was a great way to end a meal.   The service was friendly and nice, and the whole experience was very classy and enjoyable. It's definitely a pricey place so expect to spend a little extra here! They were also very accommodating with my grandma and her wheelchair which was super great.

photos.caption: Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lemon Drop
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu!
Photo of Durant's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Interior

7WWvVP68vSlfF48-oLGmSw.text: Pricey but good place to go for special occasions. Traditional red plush seating and sterling service from waiters who harken back to the days when people took pride in their professionalism!  Of course, the meat is excellent and their strawberry shortcakes are dishes that remain in your memory. Still the best steak restaurant.

5mZ7KAz30S4FJIbbr5aOGQ.text: Love coming down here. Love the old school atmosphere and friendliness of the staff. Going in through the kitchen is the best!!!!

X2NhV6BF02x8UC-uPITZDA.text: The price vs quality is very bad. I was in for dinner on 1/21 and the ambiance was really pretty and nostalgic, unfortunately that's the end to anything positive. We ordered a shrimp cocktail to start and the shrimp were horrible. Rubbery pre-cooked shrimp. It was like biting into a chicken breast, not good.
